loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria is a 54-year-old married woman with four children who works hard to support her family. She is a housewife and her husband works in agriculture. Although the family works very hard, it can be difficult for them to afford the cost of their daughter’s education. This loan of $ 1000 will allow Maria to help Nofiana to contniue her studies. She will use the loan to pay for tuition, textbooks, and school supplies. Maria loves her daughter very much and In the future, Maria hopes to send all of her children to school.

loans.use: to pay for tuition, textbooks, and school supplies.

loans.name: Sobia

texts.en:
Sobia is 35 years old and the mother of two children, living with her spouse and children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

Her husband is a supplier, by profession, and he has supplied mineral water in his shop and also door-to-door for many years. Her husband offers mineral water to his customers. He has been feeding his family through the generated income from this supply of water.

Nowadays, the needs of his family suddenly increased and he does not have other sources to cope with these needs. So, he decided to expand his current business. He wants to increase his stock on a daily basis, so that he can maximize sales of the mineral water.

Therefore, Sobia requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can buy more stocks of mineral water bottles. Sobia thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more mineral water for her husband's mineral water shop.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is a 54-year-old married woman with six children, one child attends school. Corazon works very hard to provide for them by running a general store for 5 years.

She requests 13,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, eggs, bread, and snack foods.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, eggs, bread, and snack foods.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 59 years old and married with seven children. Jane works very hard to provide for them.

Jane runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, home product care, and other groceries. Jane has been in this business for 3 years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Jane would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Nemia

texts.en:
Nemia is a 53-year-old married woman with four children, all attend school.

Nemia has grown vegetables for 4 years and requests 4,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fertilizer, vegetable seeds, and other farm supplies.

She has previously borrowed 8 times to sustain her business.

She would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, vegetable seeds, and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen is a simple house wife who lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother with 4 children. Her husband is a professional rickshaw driver but his rickshaw is not working properly and he is unable to generate any income. Her husband wants to repair it as soon as possible but is unable to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw.

Parveen requests a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. Parveen thanks Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband repair his rickshaw.

loans.name: Wendy

texts.en:
Wendy is a mother of two children, ages 12 and nine years old. She and her family live in the town of Estancia, in Iloilo, Philippines. Her husband is a driver, while Wendy is running a sari-sari store business to earn a living.

Wendy has been doing this for almost 11 years. She is asking for a loan to help them enhance their livelihood by buying additional stocks for her sari-sari store business, such as biscuits, bread, chips, candies, chocolate bars, toiletries, laundry soap, sugar, coffee, powdered juice, soft drinks, noodles, and canned goods.

In the future, Wendy dreams to be successful in her business and to have enough money to provide for the needs of her children.

loans.use: to buy biscuits, bread, chips, candies, chocolate bars, toiletries, laundry soap, sugar, coffee, powdered juice, soft drinks, noodles, and canned goods.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 25-year-old married father with two children. He is a hard working man who had to quit school during the intermediate classes. He acquired motorcycle maintenance experience and started his own business in 2006.

His business provides income for his family, his wife takes care of her beloved family members.

He has worked hard to develop his business to make sure he can cover almost all of his family's necessary living needs and education costs.

Mohamad requests a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy necessary spare parts and accessories necessary to develop his current business.
He hopes to open a motorcycle warehouse and expand his business.

loans.use: to buy necessary spare parts and accessories.

loans.name: Sariya

texts.en:
Sariya is a 25-year-old single woman who is working hard to support her father and four family members. She is employed by a telemarketing and customer service company. She has four years of experience.

She now has a home-based business to sell accessories. She works hard to support her family and attends university to study business management.

Sariya is now in her third year and requests a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, to pay for her tuition for her business management degree.

She is looking forward to opening an accessories shop in the future to increase her income and improve her family's living.

loans.use: to pay for her university tuition fees.

loans.name: Semillas De Patuju Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “SEMILLAS DE PATUJU” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de German Busch, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Elizabeth es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de cosméticos y perfumes, venta de verduras, venta de comida, venta de mantas, venta de CD y DVD’s, venta de zapatos.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Elizabeth es integrante, ella indica que ingreso a Pro Mujer por una promoción de la institución, en su zona. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de cosméticos y perfumes; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su hermana hace más de dos años.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de cosméticos por mayor) que adquirirá de una empresa de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank group “SEMILLAS DE PATUJU” (SEEDS OF PATUJU) starts its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Centro Focal de German Busch. This group is made up of new members, and is directed by a board of which Elizabeth is the president.

The members of the communal bank run various businesses, including cosmetic and perfume sales, vegetables sales, food sales, blanket sales, CD and DVD sales, and shoe sales.

This loan will benefit the small businesses that make up the group where Elizabeth is an associate. She tells us that she joined Pro Mujer through a promotion given by the institution in her area.

Currently, Elizabeth runs a business of cosmetic and perfume sales. She learned this business form her sister more than two years ago.

The loan she is requesting is to increase her capital. With it, she will buy cosmetics in bulk from a company in the city of El Alto and then she'll sell them in her sales locale. As she's married and has two children, this type of work permits her to generate the means to support her family economically.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she enjoys the training that the institution offers.

loans.use: buy cosmetics in bulk.

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza has six children and works hard to support her family.

She has an oyster culture business and requests 19,000 PHP through NWTF to buy materials needed for her oyster culture business.

Analiza has sustained her business through 7 previous loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream which is to save money, expand her business, and send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy items for her oyster culture business.

loans.name: Hatem

texts.en:
Hatem is a 48-year-old married man from the city of Rafah city, which is located in the Gaza Strip. He is employed in the public sector and earns a low income which barely covers the family needs. He wants to make his family more comfortable and improve their standard of living. He requests a USD loan from FATEN to buy a solar system to heat water for the family's house.

Hatem will be able to decrease the electricity expenses, while using a cleaner form of energy (rather than gas). Hatem’s family will have an easier time heating water for showers, cooking, and washing clothes and dishes.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for the family's house.

loans.name: Elpedia

texts.en:
Elpedia is married with four children. Her oldest child is 11. Two of her children are still attending school. She resides in the town of Talibon, Bohol.

For almost six years now, Elpedia has been a fish vendor. She sells fresh fish like tulingan (mackerel tuna), galonggung (black fin scad), and many others. She would like to improve her earnings by means of bulk purchases of supplies. With those, she could able to meet the demands of her customers.

Elpedia has requested a loan to buy a variety of fresh fish. This will improve her earnings and she will able to continue to provide her family with basic necessities.

Elpedia hopes that someday she could able to continue financing the schooling of her children and her source of income will become sustainable as well.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fresh fish.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
Catalina is 63 years old. Her husband has already passed away.

For over sixty years Catalina was able to manage her farm that absolutely met the needs of her family. Until now, the farm has been doing well and has been giving enough cash flow to cover the family's day-to-day expenditures. With her generated revenue, she was able to save for their future needs.

Recently, Catalina took a new loan to purchase fertilizer, such as manure, to improve her farm. With the acquisition of in demand basic commodities, Catalina expects an increase in sales and an improvement the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure to improve her farm.

loans.name: Enalie

texts.en:
Enalie is a 41-year-old married woman with two school-aged children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Enalie has had an auto repair shop business for 5 years and requests 5,000 PHP through NWTF to buy spare parts, steel, and welding rods.

She would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts, steel, and welding rods.

loans.name: Adela

texts.en:
Adela is a 60-year-old single woman with two children who is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Adela has had a food vending business for 2 years and requests 12,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fish, spices, and meat.

Adela would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fish, spices, and meat.

loans.name: Theresia

texts.en: Theresia is business woman who requests a loan of $ 1,000.00 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business. She start a kiosk business  a year ago with her own capital of $ 150.00. She earns a good income and will use the loan to buy detergent, sugar, cooking oil, slippers, cigarettes, coffee, snack, biscuits, noodles, soft drinks and other items to sell.

loans.use: to buy detergents, sugar, cooking oils, slippers, cigarettes, coffee, snack, biscuits, noodles, including soft drinks, and other items.

loans.name: Evelin

texts.es:
Evelin es de la ciudad de Santaní, está cursando el segundo año de la Carrera Medicina, es una excelente persona, vive con sus padres es muy dedicada a su estudios.
Su sueño es terminar esta carrera y el día de mañana trabajar de forma independiente y enseñar en las Universidades.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por la oportunidad que esta recibiendo.
texts.en:
Evelin is from the city of Santani and is pursuing her second year in the career of Medicine. She is an excellent person. She lives with her parents. Evelin is very dedicated to her studies. Her dream is to finish this career and, in the future, work independently and teach in universities.

Evelin is asking for this loan to be able to pay her career fees and thus be able to continue with her studies as she has been doing. She is thankful for the opportunity that she is getting.

loans.use: to pay her career fees.

loans.name: Janneth

texts.en: Janneth is married and has eight children to provide for. She owns and operates farmland, planting and harvesting bananas to sell to their community just to earn a living. She has been in this business for more than six years. She's working hard just to earn more profit. With her generated income, she was able to maintain and sustain her farm and solely care for her family. Recently, she took a loan from GDMPC to purchase organic fertilizer in order to improve her farm. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her farm.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer in order to improve her farm.

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy is 38 years old and married with five children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Joy runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, bread, drinks, spices, noodles and other snack foods.

Joy has been in this business for two years.

In the future Joy would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, bread, drinks, spices, noodles and other snack foods.

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion is a 49-year-old married woman with six children, one attends school.

Salvacion has raised pigs for 4 years and requests 7,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, vaccines, and other supplies.

She has previously borrowed 8 times from NWTF to sustain her business.

She would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, vaccines, and other supplies to raise her pig.

loans.name: Yuli

texts.en:
Yuli lives in Oecusse and has had a business since 2012, which she started with her working capital of $ 200.00. She requests $ 1000.00 from Tuba Rai Metin to buy inventory supplies such as coffee, candles, salt, biscuits, noodles, cigarettes, water, soy, eggs, pens, umbrellas, scissors, razors, notebooks, and drinks.

She wants to open a big store in the future and this loan will help improve her management skills.

loans.use: to buy coffee, candles, salt, biscuits, noodles, cigarettes, water, soy, eggs, pens, umbrellas, scissors, razors,  notebooks, and drinks.

loans.name: Cresilyn

texts.en:
Cresilyn is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 38 years old and has three children who are currently in school.

Cresilyn has a fruit vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more fruits to sell to her customers.

Cresilyn has been in this business for 21 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits to sell to her customers

loans.name: Shirly

texts.en:
Shirly is a married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 40 years old and has four children who are in school.

Shirly has a buy-and-sell ready to wear business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy items to sell like pants, underwear, etc.

Shirly has been in this business for one year. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like pants, underwear, etc.

loans.name: Shehnaz

texts.en:
Shehnaz is a house wife with 2 children who lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband sells fruit (apples, bananas, and grapes). Her husband is responsible for feeding the entire family and managing the house hold.

Shehnaz's husband needs to purchase different types of fruit to increase the size of his business, improve his sales, and earn maximum profit. Her husband is not in the condition to purchase fruit for his business.

Shehnaz has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to purchase items for his business.

She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's fruit business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buy a variety of shoes and clothing.

loans.name: Nasiba

texts.ru: 37 летняя женщина Насиба. Насиба жительница города Турсунзаде. Она замужем и мать троих детей. Она живет вместе семьей. Ее муж в городе занимается мастером. Насиба сидя дома зарабатывает на жизнь. Она 10 летняя рукодельница. Насиба дома сделает ручной вышивки на заказ. Она хочет расширить свою деятельность. Насиба просит кредит для покупки больше ткани и других швейных принадлежности. С расширением деятельности увеличиться ежедневный доход. Она зарабатывает и помогает мужу кормить и одевать детей. Насиба верит в Вас и на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en: Meet Nasiba, a 37-year-old resident of the city of Tursunzoda.  Nasiba is married and the mother of three children.  She lives with her family.  Her husband works in town as a handyman.  Nasiba herself works from home; she's been a craftswoman for the past 10 years and she embroiders fabrics from orders received from her customers.  She wants to increase her activity, and for this reason she is taking a loan to buy more fabrics and other sewing supplies.  Her goal is to expand her activity, so that she can increase her daily income.  Thanks to the money that she makes, Nasiba helps her husband to feed and buy clothes for the children.  She relies on you and on your support.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and other sewing supplies.

loans.name: Hani

texts.en:
Hani is a 34-year-old married man from the city of Rafah which is located in the Gaza Strip. He is employed in the public sector and earns a low income which barely covers all the family needs. He wants to make his family more comfortable and improve their standard of living.

Hani took a USD loan from FATEN to buy a solar system to heat water for the family's house. Hani will be able to decrease the electricity expenses and use a cleaner form of energy (rather than gas). Hani’s family will have an easier time heating water for showers, cooking, and washing clothes and dishes.

loans.use: to buy a solar system.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en: Juliana is a 23-year-old Lebanese single woman living with her parents and five siblings. Her mother represents the main income source, and she benefits from her husband's pension salary. Her mother's only goal is to satisfy their family needs and improve their lifestyle. Today, with the aim of paying her study fees, she is applying for a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. In the future, she plans to take more Kiva loans to continue her education.

loans.use: to pay her study fees

loans.name: Jerelyn Joy

texts.en:
Jerelyn Joy is 24 years old and married with one child. She works very hard to provide for them.

Jerelyn Joy runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, bread, drinks, spices, noodles and other snack foods.

Jerelyn Joy has been in this business for two years.

She would like to save money to provide for and secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, bread, drinks, spices, noodles and other snack foods.

loans.name: Felomina

texts.en:
Felomina is a married woman with eight children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 54 years old and has three children who are in school.

Felomina has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy a variety of fish to sell.

Felomina has been in this business for one year. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fish to sell.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita is 47 years old and married with four children, with one child still in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Juanita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, bread, drinks, spices, noodles and other snack foods.

Juanita has been in this business for five years.

In the future Juanita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, bread, drinks, spices, noodles and other snack foods.

loans.name: Ma. Delma

texts.en:
Ma. Delma is a 29-year-old married woman with one child who works very hard to provide for them.

Ma. Delma has run a general store for 3 years and requests 8,000 PHP through NWTF to buy canned goods, beverages, home care products, and groceries.

In the future, Ma. Delma would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages, home care products, and  groceries.

loans.name: Rukhsana's Group

texts.en:
Rukhsana is a 38-year-old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of two sons and four daughters. Her son is a welder and provides welding services in his community. He manufactures iron accessories for doors and windows. He provides door-to-door services to weld the broken accessories.

His welding plant is out of order due to overheating and needs to be replaced. He wants to buy a new welding plant but he does not have cash.

Rukhsana requests a loan from BRAC and Kiva so that her son can buy a welding plant for manufacturing.

Rukhsana thanks Kiva and their field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a welding plant for her son's manufacturing business.

loans.name: Zeinab

texts.en: Zeinab is a 50-year-old married woman from Lebanon, living with her husband and three children, all of them are still attending school. Her husband owns an Internet café in his town. Today, she looks to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to pay her children’s educational fees. Definitely, this will help her to ensure them a good education path.

loans.use: to pay her children’s educational fees

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is an 18 year old Lebanese single man living with his parents and their four children, some of them are still attending school. His father and his oldest brother are the main income source in the family in order to fulfil the family needs.

Today, he is applying for a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to pay his Technical Educational fees. He states that this loan will help him to pursue a good educational level.

loans.use: to pay his Technical Educational fees.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema has applied for a loan of ugx2,000,000 is aged 49 years old and this is her first loan cycle from UGAFODE MDI. She is married and has four kids who are school goers. The kids are aged 22, 19, 16, 15 and 13 years old respectively.

She deals in groceries, banana farming and she has a room that is under construction. She works for 8 hours a day. She also gets incomes from the government as a teacher.

She started these businesses in 1999, so as to raise money to educate her children. She says she will use this loan funds to complete her house that is under construction. Her dream ideal is to educate her children and her main challenge is limited working capital. She is hard working and he says UGAFODE MDI staff has good customer care.

loans.use: to finish construction of her house by buying construction materials.

loans.name: Josedith

texts.en:
Josedith is a sari-sari store owner for more than eight years. She is married and a mother of three children ages 14, 13 and five years old. Her husband is a business man and works hard to provide the needs of their family. Josedith has been doing the sari-sari store business for eight years. She is asking a loan to buy assorted grocery items such as canned goods, spices, noodles, cooking oil, eggs, mosquito repellent, chips, biscuits, candies, sugar, powdered milk and chocolate drink, toiletries, laundry soap and soft drinks.

She also buys scrap to sell. Perhaps, she has other business to enhance their livelihood. In the future, she wishes to uplift their livelihood. In addition, Josedith and her family live in the town of Carles in Iloilo, Philippines.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, spices, noodles, cooking oil, eggs, chips, biscuits, candies, sugar, powdered milk and chocolate drink, toiletries, laundry soap and soft drinks; scrap

loans.name: Julian De Jesus

texts.es:
Julian es un joven de 17 años de edad, que a su corta edad tiene sus metas bien trazadas, entre ellas ser el mejor estudiante de la carrera de Ingeniería en Sistemas, desde el primer año. Con el apoyo moral y económico de sus padres, para él es más sencillo sentirse motivado en convertirse en uno de los mejores ingenieros del país, como él siempre lo ha soñado.
Para esto Julian sabe que debe tener todas las herramientas necesarias para no tener obstáculos durante su trayecto, razón por la cual solicita un préstamo para comprar una computadora, equipo tecnológico que le brindará la oportunidad de realizar todos sus trabajos en tiempo y forma. Esto le permitirá coronar cada año de su carrera con grandes honores. En sus metas está  culminar sus carreras y especializarse en otra rama más adelante.
texts.en:
Julian is a young man of 17 years of age, who at this young age has his goals figured out. Among them, be the best student in his systems engineer program, right from 1st year. With his parent's financial and moral support, it's simpler for him to feel motivated to become one of the best engineers in the country, just like he's always dreamed.

To do this, Julian knows he needs all the proper tools so as to remove all obstacles in his way. For this reason, he is requesting a loan to buy a computer; technological equipment that will provide him the opportunity to finish his work correctly and on time.

This will help him crown each year of his studies with honors. HIs goals include finishing his degree and specializing in another branch of engineering further on.

loans.use: buy a computer.

loans.name: Farruh

texts.ru: Фарруху 36 лет. Он женат и у него пятеро прекрасных детей. Когда он еще был маленьким, они с отцом ухаживали за своим садом дома и ему это очень нравилось. С тех самых пор, Фаррух мечтал вырастить свой большой сад. Прошло уже много времени, и на данный момент у него есть огромный сад, где он выращивает разные сорта яблок. Это является основным доходом в его семье. Так как его деятельность сезонная, в семью доход поступает не полный год. У Фарруха очень большая семья, с ними живут еще его пожилые родители и он должен позаботиться о все них. Фарруху еже много лет не удается накопить на установку капельного орошения сада. Это бы ему очень облегчило работу. Поэтому Фаррух обратился в Арванд в надежде, что МДО Арванд окажет ему финансовую поддержку. За ранее благодарит за поддержку и доверие.
texts.en:
Farruh is 36 years old.  He is married and the father of five beautiful children.  When he was still a child he really enjoyed working with his dad in their garden and he always dreamed of having his own orchard one day.  Many years have passed and Farruh now has a large orchard where he grows several varieties of apples.  This activity constitutes the family's main source of income.  However, this is a seasonal activity and Farruh doesn't get an income year round.

Farruh has a very large family (his elderly parents live with him), so he needs to take care of everyone.  For many years he has tried to save enough money to install a drip irrigation system in his orchard because it would make his work much easier, but he hasn't been able to gather enough money.  For this reason, he has turned to Kiva's partner, MDO Arvand, hoping that they will offer some financial support.  He thanks you in advance for your support and trust.

loans.use: to install an irrigation system in his orchard.

loans.name: Gabriel Eduardo

texts.es:
La pasión por los negocio llevaron a Gabriel a decidir estudiar la carrera de Comercio Internacional, teniendo la opción de aprender de distintas empresas a nivel global para un mejor desempeño profesional. A sus 26 años de edad, está finalizando su licenciatura y cerrando con broche de oro con un posgrado en Comercio Internacional, por lo que se siente preparado para cualquier trabajo. 
Hace seis meses debutó en su primer trabajo, donde ha podido poner en práctica lo aprendido, todo con el apoyo moral y económico de su madre, lo que lo motiva aún más a salir adelante. Estando Gabriel a unos cuantos pasos para concluir con esta etapa importante en su vida, decidió solicitar un préstamo para cancelar su posgrado, pues no quiere interrumpir su aprendizaje en ningún momento. Obtener este título le permitirá tener ventajas en el mercado laboral y tener mayores posibilidades de un mejor empleo. En sus planes está trabajar en una agencia comercial de prestigio, donde pueda contribuir en su crecimiento, personal y profesional.
texts.en:
Gabriel's passion for business brought him to the decision to study for a degree in international business, giving him the option of learning from a variety of businesses at the global level so that he can become a better professional.  At 26 years of age, he is successfully concluding a graduate degree in international business so that he will be prepared for any job in this area.  

Six months ago he started in his first job, where he has put his education into practice.  He has done all of this with the moral and financial support of his mother, who has motivated him even more to get ahead.  

As Gabriel is just a few steps short of concluding this important stage in his life, he has decided to request a loan to pay off his degree so that he will not have to take any time off from his studies.  

Once he obtains this degree, he will have an advantage in the labor market and will have better work possibilities.  Among his plans are working in a prestigious commercial agency, which would contribute to his growth at the personal and professional level.

loans.use: to pay for his graduate studies

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es:
Jorge es de la ciudad de Paraguarí, continua con sus estudios en contabilidad, por medio de su carrera quiere poder ayudar las demás personas y también a sus seres queridos con todo el conocimiento que haya adquirido. Comenta que su préstamo anterior lo uso en poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, lo cual le fue de mucha ayuda.
Hoy pude este nuevo préstamo para poder cubrir de vuelta sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Jorge is from the city of Paraguarí and is continuing his studies in Accounting. Through his degree, he wants to be able to help other people and also his loved ones with all of the knowledge that he will acquire. Jorge says that with his previous loan he was able to pay his degree fees, which was a great help.

Today Jorge is requesting a new loan so that he can cover his fees once again.

loans.use: to pay his university fees.

loans.name: Famille Luyeye Group

texts.fr: Il y a de cela 30 ans que Luyeye a planté ce caféier. Il en reconnaît les bienfaits car il lui a permis de scolariser ses enfants. Souvent buté aux difficultés d'entretien, il a beaucoup d'espoir quant au fait que ce crédit lui permettra d'y répondre afin d'améliorer sa production ainsi que d'éviter de prendre d'autre crédit ailleurs. Sa femme Françoise l'accompagne sur la photo.
texts.en: Luyeye has been planting coffee plants for 30 years. He recognizes the benefits because it allowed him to school his children. Often struggling with maintenance difficulties, there is a lot of hope due to the fact that this loan will allow him to respond to them in order to avoid taking other loans elsewhere. His wife Françoise accompanies him in the photo.

loans.use: maintain a coffee field

loans.name: Lenner Antonio

texts.es:
La versatilidad de la carrera de Administración de Empresas fue la principal característica que le llamó la atención a Lenner, un joven de 25 años de edad, que desde su adolescencia se vio atraído por el mundo de las empresas. Con el apoyo es económico de su padre y de su propio trabajo como responsable de bodegas, le ha permitido llegar hasta la última etapa de su licenciatura en Administración de Empresas.
A un solo paso de cumplir con esta meta importante de su vida, Lenner desea no tener ningún obstáculo para finalizarla, por lo que solicita un préstamo para pagar su curso de titulación y así poder obtener su diploma como licenciado en Administración de Empresas y obtener un mejor trabajo donde pueda crecer más profesionalmente. En sus planes está terminar su carrera y buscar un mejor empleo donde pueda ayudar más económicamente en su hogar.
texts.en:
The versatility of the Business Administration major was the main attribute that caught Lenner's attention. Now 25 years old, he has been attracted to the business world since he was a teenager. With the financial support of his father plus his own job as a warehouse manager, he has been able to make it to the last phase of his undergraduate degree in Business Administration.

Just one step away from fulfilling this important life goal, Lenner does not want any obstacles to stop him from finishing. That is why he is requesting a loan to pay for his degree course so that he can obtain his Business Administration diploma and get a better job where he can grow more professionally. He plans to finish his degree program and look for a better job where he will be able to help more financially at home.

loans.use: to pay for his degree course.

loans.name: Fathuddin

texts.ru: "Ничто никогда не поздно начать" с таким девизом 56 летний мужчина из района Фархора с именем Фатхуддин идет по жизни. Он решил начать новый бизнес в сфере животноводства. Он купил одного теленка и вырастил его и понял, что он сможет взяться за такую работу. Фатхуддин планирует получить кредит, построить коровник, купить корма и еще несколько голов бычков и телят. Он верит, что ему помогут, и ему способствует удача:)
texts.en: It's never too late to start something." Fathuddin, a 56-year-old man from the Farkhor region, goes through life with this motto in mind. He has decided to start a new animal husbandry business. He bought one calf and raised it and realized that he could make a go of this kind of work. He plans to take out a loan so he can build a cow shed and purchase feed and a few more head of steers and calves. He trusts that he will receive assistance and that he will find success. :)

loans.use: to build a cow shed and purchase feed and cattle

loans.name: Zamirakhon

texts.ru: Замирахон женщина в возрасте 35 лет проживающая в сельской местности. Как и многие сельские жители она занимается разведением скота. Животноводством Замирахон начала заниматься после замужества,  чтобы помочь  мужу  содержать семью. Постепенно она набралась опыта и расширила свое стадо. Замирахон покупала молодой скот и немного откормив продавала  его за более высокую цену. После смерти мужа ее бизнес стал основным источником дохода для ее семьи, а она единственным кормильцем. Ей приходиться трудится каждый день, чтобы обеспечивать семью.  На данный момент Замирахон испытывает трудности с финансами и ей необходима поддержка. Из за низкой цены она не может продать скот который откормила. С данной проблемой она решила обратится в «АРВАНД» за поддержкой. На полученные деньги Замирахон хочет купить корм для скота и молодой скот.
texts.en: Zamirakhon is a 35-year-old woman who lives in a rural area. Like many people who live in rural areas, she raises livestock. She started in the livestock business after she got married, so that she could help her husband take care of the family. Slowly she gained experience and increased her herd. Zamirakhon bought young animals, fattened them, and then sold them for a higher price. After her husband’s death, her livestock business became the main source of income for her family, and she is the sole breadwinner. She has to work hard every day to support her family. Zamirakhon is currently having financial difficulties and she needs support. She isn’t able to sell livestock that she fattened due to low prices. She decided to turn to Arvand for help with her problem. Zamirakhon wants to buy feed and young livestock with the money she receives.

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Ishrat Bibi

texts.en:
Ishrat Bibi is the age of 33, the mother of three children, living with her spouse and children in the area of Multan, Pakistan. Her husband owns a animal farm business for the last ten years, where he sells different kinds of animals.. He prefers quality instead of quantity from his animal farming business. He has been feeding his family through the generated income from this animal farm business.

Nowadays, the needs of his family suddenly increased and he does not have other sources to cope with these needs. So he decided to expand his current business. He wants to increase his livestock so that he can maximize sales out of the business. Therefore, Ishrat Bibi requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can buy more animals for sale.

Ishrat Bibi thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy animals for her husband

loans.name: Yawa

texts.fr: Mariée et mère de cinq enfants, Yawa est une femme âgée de 45 ans résidant à Tokoin. Yawa est une marchande de produits d’alimentations générales qui achète ses marchandises quatre fois par mois au marché et le revend là. Yawa sollicite ce prêt pour commander des cartons de spaghettis et de laits en vue de stocker une plus grande quantité de marchandises puis maximiser son profit afin d’aider son mari dans l’éducation de ses enfants et aux charges quotidiennes éprouvées par la famille.
texts.en: Married and the mother of five children, Yawa is a 45 year-old woman living in Tokoin. Yawa is a merchant of general food products. She buys her merchandise four time per month at the market and resells it there. Yawa requests this loan to order cartons of spaghetti and milk with the aim of stocking up on a larger quantity of merchandise. Then she can maximize her profit in order to help her husband with the education of her children and the daily needs experience by the family.

loans.use: buy 2 cartons of spaghetti and 4 cartons of milk.

loans.name: Ana Erika

texts.es:
Ana es reconocida por su pasión al trabajo como analista, en el cual lleva más de ocho años ejerciendo, luego de haber estudiado por cuatro años la carrera de Administración de Empresas. No obstante, esta madre de cuatro hijos menores de edad, no se da por vencida de obtener su título de licenciada, por lo que a sus 41 años de edad, desea llevar a cabo su curso de titulación. 
Ella cuenta con el apoyo económico y moral de su esposo, por lo que se siente motivada de solicitar un préstamo para pagar su curso de titulación y así convertirse en Licenciada en Administración de empresas, y poder optar a un mejor puesto, siempre acorde a su profesionalización. En sus planes está trabajar mucho para servir de ejemplo en el espacio de negocios.
texts.en:
Ana is known for her passion for her work as an analyst, in more than eight years of experience following four years of study in a Business Administration program. However, this mother of four young children has not given up on completing her undergraduate degree, so at the age of 41, she wants to complete her degree course.

She has the financial and moral support of her husband, which makes her feel motivated to request a loan to pay for her degree course and thus obtain her degree in Business Administration. This will allow her to seek a better position, appropriate to her level of training. Her plans include working hard to serve as an example in the business world.

loans.use: to pay for her degree course.

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr: Agée de 37 ans, Akossiwa est une femme mariée qui vit à Tokoin. Ayant cinq enfants à charge, Akossiwa est une femme qui se bat pour l’épanouissement de ses enfants en préparant de la bouillie accompagné faite à base du maïs et accompagner des gâteaux faites à base de la farine de blé. Akossiwa demande ce prêt pour commander des sacs de maïs, du sucre et des bols de la farine de blé. Avec la marge bénéficiaire qui en résultera, Akossiwa va pouvoir répondre favorablement aux besoins de ses clients et avoir ainsi une autonomie financière considérable pour aider ses enfants dans leur éducation.
texts.en: 37 years old, Akossiwa is a married woman who lives in Tokoin. Being responsible for five children, Akossiwa is a women who fights for the thriving of her children by preparing corn porridge for babies, accompanied by cakes made from a base of wheat flour. Akossiwa asks for this loan in order to buy bags of corn and sugar and bowls of wheat flour. With the resulting profit margin, Akossiwa is going to be able to respond favorably to the needs of her customers and thus have considerable financial autonomy to help her children with their education.

loans.use: buy 1 bag of corn, 10 bowls of wheat flour, and 1 bag of sugar.

loans.name: Katherine Belen

texts.es:
EL Grupo De Crédito Calle América se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía, que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive la señorita Katherine, tiene 21 años de edad, está  soltera y vive en casa de sus padres. Lleva tres años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le ayudan a salir adelante.
Doña Katherine con la intención de ganarse algo por su cuenta y con esto poder ayudar a sus padres con los gastos del hogar se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta¡ es puerta a puerta, trabaja casi todos los días en sus recorridos, ella  deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada quince días, sus ventas son muy buenas ya que cuenta con buena clientela que siempre le encargan las prendas cuando ella viaja a Guayaquil a comprar, ya son 3 años que lleva en esta actividad la cual empezó con el primer crédito que recibió del grupo. 
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas y camisetas. Lleva 3 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta la unidad del grupo y la seriedad de la fundación. Su sueño es seguir trabando y que su negocio crezca más.
texts.en:
The credit group Calle América (America Street) meets every fifteen days in Cantón Montecristi, known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its craftsmanship, which is recognized both nationally and internationally. It is the place of the famous straw ‘Panama hats’.

This is where Miss Katherine lives. She is 21 years old, single, and lives with her parents. She has spent three years in the credit group and likes it because the loans help her to get ahead.

Ms. Katherine has the intention to earn something on her own and in this way to help her parents with the household expenses. Her work is in the business of trade, selling clothes of all kinds, going door-to-door, and working her routes almost every day. She gives credit to her customers and collects from them every fifteen days. Her sales are very good because she has good clientele, who always order items from her for when she travels to Guayaquil to buy her stock. She has been running this business for 3 years, beginning with the first loan the group received.

She will use this loan to buy more merchandise such as trousers, blouses and shirts. She has been with the credit group for 3 years and likes the unity of the group and the seriousness of the foundation. Her dream is to continue working and that her business will grow further.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses and shirts.

loans.name: Sabah

texts.en:
Sabah is a 55-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and three children, one of them is still attending school. She is a housewife taking care of her adored family and her husband is the main income source in family, in addition to her children's contributions.

With her loan requested from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l, Sabah will pay her child’s educational fees. She insists that she will be a permanent customer, as her only goal is to guarantee an excellent educational path for her child in a friendly environment.

loans.use: to pay her child’s educational fees.

loans.name: Julita

texts.en:
Julita is a married woman with eight children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Julita is 49 years old and three of her children are in school.

Julita has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Julita requested a PHP 8000 loan amount through NWTF to buy variety of fish to sell. She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her business.

Julita has been in this business for 11 years. In the future, Julita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell

loans.name: Gouri

texts.en:
Gouri is a 43-year-old married woman. She has two sons and two daughters. Her daughters are married, one son is engaged in painting work, and the other son is unemployed. Gouri lives in the small village of Kandi, in Murshidabad district of West Bengal with her family.

Gouri’s husband Sridam has been engaged in a green coconut business for the last 20 years. He purchases green coconuts and coconuts at a wholesale price and sells them to their local customers as well as in the market. This business has a high demand in the rural as well as urban markets because people are more health conscious and green coconut water is very good for their health. With the hope of generating more profit and income, they want to increase the volume of the business. So Gouri is coming forward and taking the step of seeking a loan from Kiva via BJS for the expansion of the business.

With this loan, they will purchase more coconuts at a wholesale rate for their business. Their dream is to buy a shop in their local village market with the profit from this business.

Gouri and her husband convey their thanks to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase more coconuts for the expansion of the business.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a 36-year-old married man from Lebanon. He is a father for one child who is still attending school. He is the main income provider in his family.

In 1996, Ibrahim opened a barber shop. To help him continue operating his business, he is requesting today to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. He will use the loan to buy a chair for his shop. He expects an increase in his income as he is expanding his work and hopes that his business will grow. His dreams is to be able to reach his goals.

loans.use: to buy a chair for his barber shop.

loans.name: Ardiana

texts.en:
Ardiana is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Ardiana is 55 years old and has one child still in school.

Ardiana has a buy-and-sell frozen food business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 30000 loan amount through NWTF to buy a variety of frozen foods to sell. She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her business.

Ardiana has been in this business for 19 years. In the future, Ardiana would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy frozen food to sell.

loans.name: Haydee

texts.en:
Haydee is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with seven children. She has a food vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Haydee also industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like fattening pigs. Haydee dreams that one day, she will be able to save enough money to expand her businesses.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Yeimy Edicza

texts.es:
La sonrisa de Yeimy muestra lo feliz y orgullosa que se siente de sí misma por estar hasta donde está a sus 21 años de edad, casi culminando la carrera de Diplomacia y Relaciones Internacionales. Con mucho esfuerzo y con el apoyo de su tía, quien trabaja como responsable de monitoreo y evaluación de proyectos, y de su tío quien posee un negocio propio, ha podido motivarse al punto que es una de las mejores alumnas de su año. 
El sueño de Yeimy es ser representante de Nicaragua a nivel internacional y promover la inversión para mejorar la económica de este mismo, por lo que para ella fue fácil adaptarse con la carrera. Ella acaba de culminar su carrera y no quiere interrumpir su educación superior, por lo que solicita un préstamo para pagar un posgrado en Comercio Internacional y así aprender del mundo del negocio desde una forma más global. Esto le permitirá aprender de otras áreas, bastante útiles en su carrera como para abrirle mejores puertas en el mundo laboral.  En sus metas está llegar a tener un trabajo donde pueda poner en práctica todos sus conocimientos adquiridos.
texts.en:
Yeimy's smile shows how happy and proud she feels about herself. At the age of 21 years old she is finishing her studies in Diplomacy and International Relations. Through much effort and with the support of her aunt, who works as the person responsible for monitoring and evaluating projects and her uncle who has his own business she has been able to motivate herself to the point of being one of the top students of her year.

Yeimy's dream is to represent Nicaragua at the international level and promote the investment that will improve the economy of her country. This would be easy for her to adapt to from her studies.

She has just finished her studies and doesn't want to interrupt her post secondary studies. So she is requesting a loan to pay for postgraduate studies in International Commerce and learn about the world of business in a more global form. This will allow to learn other fields, quite useful for her career as it will open better doors in the working world. Amongst her goals is to obtain work where she can put in practice all her acquired knowledge.

loans.use: to pay her postgraduate studies.

loans.name: Samara

texts.en:
Samara is 44 years old and has three children. She is married and two of her children are currently in school.

Samara is in the agricultural business fattening pigs in the Philippines. Samara requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Samara has been in pig fattening for 2 years now and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Samara would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds & supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is 44 years old and has three children. She is married, and one of her children is in school.

Violeta is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Violeta requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Violeta has been in this business for two years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Violeta would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Anjuwara

texts.en:
Anjuwara is a 27-year-old woman who lives in a small village in Falakata, in the Alipurduar district. She is an illiterate housewife who can sign only her name. She is blessed with three children (two sons and one daughter) who are students in local schools. Her husband, 28-year-old Taibar, is a carpenter by profession. He makes furniture such as beds, chairs, shelves, tables, wardrobes, etc. as per customers' orders. This is their sole source of income to earn their livelihood.

In order to make furniture, her husband requires materials such as logs of wood, nails, a hammer, saw, paint, and others tools. He has been engaged in this business for two years and attained a good number of customers. With the intention of expanding her family business, Anjuwara seeks a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to buy logs of wood and other necessary carpentry tools.

Anjuwara hopes that the loan will allow her husband to cater to the customers' orders on time, which will generate better income to offer them a better quality of life and new opportunities to get ahead.

Anjuwara is thankful to her lenders.

loans.use: to purchase wood and necessary tools for her husband's carpentry business.

loans.name: Arati

texts.en:
Arati is a young woman of 27 years hailing from Falakata. She is married and her family consists of three; her husband and two young children. Her daughter is a student in grade two and her son is a preschooler. Since Arati could achieve an education only up to grade two in her childhood, her greatest motivation in life is to provide the best education to her children.

Her husband is a farmer by profession and he has a plot of land. He mainly grows vegetables like potatoes, bottle gourd, bitter gourd, pointed gourd, etc. He has five years experience in farming. His products are in much demand in the markets. Arati is an energetic and hardworking woman. Although she is a housewife, she helps her husband in his work a lot, especially at the time of harvesting and carrying the products to the market for sale. The income for her family entirely depends on this agribusiness, so the couple wants to develop it by growing more vegetables. They have chosen to grow eggplant.

As they have no capital on hand, Arati is requesting a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner) to purchase agricultural inputs such as seeds, fertilizers, pesticides, etc. for eggplant cultivation.

Her dreams are to support her children in their studies, improve their quality of life and continue strengthening the family assets.

She is very much grateful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies for eggplant cultivation.

loans.name: Amna

texts.en:
Amna is a 31-year-old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of three children and equally responsible for all of them.

She belongs to an ultra-poor family, and that is why she cannot afford her children's educational expenses. One of her sons goes with his father to help him in his business. Her husband owns a blacksmith shop in which he provides services of welding. He also provides door-to-door services to his customers. Due to the increase in the price of iron, he is unable to buy sufficient welding materials such as welding rods, soldering rods, etc. to carry on his business.

To fulfill the demand of his customers and to run his enterprise, he needs some capital to buy welding materials. Amna has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband so that he will be able to buy welding rods, soldering rods and iron rods for manufacturing iron accessories.

Amna is very glad and thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy welding rods, soldering rods and iron rods for her husband's  blacksmith shop.

loans.name: Amtul Hafeez's Group

texts.en:
Amtul Hafeez's husband owns a metal shop in which he sells iron sheets and rods in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. He sells iron rods, which are used for constructing concrete roofs and manufacturing iron accessories. He has been doing this business since his childhood. He wants to generate maximum income so he can easily reduce financially constraints upon his family. He wants to educate and feed his children in good manners.

For the sake of his family's future he wants to increase inventory in his shop. In this way he can easily generate maximum income to support his family. But he does not have cash in hand.

Amtul Hafeez is 35 years old and mother of three children. She has to look after her children at home. She wants to financially support her husband so his aims can easily come true. She is very thankful to the Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy iron rods and sheets for her husband's metal shop.

loans.name: Safaa

texts.en:
Safaa is a 46-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband. She has been working since four years ago from her house doing tailoring to help her family to meet the needs of life. She is well-known in her region by her good reputation.

To better develop her work, Safaa is requesting a loan from Kiva partner, Vitas s.a.l. She will be utilizing the loan to buy new materials for her business, such as textiles, scissors, and a sewing machine. This will allow her to offer a greater variety of products and therefore will improve her income.

loans.use: to buy sewing materials & a sewing machine.

loans.name: Try - N11Tphongnphong Group

texts.en:
Hồng is 33 years old and is married. She has been operating a food stall selling fermented pork roll for 5 years.

Hồng lives in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in the village, moreover the market need is low in this region. She has no collateral and can't get loans from other banks or credit institutions.

The main hardship that Hồng faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase fermented pork roll to resell.

In 2012, Hồng joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Hồng has successfully repaid 3 loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. She is the group leader of "Try - N11TPhongNPhong", which consists of 3 members.

In the future, Hồng hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to go to school.

loans.use: to buy fermented pork roll to resell.

loans.name: Yai

texts.en:
Yai, who is 49 years old, is a farmer who lives in Cheung Prey district, Kampong Cham Province. She is a hard-working mother of four children, one of whom is married. She can make a net profit of approximately $5 (USD) a day.

During this rainy season, Yai is faced with a financial issue in her family. She needs some money to buy fertilizers and other farming-related materials to use in the rice field. After learning that HKL provides Kiva loans with a lower interest rate than its normal loans, Yai has decided to apply for a Kiva loan. She would like to thank to all lenders for their kindness.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farming-related materials.

loans.name: Karen Lorena

texts.es:
Karen es una mujer con 28 años de edad, luego de quedarse sin empleo durante varios meses por cuestiones de maternidad y ver que su situación económica va desmejorando, quiere montar su propio negocio, algo que le permita pasar más tiempo con su bebé y generar buenos ingresos.
Piensa iniciar con una sala de internet, pero no cuenta con suficiente capital es por esto que solicita un préstamo con el cual comprará computadores, módulos, impresoras y papelería.
Espera crecer con su negocio, formalizarlo y que algún día pertenezca a su hijo.

Su propósito es continuar trabajando para brindarle a su hijo una buena estabilidad económica y mejor calidad de vida.

Su actitud positiva y los deseos de salir adelante permiten ver esta mujer unas ganas inmensas de superarse y por supuesto una respuesta favorable a su petición.
texts.en: Karen is a 28 year old woman. After losing her job during many months because of maternity matters and seeing that her financial situation was worsening, she wants to open her own business, a job that will allow her to spend more time with her baby and earn more income. She plans to start an internet cafe, but she does not have enough capital. Therefore, she is requesting a loan to buy computers, modules, printers and paper goods. She hopes to grow her business, to formalize it so that some day it belongs to her son. Her purpose is to continue working to give her son good financial stability and a better quality of life. Her positive attitude and the wishes to prosper allow this woman to see huge desires to prosper, and also a favorable answer to her application.

loans.use: to buy computers, modules, printers and paper goods.

loans.name: Juan Francisco

texts.es:
Juan es un señor con 58 años de edad, trabajador y muy humilde. Desde hace tres años tiene su propio negocio, en un pequeño local arrendado por un familiar se dedicó a la venta de caucho/plástico. Con el dinero que esto genera paga los servicios y su alimentación.
Con el fin de mejorar sus ventas, aumentar sus clientes e incrementar sus ganancias, solicita un crédito para la compra de empaques, mangueras, cauchos, plásticos y otros.
Quiere seguir trabajando hasta cumplir el sueño de reparar su casa.
Sabe que de la mano de Interactuar y los colaboradores del Portal Kiva sus sueños se harán realidad.
texts.en:
Juan, 58, is a hard worker and very humble. He has had his own business for three years. In a small place rented from a relative, he works selling rubber and plastic. With the money that this generates, he pays for his utilities and food.

In order to improve his sales, expand his customer base, and increase his profits, he is requesting a loan to buy packing, hoses, rubber, plastic, and other items.

He wants to keep working until he can fulfill his dream of repairing his house. He knows that with the help of Interactuar and Kiva lenders, his dreams will become a reality.

loans.use: to buy packing, hoses, rubber, plastic, and other items.

loans.name: Rinku

texts.en:
Rinku is a 42-year-old woman who lives in the small village of Kandi. She lives there with her husband and two children (a daughter and a son). Her daughter is a student earning an M.A (Masters in Arts) and her son is in Higher Secondary grade.

Being a housewife, Rinku has been running a watch shop for 10 years with the help of her husband. She sells men and women’s wristwatches, wall clocks, alarm clocks, etc. from her shop. The local people, nearby villagers and passersby are her customers. Her business has a good reputation in her locality but it is crucial for Rinku to run the family with her present monthly income. As the costs of daily essential commodities are increasing day by day, she is unable to meet the household needs and the high education costs of her children. To overcome this situation, she plans to expand her shop with more stock. As she has no capital on hand, she seeks a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to buy more varieties of modern watches and clocks for her shop.

She hopes she will be able to sell more than before to generate a better income and can satisfy her customers. This will also help to bear the education costs of her children’s further education.

Rinku is thankful to BJS and Kiva for this financial help.

loans.use: to increase the stock in her watch shop.

loans.name: Sreymom's Group

texts.en:
Sreymom, 33, lives with family members in a rural village in Prey Veng province. She is a mother of four children, three of whom are in school and the one is too young to get in school.

To earn income for her living condition, Sreymom weaves cotton scarves and works as a construction worker. In addition, she can earn more income via fishing. She can save from her daily income for her family about 5.5 USD per day and she has been with her business for 13 years. She is selling her cotton scarves at the lower prices than last year and it is her main challenge.

Sreymom leads a group of four to seek for a new loan. This is her second loan with VisionFund. With the previous loan, her family’s living has improved more than before. As the group leader, she will manage her loan portion to buy more cotton thread to support on her weaving business and buy a decent bicycle for her children to go to school on time. She hopes that she can earn more income to upgrade her living condition and support her children’s education as well.

loans.use: to buy weaving supplies.

location.town: Prey Veng Province, Sithor Kandal district

loans.name: Rosenda

texts.en:
Rosenda is 57 years old and widowed with ten children. With three children in school, Rosenda works very hard to provide for them.

Rosenda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7500 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like bread, spices, and other groceries.

Rosenda has been in this business for 6 years and sells a variety of items. 

In the future, Rosenda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like bread, spices and other groceries.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 62 years old and married. She has six children, one of whom is in school.

Rosalinda is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Rosalinda has been in this business for 22 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Pablo Rafael

texts.es:
Pablo es un hombre con 36 años de edad, tiene tres hijos menores y vive en el Municipio de 
Sincelejo. La adversidad que lo ha perseguido no ha sido obstáculo para querer salir adelante y alcanzar sus sueños, lo que se propone lo logra.
Su deseo es tener su propio negocio, quiere dedicarse a vender mercancía desde su casa, sabe que lo puede lograr con la ayuda de interactuar y los colaboradores del portal Kiva.
El préstamo que está solicitando es para la compra de camisetas, jeans, calzado y perfumes.
Espera crecer con su negocio y en poco tiempo abrir su primer local y llegar a generar empleo a las personas que más lo necesiten.
Sus sueños son muchos, pero el principal es tener su casa propia y pagar la educación de sus hijos, pues su bienestar le preocupa.
texts.en:
Pablo is a 36 year old man. He has three children and lives in the municipality of Sincelejo. The adversity that has dogged him has not been an obstacle to his desire to get ahead and fulfill his dreams.

His desire is to have his own business. He wants to work selling merchandise from his house. He knows he can manage this with the help of Interactuar and the lenders at the Kiva portal.

The loan he is requesting is to buy t-shirts, jeans, footwear and perfume.

He hopes to grow with his business and in a short time open his first shop and end up generating employment for people who most need it.

His dreams are many, but the principal one is to have his own house and pay for the education of his children as their well-being worries him.

loans.use: to buy t-shirts, jeans, footwear and perfume.

loans.name: Deofanor

texts.es:
Deofanor  es un señor de 73 años, tiene un hijo con 22 años de edad y es viudo ya hace tres años. Se desempeña en la cría y venta de aves, un negocio que lo inicio por necesidad económica y el cual le genera los ingresos necesarios para solventar sus necesidades.

Su deseo de salir adelante es admirable porque pese a su avanzada edad no disminuye los esfuerzos para lograr sus objetivos, su meta es continuar con esta labor y cumplir el sueño de mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda.

Solicita un préstamo con el cual comprará aves, cerdos, alimentación y medicamento para los mismos.

Las circunstancias difíciles por las que ha pasado este hombre y su empuje para superarlas lo hacen merecedor de la ayuda que solicita.
texts.en: Deofanor is a 73 year old man. He has a 22 year old son and has been a widower for three years. He works raising and selling poultry, a business he started because of financial need which generates the needed income to pay for his needs. His wish to prosper is admirable, because even at his older age, he does not decrease his efforts to reach his objectives. His goal is to continue with this job and fulfill his dream of improving the conditions of his house. He is requesting a loan to buy poultry, pigs, food and medicine for these animals. The difficult circumstances this man has been through and his drive to overcome them make him deserve the help he is requesting.

loans.use: to buy poultry, pigs, and food and medicines for these animals.

loans.name: Erlyn

texts.en: Erlyn is a 35-year-old woman who lived in the town of Carles in Iloilo, Philippines. She is a mother of four children ages 13, 10, nine and two years old. Her husband is a carpenter while Erlyn is engaged in sari-sari store business. They work hard to provide the needs of their family. She is asking a loan to buy assorted grocery items such as noodles, spices, flour, toiletries, salt, sugar, coffee, powdered chocolate drink, chips, candies, eggs, cooking oil and canned goods. In the future, she wishes to improve her business to uplift their livelihood.

loans.use: to buy noodles, spices, flour, toiletries, salt, sugar, coffee, powdered chocolate drink, chips, candies, eggs, cooking oil and canned goods

loans.name: Fatmeh

texts.en: Fatmeh is a 50 year old Lebanese married woman of three children. Her husband represents the main income provider in his family, he owns a grocery store in his town for many years. His income is barely sufficient. That’s why currently, she is requesting to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to pay her children stationary for the school with the aim to insure them a good education.

loans.use: to pay for her children's stationary for the school.

loans.name: Ernie

texts.en:
Ernie toils the land and grows vegetables like squash and ampalaya(bitter gourd). He has been engaged in farming for 5 years now. He is a married man with four dependents. His eldest is 18 while the youngest is 1.

He has requested a loan in the amount of 3,000 PHP to buy fertilizers and seedlings. These will boost his livelihood and improve his yield. Thus, she could able to settle his obligation and provide the needs of his family.

Ernie is hoping that he could improve his source of income to be productive and also continue finance the schooling of his children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seedlings

loans.name: Paciencia

texts.en:
Paciencia is a married woman with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Paciencia is 51 years old now.

Paciencia has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Paciencia requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell in her business.

Paciencia has been in this business for 4 years. In the future, Paciencia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in her business

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy  is 34 years, single.

Joy  is in the agricultural business, raising chicken in the Philippines. Joy  requested a PHP 9000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, vaccine and other farm supplies to raise her chicken.

Joy  has been in this business for 2 years now, and has borrowed 7 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, vaccine and other farm supplies to raise her chickens.

loans.name: Katia Marcela

texts.es:
Karen es una mujer con 21 años de edad,  tiene un hijo con 11 meses de edad, gracias a unas clases que recibió sobre todo lo relacionado con la belleza, hoy en día tiene su propio negocio, ella desde su casa se dedica a realizar el manicure y pedicure. Este ha sido un medio por el cual esta mujer ha logrado superar una crisis económica la cual vivió luego de tener a su hijo y no encontrar empleo. Además de generarle buenos ingresos también le permite pasar más tiempo con su hijo.
Se encuentra solicitando un préstamo para la compra de implementos que mejoren su servicio, como esmaltes de buena marca, limas, alicate y cremas para los masajes.
Quiere seguir trabajando hasta cumplir el sueño de mejorar las condiciones de su casa, ya que esta lleva mucho tiempo de construida y su estado actual no es el mejor.
Para esto cuenta con la ayuda de Interactuar y los prestamistas del portal Kiva.
texts.en:
Karen, age 21, has an 11 month old son. Thanks to some classes that she got about everything having to do with beauty, she now has her own business. She does manicures and pedicures at her house. This has been a means through which this woman has managed to overcome the financial crisis that she went through after having her son and not finding employment.

In addition to generating good income, it also allows her to spend more time with her son.

She is requesting a loan to buy implements to improve her service. She will buy things like a good brand of nail polishes, nail files, nail clippers, and massage cream.

She wants to continue working to fulfill her dream of improving the condition of her house, which is taking a long time to build. Its current state is not the best. That is why she counts on help from Interactuar and the Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy a good brand of nail polishes, nail files, nail clippers, and massage cream.

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en: Nazia is a 31 years old, married woman. She is a very talented lady and excels in her work of stitching. She has gotten a lot of appreciation from her community. Some years ago she started her business of tailoring for running her household activities. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. She has now requested for a loan of 50000 PKR  to purchase more spools of threads, ribbons, cloth, needles and scissors for sewing more dresses on time to get a boost in her earnings and wishes to spend it on providing quality life to her family members.

loans.use: to purchase more spools of threads, ribbons, cloth, needles and scissors for sewing  more dresses on time.

loans.name: Marivel

texts.en:
Marivel works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Marivel has been in this business for five years, now. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Carmel

texts.en:
Carmel is 41 years old and married. She has one child. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines.

Carmel is borrowing PHP 50,000 through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

She has been raising pigs for 15 years, and she earns additional income from retail sales of personal products. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Salma

texts.en:
Salma is a 40-year-old woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of two children.

Her husband is a rickshaw driver, by profession. For a long time, he has wanted to replace his old rickshaw's body. Because of its ugliness, he is unable to attract passengers or to generate any amount of income. He wants to buy a rickshaw body as soon as possible. However, due to the lack of money, he finds it difficult to cover the cost of a new rickshaw body.

Therefore, Salma has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan. She will use the loan to help her husband to cover the cost of the rickshaw body. This will help him to continue his business. Salma is so very thankful to Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to replace the old rickshaw body for her husband's transportation services business.

loans.name: El Kifah 2 Group

texts.en:
Shshay is the featured borrower for El Kifah 2 Group. She got together with her other group members to take this Al Majmoua loan because they have always been neighbors and friends. They are working hard to develop their businesses and living at the same time.

Shshay is a 28-year-old Ethiopian divorced mother of one child who is working hard as a housekeeper to cover the expenses and needs of her family and improve their living conditions. Thus she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay her child's school tuition fees in Ethiopia.

Shshay is the first lady on the left of the photo. With respect to the other group members, Hadiya is the second lady on the left, Clar is the second lady on the right, and Mona is the first lady on the right of the photo.

loans.use: to pay her child's school tuition fees in Ethiopia

loans.name: Ninfa Maria

texts.es:
Ninfa es una señora con 30 años de edad, se dedica a la preparación y  venta de comida desde su casa. Un negocio que lo inicio hace poco y del que se generan muy buenos ingresos que son invertidos en el pago de arriendo y la compra de los alimentos para su hogar.
Trabaja todos la semana durante 6 horas diarias. 

Los factores que la han llevado al fracaso en ocasiones anteriores no han sido impedimento para esta mujer querer salir adelante y alcanzar sus metas.
Su propósito es continuar trabajando y cumplir el sueño de tener su propia casa, tener una mejor estabilidad económica y gozar de una buena salud.
 
Se encuentra solicitando un préstamo con el cual comprará utensilios como platos y  cucharas desechables y también lo invertirá en la compra de alimentos como arroz, aceite, sal y otros.

Con su aporte esta mujer podrá hacer de sus sueños una realidad, anímese, haga un préstamo.
texts.en:
30-year-old Ninfa works preparing and selling food from home. She started this business recently and so far it is generating a good income, which she invests in paying rent and buying food for her home. She works all week for 6 hours per day.
