The factors that have led her to failure in the past are not an impediment for this woman to try to get ahead in life and achieve her goals. Her objectives are to continue working and to reach her dream of having her own home, financial stability and health. 

She is requesting a loan, with which she will buy disposable plates and utensils, as well as products such as rice, oil, salt and others. 

With your support, this woman will be able to make her dreams come true. Please make the decision to give her a loan!

loans.use: to buy disposable plates and utensils, as well as products such as rice, oil, salt and others.

loans.name: Suriya

texts.en:
Suriya is 47 years old, a married woman, and a mother of four children. Her son is a driver, by profession. He provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family's expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine.

For this reason, Suriya has applied for a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan. She will use the loan for her son. He wants to buy new tires and do a little bit of engine maintenance on his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transportation services to his passengers. Suriya hopes that this loan will be a productive one for her son and will bring positive changes to his business. Suriya gives thanks to Kiva and to its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to cover the maintenance cost of her son's rickshaw, so he can drive it smoothly.

loans.name: Ashoki A Group

texts.en:
Severina is in her early 40s. She is married and has four children who are still in school. She has been selling shoes for twelve years. She works from 06:00 in the morning to 06:00 in the evening, daily, and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Severina's 10th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to keep on buying the latest styles and to increase her stock of styles. She has paid back all her loans successfully. She used the profits to pay school fees, to build her own house, to repay the loans, and to cover household expenses. She is doing great, and she appreciates Kiva for the support of their group. Her family is now able to lead a comfortable life, with their children going to good schools.

She will use this new loan to buy the latest-style shoes and meet her customers' requirements. She dreams of becoming an international businesswoman.

Severina will share this loan with her loan group, Ashoki A, which has two members. They will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to  buy the latest-style shoes and meet her customers' requirements.

loans.name: Ze8Inab

texts.en: Zeinab is a 28-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and four children. Her husband is the mail the income source in the family, working to fulfil their family needs and improve their lifestyle. Zeinab doesn’t work. Now, she needs a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to pay her children's school fees. This will make her very happy that she will able to support their education suitably and secure a brilliant future.

loans.use: to pay her children's school fees.

loans.name: Brona

texts.en:
Brona is 42 years old and has nine children. Brona is married and has three children who are currently in school.

Brona is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Brona requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Brona has been raising pigs for 5 years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Brona would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Ofelia Maribel

texts.es:
Ofelia, utilizo el crédito anterior para tener un mejor inventario de frutas y bebidas para vender, sus clientes están satisfechos con sus productos y atención que ella les brinda, sus condiciones económicas están mejorando, el grupo familiar se mantiene y hasta la fecha no ha tenido problemas para seguir trabajando.
Requiere de un nuevo crédito para comprar jugos, agua, gaseosas y otras bebidas refrescantes, así como también frutas, seguirá trabajando y ofreciendo mercadería del gusto de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Ofelia used her previous loan to have a better inventory of fruits and drink to sell. Her clients are satisfied with her products and the attention that she brings them. Her economic conditions have improved, her family group is supported, and to date she has had no problems to keep working.
She needs a new loan to buy juices, water, sodas, and other refreshing drinks, as well as fruits. She will keep working and offering merchandise to her client's liking.

loans.use: to buy juices, water, sodas, and other refreshing drinks, as well as fruits. She will keep working and offering merchandise to her client's liking.

loans.name: Munira

texts.ru: Мунира женщина 44 лет,разведена,мать четырех детей.Она развелась с мужем 5 лет назад и с тех пор сама воспитывает своих детей.Мунира работает на базаре,у нее маленький ларек,где она продает продукты питания.Также Мунира подрабатывает в школе техничкой.Мунире приходится очень тяжело одной воспитывать и обеспечивать четырех детей,ее бывший муж почти ей не помогает. Сейчас Мунира планирует установить пластиковые окно в доме,так как в прошлом году зима была очень суровая и все ее дети всю зиму болели.Но у нее нет полной суммы денег.Поэтому она обратилась в МДО Арванд за финансовой поддержкой.Мунира надеется,что МДО Арванд выделит ей нужную сумму.Заранее благодарит за поддержку и доверие.
texts.en:
Munira is the 44-year-old divorced mother of four children.  She and her husband divorced five years ago and since then, Munira has been raising her children alone.  Munira is a market vendor; she has a small stall where she sells food products.  She also works in a school as a cleaning lady.  Munira finds it very difficult to raise and support her four children alone, especially since her ex-husband offers very little help.

Munira is planning to install vinyl windows at home.  Last winter was very cold and her children were sick the whole time.  However, she doesn't have the full amount of money necessary for this purchase.  For this reason, she has turned to MDO Arvand for financial support, and she hopes that they will be able to lend her the money that she needs.  She thanks them in advance for their support and their trust.

loans.use: to install vinyl windows in her house.

loans.name: True Colors - N06T7Đanhđsơn Group

texts.en:
Thảo is 38 years old and is married with 2 children. Mrs. Thảo has been operating a food stall selling fish for 5 years.

She lives in Dong Son district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in the village; moreover the market need is low in this region. The income from this business is unstable because the amount and the price of the fish they catch depend upon the weather conditions.

The main hardship that Thảo faces in her business is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more fish to resell.

This is Thảo first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. She hopes that this loan could help her improve her living standard. Thảo is the group leader of "True colors - N06T7ĐAnhĐSơn", which consists of 5 members.

In the future, Thảo hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to resell.

loans.name: Mithu

texts.en:
Forty-three-year-old Mithu is a rural housewife in the village of Lohapotti in Kandi. She lives with her husband and their only son who is a student in grade eight.

Mithu’s husband Goutam runs a trunk shop for their livelihood. He purchases embossed tin and other necessary materials and constructs trunks to sell. A “trunk” is a large container for holding clothes and other personal belongings, commonly used for extended periods away from home, such as for boarding school or long trips. In rural areas, rural people use trunks as furniture storage for everything from blankets to other important equipment. So there is a huge demand for these trunks in the locality for keeping their bags and baggage. But Mithu’s husband cannot supply his customers on time due to insufficient stock. He needs to make more trunks and suitcases for sale.

So Mithu asked for a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase embossed tins and other related accessories in bulk to make trunks on a large scale.

She hopes this will generate more income for her family’s wellbeing and her son’s future better education. Mithu thanks her lenders.

loans.use: to purchase tin and other materials in bulk for her husband’s existing business.

loans.name: Sughran

texts.en:
Sughran’s family have been making artificial jewelry for many years and generating income. Their practice is to buy metal, pearl and gemstones for making artificial jewelry. Her husband melts the metal and gives it a specific shape through dies, and Sughran strings pearls and pastes gemstones into it. After completing the entire process, her husband sells it to the jewelry shops.

Nowadays the cost of metal has suddenly increased, so Sughran has requested a Kiva loan. Through the loan she will buy raw materials for making jewelry so she can continue her family's business and can cherish her family happily.

Sughran is thankful for this opportunity and sends compliments to Kiva and BRAC.

loans.use: to buy metal, gemstones, and pearls for her family's jewelry-making business.

loans.name: Bebiana

texts.en:
As a married mother of six children, Bebiana works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Bebiana is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF in order to buy fishing nets and other equipment for her fishing business.

Bebiana has been sustaining her business activities through her past 22 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and other equipment.

loans.name: Jamuna

texts.en:
Jamuna is a 42-year-old hardworking housewife from Raychenga village in Falakata, Alipurduar district of West Bengal. She is a blessed mother of two children (a son and a daughter). Her daughter is married and her son is engaged in his father's business.

Jamuna's husband provides different types of decorating lights to rent in various occasions (like puja pandals, marriages etc.). As his income is on a seasonal basis, it is irregular. So Jamuna faces difficulties running her family properly with the adequate household necessities. Now as the marriage and festival season is coming, Jamuna’s husband wants to take advantage of this season to expand his business. He wants to buy more varieties of decorating lights and other electrical tools for upgrading his lighting business. But due to a lack of money, he cannot buy these things. So Jamuna took the initiative and applied for a loan from BJS (Kiva’s Partner) to help her husband.

She hopes the financial aid will surely develop her husband’s business, increase her income level and give this hardworking and honest entrepreneur a ray of hope to get ahead in life.

Jamuna wants to convey her thanks to her lenders BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy different types of lights for her husband’s lighting business.

loans.name: Ashalata

texts.en:
Ashalata is a 44-year-old rural woman who lives at Baganbari village in Falakata. She lives there with her husband and one son. Her son is studying in college. Ashalata is unfortunate that she could not continue her study after 8th grade due to her family's financial constraints and her husband is illiterate and can only sign his name.

Ashalata's husband is associated with the business of furniture making. He prepares wooden furniture like chairs, tables, cabinets, racks etc. according to the demands of his customers. His main customers are his neighbors. He buys wood from the wholesale market for manufacturing furniture. This business is the main source of creating income for maintaining the family's expenses. Ashalata helps her husband in his business after managing her household work. Now her husband wants to extend his business. He wants to buy more wood and other materials for making furniture. But he does not have enough capital.

Thus, Ashalata has decided to help her husband. She applied for a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner). She hopes this loan will help her husband to increase his business. She also hopes their financial status will be upgraded with the profit from the business.

She and her husband thank their lenders (BJS and Kiva) for their support.

loans.use: to purchase good quality wood and other necessary materials for her husband's carpentry business.

loans.name: Jimsher

texts.en:
Jimsher, 51, lives with his wife, mother and three children in the Zugdidi district in Georgia. He farms vegetables on his own land.

Jimsher would like to build a greenhouse where he could grow tomatoes and cucumbers two to three times a year. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, is offering him a 4500 GEL loan.

A greenhouse operation will give Jimsher a chance to generate stable income and improve the living conditions of his family. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to build a greenhouse

loans.name: Sonia Eloisa

texts.es:
Sonia tiene la necesidad de solicitar un crédito para poder comprar insumos para la venta de pupusas, como: aceite, chicharrón, quesillo, harina, repollo, tomates, etc., de esta manera su negocio se mantendrá en el mercado.
Sonia considera que con la facilidad de recursos económicos que le dio el crédito anterior, ella puede tener a su alcance todo lo necesario para sostener la pupusería y la tienda, atender mejor a sus clientes y tener ingresos para cumplir con sus obligaciones, su familia de mantiene y su estilo de vida es más digno.
texts.en:
Sonia requests a loan to buy inputs for pupusa sales such as oil, fried pork rind, cheese, flour, cabbage, tomatoes etc. This will allow her to keep her business in the market.

Sonia believes that the economic resources from the previous loan enabled her to have everything she needs to sustain her pupusa shop. She is also able to better serve her customers and earn income to meet her obligations. Her family is maintained and her lifestyle is more worthy.

loans.use: to buy inputs for pupusa sales such as oil, fried pork rind, cheese, flour, cabbage, tomatoes etc.

loans.name: Adjoavi

texts.fr: Adjoavi est âgée de 57 ans et est une femme mariée. Adjoavi vit avec ses cinq enfants à charge à Tokoin où elle prépare de la bouillie faite à base du maïs pour ses consommateurs qui trouvent satisfaction dans son activité. Adjoavi s’approvisionne une fois par mois au marché et désire ce crédit pour commander des bols de maïs en vue de gagner une bonne marge bénéficiaire et pouvoir ainsi aider son mari à  promouvoir l’éducation de ses enfants et prendre en charge certaines dépenses de la famille.
texts.en: Adjoavi is 57 years old and married. Adjoavi lives with her five dependent children in Tokoin, where she cooks corn porridge for sale to her loyal customers. Adjoavi stocks up at the market once a month. She would like to use this loan  to stock up on bowls of corn in order to earn a good profit margin and help her husband support their children's education as well as cover some household expenses.

loans.use: to buy 90 bowls of corn.

loans.name: Azhar

texts.en:
Going to a university is financially difficult for many families. Azhar comes from one of them. She has a big family of six people: her parents, grandmother, herself and two younger siblings. Her grandmother is widowed and old; she needs someone to take care of her. Azhar’s father works at budgetary organization and her mother is an assistant of the Psychology Department at one of the local universities. Although both parents work, their income is used for two children's school tuition and for food, transportation, and other daily living expenses. Having no other sources of funding, it is hard for them to save money for necessary things such as higher education for their children.

Azhar remembers the days when her family used to pay rent for their apartment. Now, thanks to her uncle, they live in his house for free. Of course, it helped them to save some money for Azhar’s university tuition. Having applied for AUCA’s financial aid, Azhar got some discount, and she hopes to get a Kiva loan to reduce the remaining amount of the tuition and fees. Her parents totally support their daughter’s idea to get a good education to succeed in life. They are ready to work day and night, to provide their children a better future than they have.

loans.use: to pay for her studies toward a Bachelor Degree in the IBL Program at AUCA.

loans.name: Khalil

texts.en:
Khalil is a 32-year-old, married father of one daughter. His daughter means the world to him, and he works hard to provide her with the best education and living. Khalil has been working as a sales person since March 2011. Because he is his family's sole earner, he has to make sure that his limited monthly income is enough to cover his family's increasing living needs.

Since his family responsibilities are increasing, but his salary is not, Khalil is acquiring a loan today from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua. He will use it to pay his beloved daughter's school tuition.

He hopes to stay in good health and be promoted in his job, to make sure he can cover his family's increasing living needs.

loans.use: to pay his beloved daughter's school tuition.

loans.name: Emilia

texts.en:
Emilia is a 51-year-old married woman with five children, three of whom are in school. Emilia sells tempura (a street food, consisting of seasonal vegetables, fish and other seafood coated in a batter of wheat flour, egg and water, deep-fried in vegetable oil). She has been engaged in this business for 8 years now.

Emilia is asking for a loan to buy more stock of tempura. This will allow her to meet the needs of her customers and raise her income.

She is doing her best to expand her business to continue supporting the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy more stock of tempura (batter for frying fish and vegetables).

loans.name: Ry

texts.en:
Ry, 48, is married and the mother of two children. She and her husband farm rice in Cheung Prey district, Kampong Cham Province and make a net profit of about 10 USD a day.

Ry learned that Kiva offers loans at a lower interest rate through HKL and so has applied for a 300 USD loan. She will use it to build a new kitchen outside of her house because the old one is beyond repair. She would like to thank all lenders in advance for their kindness.

loans.use: to build a new kitchen outside of her house because the old one is beyond repair.

loans.name: Alia

texts.en:
Alia is a simple housewife, and a mother of three sons. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been running a food stall, selling various edible items -- for example, chicken, mutton, chicken tikka, kebab paratha, etcetera. Her husband is solely responsible for feeding their entire family and managing their household.

Alia's husband needs to purchase different kinds of edible and other items for his business purpose, so that he can increase the size of the business, improve his sales growth, and earn maximum profit. But due to an unfavorable financial position, her husband is not in condition to purchase these items for his business purpose.

Therefore, Alia has applied for a Kiva loan from Kiva's field partner, BRAC Pakistan. She will use the loan to help her husband to purchase the above items for his business purpose. She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to enable her husband to increase his food stall business.

loans.name: Umid

texts.ru: Умид молодой энергичный парень. Ему 22 года. Он родился в центре Спитаменского района. Умид живет со своими родителями. Он подрабатывает таксистом. Этот год для Умида оказался счастливым, так как он встретил свою половинку. И мечты родителей Умида тоже сбылись. Они посватали невесту и сыграли свадьбу. Теперь Умид ответственный семьянин. Полученный доход от такси он тратит на содержание семьи.  Его юная жена Лайло окончив школу хотела поступить в ВУЗ. Но по повелению судьбы не удалось поступит. Она рассказала своему мужу о своей заветной мечте учится дальше. И Умид выслушав Лайло решил ей помочь в осуществлении ее мечты. Выбрав университет Лайло сдала экзамены своим знаниям и поступила на “Банковское дело”. Так как группа коммерческая им надо оплатить договор за обучение. И им требуются денежные средства. Половину договора оплатил сам Умид. Услышав от знакомых о кредитном продукте для обучения выдаваемым МДО Арванд Умид обратился в Арванд. Получив кредит он полностью оплатил договор Лайло. Умид и Лайло от всей души благодарят за оказанную им помощь со стороны работников Арванд.
texts.en:
Umid is a young energetic person. He is 22 years old. He was born in the center of the Spitamen Region.  He lives with his parents and earns an income by driving a taxi. This year proved lucky for Umin because he met his soul mate. The dreams of Umid's parents have also come true. They sent matchmakers to the bride and hosted a wedding. Now Umid is a responsible family man. He is using the income from his taxi to support his family.

Umid' young wife, Lailo, had wanted to enter college after secondary school. However, this was not meant to be. Lailo told her husband of her dream to continue her studies, and Umid decided to help Lailo realize this dream. Lailo chose a university, took entrance exams and was admitted to the Banking major. Since she is in a student group that does not get a scholarship, she must pay the costs of her tuition, and is in need of funding. Umid was able to pay half of the amount himself. Having heard from his acquaintances about MDO Arvand's student loans, Umin has reached out to Arvand. He obtained a loan and paid the tuition for Lailo in full. Umid and Lailo express their heartfelt thanks to Arvand's officers for their help.

loans.use: to pay for college tuition [for his wife] and a computer.

loans.name: Flower Group

texts.en:
Sheilapaz is the featured borrower of Flower Group. She is the second lady on the right. She got together with the other group members to acquire a loan from Al Majmoua because the four women have always been friends since they left their hometown in the Philippines. They all came to work in Lebanon to earn a better income and support their loved ones back home.

Sheilapaz is a 48-year-old married mother of three children who is working hard as a housekeeper to cover the expenses and needs of her beloved children and to improve their living conditions. Thus she is requesting a loan to pay her children's school tuition fees in the Philippines.

With respect to the other group members, Mildred is the second lady on the left of the photo, Olivia is the first lady on the right, and Arlene is the first lady on the left.

loans.use: to pay her children's school tuition fees in the Philippines.

loans.name: Khalil

texts.en:
Khalil is a 25-year-old, single man from Rafah city. Rafah is located in the Gaza Strip. He works as an employee in the public sector, where he gets a low income. This income barely covers all the family's needs, but he wants to make his family more comfortable and improve their standard of living.

So Khalil took a US Dollar loan from FATEN, which will enable him to buy a solar-powered system for heating water, for the family house. By taking this loan, Khalil will be able to decrease his family's electricity expenses, while using a cleaner form of energy (rather than gas). Khalil’s family will have an easier time heating water for showers, cooking, and washing clothes and dishes. Khalil appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a solar-powered system for heating water for the family house.

loans.name: Alaa

texts.en:
Alaa is a 33-year-old married man from Rafah city, which is located in the Gaza Strip. He works as an employee in the public sector, where he gets a low income. This income barely covers all the family needs, but he wants to make his family more comfortable and improve their standard of living.

So, Alaa took a USD loan from FATEN, which will enable him to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house. By taking this loan, Alaa will be able to decrease the electricity expenses, while using a cleaner form of energy (rather than gas). Alaa’s family will have an easier time heating water for showers, cooking and also washing clothes and dishes. Alaa appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house.

loans.name: Ana Luisa

texts.es:
A veces los héroes y heroínas no necesariamente tienen capas, ni trajes extravagantes, en el mundo real luchan por la justicia de las personas de cerca para hacer de un mundo mejor. Este es el concepto que tiene Ana, una joven de veinte años de edad, que velando por sus ingresos personales y de hacer valer las leyes en este país, la llevaron a estudiar la carrera de Derecho, donde es caracterizada como la mejor alumna de su año. Ella sueña con algún día establecer su propia notaria para convertirse en una emprendedora. 
Ana ya está a punto de concluir con esta meta importante en su vida, pues ya está en cuarto año de la licenciatura gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo de su madre, quien posee una fritanga, de su papá, quien tiene un taller de silenciadores y de sus cinco hermanos, quienes la apoyan económicamente cada uno. Esto la ha motivado a no soltar este sueño, de manera que solicita un préstamo para pagar su posgrado, última etapa con la cual podrá salir con la licenciatura y este otro título con el cual podrá optar a un excelente puesto de trabajo y cumplir con sus sueños.
texts.en:
Sometimes heroes don't have capes or extravagant costumes. In the real world they fight for people's justice to make a better world. This is the case of Ana, a young 20-year-old woman whose desire to have personal income, and enforce the laws of this country, led her to study law where she is the best student in her class. One day she dreams of opening up her own notary firm and becoming an entrepreneur.

Ana is about to achieve an important goal in her life because she is already in her fourth year of her degree. This is thanks to the effort and support of her mother, who runs a fritanga [sale of fried foods], her father, who has a muffler shop, and her five siblings who each support her economically. This has motivated her to hold onto this dream. For this reason she is requesting a loan to pay for her postgraduate studies, which is the last step in obtaining her degree. With this degree she will be able to select an excellent job and fulfill her dreams.

loans.use: to pay for her graduate studies.

loans.name: Hakim

texts.ru: Хаким молодой мужчина в возрасте 38 лет. Он женат. ОН родился и вырос в сельском местности. И по этому с детства был приучен к труду. У Хакима среднее образование. Хаким занимается откормом и куплей продажей скота. Он покупает скот со скотного рынка, откармливает и перепродает. Кроме этого его жена продает молоко полученного от коров, что принесет им дополнительный доход. Жена Хакима домохозяйка. Она ухаживает за детьми. И дома помогает мужу присматривать за скотом. Как мы знаем в сегодняшний  день выручка который получает Хаким  от продажи скота не хватит им для содержание семьи. По этому Хаким дополнительно работает плотником. Но это работа считается сезонной. Хаким посоветовавшись с женой решили увеличить  объем скотов. И этим организовать свой бизнес дома. Но для этого у них не хватило средств так как они  тратили деньги  на покупку корм для скотов. Поэтому они обратились в МДО Арванд за кредитом. На полученную сумму Хаким купит нескольких голов крупнорогатого скота.
texts.en:
Hakim is a young man who is 38 years old. He is married. He was born and raised in agricultural areas, and so he has been used to labor since childhood. Hakim has a secondary-level education, and he works by fattening and buying and selling livestock. He buys livestock at the livestock market, fattens them up, and resells them.

In addition to this, his wife sells milk that they get from their cows, which brings them some supplementary income. Hakim's wife is a homemaker. She looks after the money, and she helps her husband watch after the livestock.

As we all know, the earnings that Hakim gets from selling livestock are not enough to support a family nowadays. Therefore, Hakim also works as a carpenter. However, this work is seasonal. Hakim, consulting his wife, decided to enlarge his number of livestock, and put his home business in order.

However, their funds were not enough for this, because they had spent money on purchasing feed for their livestock. Therefore, they applied to MDO Arvand for a loan. With the sum of money he receives, Hakim will buy a few head of cattle.

loans.use: to buy a few head of cattle.

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en:
Rukhsana is age 47; she is a mother of five children and lives in Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband has been running a general store, in which he sells rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, soap, biscuits, etcetera. He manages his household necessities from his own store, and his relatives like to purchase from his general store, as well. He speaks with an even tone, which is impressive, and he easily wins the trust of others. Due to his behavior and tone, he has built up very good relations with his customers. His general store is very famous in the town, and that is the reason his business runs well.

Due to good relationships his sales have increased a lot, but he does not have sufficient stock to cope with the demand. Therefore, Rukhsana requested a loan for her husband so that he can buy more stock, including wheat, rice, flour, pulses, soaps, shampoo, detergents, biscuits, etcetera.

Rukhsana hopes that her husband will use the loan in a positive way, and that this amount will help him to cope with the demands of her family. Rukhsana thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy stock for her husband's general store, including rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, soap, and biscuits.

loans.name: Nuevo Amanecer De Mollepata Ii Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “NUEVO AMANECER DE MOLLEPATA II”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Mollepata, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Lourdes, la socia sigue con su negocio de crianza de animales menores como gallinas, cuyes entre otros, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio,  la socia sigue criando a sus animalitos para luego venderlos a sus clientes que le solicitan como amoistades, familiares entre otros, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
Los socios en general agradecen  a quienes forman parte de este sueño y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de cuyes entre otros.
texts.en:
These are the members of the community group Nuevo Amanecer de Mollepata II, located in Mollepata district, belonging to Anta province and the department of Cusco.

Lourdes is one of the members, and continues raising birds and small animals, among them chickens and guinea pigs. She has been working in this business for a long time, and it's going well thanks to the effort she puts into her work every day. Lourdes is continuing to care for small animals in order to sell them to her customers, who include friends, relatives and others. Lourdes wants to keep working in this way in order to continue supporting her family.

As a group the members are grateful to those who have become part of their dream and they promise to make their payments on time.

Lourdes is asking for the loan to buy guinea pigs and other small animals or birds.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs and other small animals.

loans.name: Zhypara

texts.en:
Zhypara has a large family of 9: parents and 6 siblings. Her parents work at the local bazaar. Her two elder sisters are studying on full scholarships at the universities, so her parents are struggling to make ends meet. 

The difficult financial situation of her family became an obstacle for her to get a higher education last year. So her classmates from her school are now sophomores, and Zhypara, having lost one year without funding, is now doing her best to find donors and be a freshman.

She decided not to wait until the day when her parents can afford her education, so she applied for financial aid of AUCA and got it. Now she hopes to get a Kiva loan, which will defer the part of her payment until she graduates. 

Zhypara could go abroad like many people of Kyrgyzstan, to Russia for example, and make quick money. But she remembers her mother’s career path; when she had a Red Diploma in accounting, she had to leave with her husband to Almaty’s bazaar, so that they could repay their loans. After that, she got children and stayed as a house-wife. Zhypara is sorry for her mom, but promised to not repeat her steps and go with her own way as her sisters did.

Zhypara's main dream is to open her own social bank, like Muhammad Yunus, and help people of her country, especially women, to open their own businesses, even while they are at home. Zhypara believes that her studies at AUCA will help her to learn more about world practices and maybe even gather a team of groupmates, who will become her business partners in the future.

loans.use: to pay for her bachelor's degree in economics at AUCA

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
The lady in the photo is Mary—forty one years old, married and blessed with three children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) in 2013.

Mary operates a grocery kiosk where she sells vegetables and fruits such as kale, cabbages, mangoes, oranges and carrots. She benefited from the HiH EA enterprise and financial development training by acquiring skills that help in running and managing her business well.

She is borrowing a Kiva loan to add stock to the business and hence help satisfy her customers' needs and thus maximize her profit. Income from this enterprise will help take care of family basic needs, school fees and medical care. Mary is grateful to Kiva and its lenders and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: To buy vegetables and fruits such as kale, cabbages, mangoes, oranges and carrots.

loans.name: Jose Armide

texts.es:
José, es casado, vive con su esposa y tres hijos, los niños estudian nivel básico, su esposa lo apoya con los gastos de su hogar, ella brinda los servicios de sastre. José se dedica a vender medicina natural y química, así puede aportar para el sostenimiento de su hogar, desarrolla está actividad desde hace 10 años, trabaja en la ciudad, sus dificultades para trabajar en ocasiones es el mal clima y que está expuesto a ser asaltado.
Está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar vitaminas, analgésicos, antibióticos, etc., con estos productos atenderá mejor a sus clientes, pretende que sus ventas y ganancias incrementen para así poder pagar su deuda y disminuir las necesidades de sus seres queridos.
Sus sueños son ampliar más su negocio y establecer un puesto fijo de ventas.
texts.en:
José is married and lives with his wife and three children. His children are in elementary school and his wife supports him with household costs with her work as a tailor. José works selling natural and chemical medicine to contribute financially to his household. He has done this work for ten years and works in the city. Sometimes work challenges are bad weather and being susceptible to robberies.

He is requesting a loan to buy vitamins, painkillers, antibiotics, etc. and with these products better serve his clients. He hopes that his sales and earnings will increase so that he can pay off his loan and meet the needs of his loved ones.

He dreams of expanding his business and establishing a permanent stall for his business.

loans.use: to buy vitamins, painkillers, antibiotics, etc. and with these products better serve his clients.

loans.name: Barno

texts.ru: Барно  доброжелательная и красивая женщина, ей 49 лет. Она замужем и у неё трое детей. Барно живет вместе со своей семьёй  в городе  Истаравшан. Барно по профессии швея. Он шьет национальные платья и шторы. Всё что она зарабатывает расходуется на содержание семьи. У неё нет возможности накопить денег для других более перспективных целей. Её муж находится на заработках в России. В данное время Барно вместе со своим мужем хотят отремонтировать дом, где они живут, чтобы улучшить условия для проживания. Но собственных средств у них недостаточно. Для этого Барно обратилась в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку строительных материалов для ремонта дома. Она надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Barno is a benevolent and beautiful woman. She is 49 years old, married, and has 3 children. Barno lives with her family in the city of Istaravshan. Barno is a seamstress by trade. She sews traditional women's dresses and curtains.

Everything that Barno earns, she spends on supporting her family. She does not have the ability to save money for any long-term goals. Her husband is a migrant worker in Russia.

At the moment, Barno and her husband want to repair the house where they live, so that they can improve their family's living conditions. However, their own funds are not enough for this. Therefore, Barno has applied to MDO Arvand to receive a loan to purchase building materials to repair her house. She hopes for a positive outcome and is thankful in advance to MDO Arvand for the support.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy ingredients for provisions

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
The person in the photo is Margaret, sixty three years old, married and blessed with four children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) in 2013.

Margaret operates a retail kiosk, selling household goods like flour, sugar, cooking fat and other items. She has gone through Hand in Hand Eastern Africa training (HiH EA), which has enabled her acquire skills on enterprise and financial management. She is borrowing a Kiva loan to expand her business by adding more stock. This will attract more customers, hence more income. She will use the anticipated income to educate her children, provide medical care and meet family needs.

She is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for their support and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: To buy more stock of flour, sugar and cooking fat that will improve sales, thus more income.

loans.name: Sobirjon

texts.ru:
Собирчону 52 года. Он женат и у него 5 детей. Собирчон работает в основном сварщиком, но умеет делать еще много других видов строительных работ. Его работа является сезонной и доход в семью поступает не полный год. Поэтому Собирчон берется за все виды работы, чтобы зарабатывать больше и прокормить всю свою большую семью. Ему хочется, чтобы все его дети получили хорошее образование, и поэтому он откладывает деньги на оплату обучения детей. 
Собирчон хочет получить кредит для установки пластиковых окон и дверей. Зимы в нашей стране очень холодные и суровые. Вся его семья часто болеет, много денег уходит на покупку лекарств и он не может скопить достаточную сумму. Собирчон обратился в МДО Арванд с надеждой что наша организация поможет ему с финансовой поддержкой. Он заранее благодарит за поддержку и доверие.
texts.en:
Sobirjon is 52 years old. He is married and has 5 children. Sobirjon generally works as a welder, but he knows how to do many more types of construction work. His work is seasonal, so his family has an income for only part of the year. Therefore, Sobirjon has been learning different types of work so he can earn more and feed his entire family throughout the year. He wants his children to receive good educations, so he is setting aside money to pay for his children's tuition.

Sobirjon wants to receive a loan to install plastic windows and doors. Winters in our country are very harsh and cold. His entire family often gets sick, and a lot of money is getting spent to buy medicine, so he can't save enough money. Sobjirjon has applied to MDO Arvand in the hopes that our organization will help him with financial support. He is thankful in advance for the support and trust.

loans.use: to install plastic doors and windows.

loans.name: Emom

texts.ru: Эмом 27 летный житель района Файзабад. Он счастливый отец одного 4 летного ребенка. Он живет вместе отцом, матерью, братиком, женой и ребенком. Эмом обожает проводить время вместе с семьей, но не забывает о своем бизнесе. Эмом вместе с братиком имеют не большой бизнес. Они занимаются пчеловодством. От продажи меда они зарабатывают на жизнь. Эмом хочет расширить бизнес и по этой причине обратился за кредитом. Он планирует увеличить пчелиные ульи. Для этой операции нужны средства и он надеется, что ее поддержат. Эмом заранее выражает свою благодарность.
texts.en:
Emom is a 27-year-old resident of the Fayzabad region. He is the happy father of one 4-year-old child. He lives with his father, mother, younger brother, wife and child. Emom loves spending time with his family, but he doesn't forget about his business.

Emom and his brother have a small business. They are beekeepers. They earn their living by selling honey. Emom wants to expand the business, so he has applied for a loan. He plans to increase the number of beehives. For this project, they need funds, and Emom hopes that he will find support. Emom expresses his thanks in advance.

loans.use: to increase his number of hives.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana vive felizmente con su esposo y un hijo, depende dos personas económicamente de ella, no cuenta con ayuda de remesas familiares, su negocio es elaborar pupusas para vender, tiene más de 8 años dedicándose a esta actividad, además en la temporada de siembra ella cultiva maíz y frijoles, el oficio lo aprendió de su hermana.
Ella está solicitando ayuda con un crédito para comprar una plancha nueva para hacer pupusas, le será de utilidad para aumentar la productividad de su negocio y atender mucho mejor a sus clientes, espera poder tener mejores ingresos para tener una vida digna junto a su familia.
Su objetivo es saber administrar el crédito y resarcirlo lo más pronto posible.
texts.en:
Juana lives happily with her husband and son. Two people depend on her economically and she does not receive support through remittances from family members. She works making pupusas to sell and has done this work for eight years. Also, during planting season she grows corn and beans, which her sister taught her how to do.

She is requesting a loan to buy a new grill to make pupusas, which she will be useful to increase her business' productivity and better seve her clients. She hopes to have a better income to have a dignified life with her family.

Her goal is to know how to manage the loan and pay it off as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy a new grill to make pupusas which she will be useful to increase her business' productivity and better seve her clients.

loans.name: Wael

texts.en:
Wael is a 48-year-old married man from Rafah city, which is located in the Gaza Strip. He works as an employee in the public sector, where he receives a low income. This income barely covers all the family needs, but he wants to make his family more comfortable and improve their standard of living.

Wael took a loan from FATEN, which will enable him to buy a solar system to heat water for the family house. By taking this loan, Wael will be able to decrease the electricity expenses and at the same time use a cleaner form of energy (solar rather than gas). Wael’s family will have an easier time heating water for showers, cooking, and washing clothes and dishes.

loans.use: to buy a solar system to heat water for the family house.

loans.name: Farhod

texts.ru:
Фарходу 22 года. Он учится на архитектора в университете. После учебы он подрабатывает продавцом на базаре, для того чтобы покрыть свои расходы и плату за обучение. Он еще частично помогает своим родителям. Но его доходы очень малы. Ему даже приходилось на время прекратить учебу, так как ему не хватало средств оплатить учебу. Он хочет стать дипломированным специалистом и получить хорошую работу, чтобы в будущем обеспечить свою семью. 
Он учиться на последнем курсе и в этом году он заканчивает учебу. На данный момент у него нет всей суммы денег для оплаты обучения, поэтому он обратился в МДО Арванд за финансовой помощью. Фарход надеется, что МДО Арванд окажет ему помощь. Заранее благодарит за поддержку и доверие.
texts.en:
Farhod is 22 years old. He is studying architecture at the university. After classes, he works part time as a salesperson at the bazaar so that he can cover his expenses and pay his tuition. He also helps his parents. However, his income is very small. He even had to stop studying for a while, because he didn't have the means to pay his tuition. He wants to become a qualified specialist and get a good job, so that in the future he will be able to support his family.

He is in his final year of school, and this year he will graduate. At the moment he doesn't have the entire sum of money he needs to pay tuition, so he has applied to MDO Arvand for financial support. Farhod hopes that MDO Arvand will give him assistance. He is thankful in advance for the support and trust.

loans.use: to pay his education costs.

loans.name: Laxmi

texts.en:
Laxmi hails from Kandi. She is a 31-year-old married woman and the mother of a son. She lives in a small village in Murshidabad district, West Bengal. Laxmi received a secondary level education. She is a hardworking and active woman whose main objectives are to get economic security through her small enterprise and develop her family's livelihood. Her husband works in a small company, earning a very meager income. Her son is a student in grade five. She is engaged in her own animal husbandry business where she raises cows.

For the last two years, Laxmi has been running her milk-selling business with the help and support of her husband. She sells milk and cow dung to her neighbors and her earnings give good financial support to her family. She decided to increase her family income by selling more milk and cow dung. So she requested a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner).

With this loan money, she will purchase a dairy cow. Through this, she hopes that she will definitely generate a handsome amount of extra income by selling her products on a huge scale. She has a dream of saving enough for a better education for her son.

Laxmi is very much grateful to her lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow for her milk-selling business.

loans.name: Madhabi

texts.en:
Madhabi is a very hardworking woman who hails from Falakata. She is married and is a mother of one lovely, adorable son. She is 49 years old. Her husband Shambhu is engaged in a small tin business. Her son works in a small private company.

Madhabi's husband has no fixed income from his business, so it is very difficult to run the family. To earn extra income, Madhabi has been doing dairy farming for the past five years. She raises cows and her source of income is milk selling. Through this, she has managed to earn a decent and honest income.

Madhabi is planning to expand her business by selling more milk and cow dung to her neighbors and around the market. Cow dung is also in demand in the rural areas as manure for farming but the main challenge she is facing is the lack of funds. That is why she is kindly requesting a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner) to buy a dairy cow.

Madhabi will be able to produce more milk to sell and acquire more income for her family. She hopes to be able to secure her family's economy and improve her family’s living conditions. With the outcome profit, she dreams of purchasing more cows for her business in the future.

She is very much grateful to her lenders.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow for her milk supply business.

loans.name: Jhuma

texts.en:
Twenty-year-old Jhuma is a hardworking lady from Kandi in Murshidabad district in West Bengal. She is residing with her husband and their only toddler son. She is a housewife and looks after her family.

Jhuma's husband has been running a small grocery store by selling daily needed items like rice, oil, soap, shampoo, biscuits, tea, sugar, etc., for the last two years. Right now, her husband's business in not going well, so he is earning a small income. With this income, they cannot cope with their family expenses.

Due to a lack of capital funds, her husband cannot purchase more grocery items for his store to attract more customers. Financial help will help him to expand his business and enhance his earning capacity. This is why Jhuma is requesting a loan from BJS, Kiva's partner, with an aim to expand the business.

She wants to purchase sufficient stock for her husband’s grocery store, like more variety of rice, pulses, oil, soap, shampoo, biscuits, tea, sugar, toffees, etc. Jhuma believes she will earn more income after this investment to manage her family expenses smoothly and expand the business.

Jhuma thanks her lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase stock for the grocery store.

loans.name: Sabita

texts.en:
Sabita is an inhabitant of Chuyakhola, a small village in Falakata, Alipurduar district of West Bengal. She is 34 years old and resides with her husband and two children (one son and two daughters). All her children are students.

Sabita and her husband prepare raw materials for making plywood from the tender wood of the forest and sell them to the plywood manufacturing mills to earn a livelihood. The main source of income for her family is the business of supplying the raw materials for plywood manufacturing. Her husband purchases wood and cuts it into thin sheets and supplies it to the plywood manufacturing mills. All this is done by him with the active help of Sabita.

In spite of regular earnings, they are not able to improve their source of revenue. They want to overcome this situation by expanding the business, and that is why she needs capital to purchase logs of wood in bulk for this business. So Sabita has applied for a loan from Kiva through BJS.

She is very much hopeful that this investment will enable her to supply the raw materials for making plywood on a large scale and fetch more income to develop her family’s financial condition, provide a good education to her children and fulfill her dream of purchasing a Toto (a battery-operated auto rickshaw) for another means of income.

Sabita expresses her gratitude to her lenders.

loans.use: to purchase more logs for her husband's business.

loans.name: Awad

texts.en:
Awad is a 31-year-old, married man from Rafah city, which is located in the Gaza Strip. He works as an employee in the public sector, where he gets a low income. This income barely covers all the family needs, but he wants to make his family more comfortable and improve their standard of living.

So, Awad took a USD loan from FATEN, which will enable him to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house. By taking this loan, Awad will be able to decrease the electricity expenses, while using a cleaner form of energy (rather than gas). Awad’s family will have an easier time heating water for showers, cooking, and also washing clothes and dishes. Awad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house.

loans.name: Fulkumari

texts.en:
Fulkumari is a 31-year-old, rural housewife and a mother of two daughters and a toddler son. She lives with her husband and children in a small village, Nandi Baneswar in Kandi. Her daughters are students of grade 9 and 7. She is an adept homemaker and a lovely mother.

Fulkumari's husband makes furniture such as beds, wooden racks, chairs, shelves and tables, etc., as per customers' orders. In order to construct the furniture, he requires materials such as logs of wood, nails, plywood, paint, glues and good modern tools. So Fulkumari wants to invest money to buy logs of wood in bulk and all the required materials for enhancing the carpentry work.

With the hope of improving their present economic situation, Fulkumari is requesting a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to buy those needed materials. This will allow her husband to handle the requests from his clients and supply the orders in time. She also hopes that this business will generate enough income to offer them a better quality of life. Her dream is to build a concrete house in the future for her family.

She expresses her gratitude to her lenders.

loans.use: to purchase good quality logs of wood and necessary tools for her husband's carpentry business.

loans.name: Basheer

texts.en:
Basheer is a 40-year-old married man from Rafah city, which is located in the Gaza Strip. He works as an employee in the public sector, where he gets a low income. This income barely covers all the family needs, but he wants to make his family more comfortable and improve their standard of living.

So, Basheer took a USD loan from FATEN, which will enable him to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house. By taking this loan, Basheer will be able to decrease the electricity expenses, while using a cleaner form of energy (rather than gas). Basheer’s family will have an easier time heating water for showers, cooking, and also washing clothes and dishes. Basheer appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house.

loans.name: Asima

texts.en:
Asima is a 49-year-old hardworking woman who lives in the small village of Kandi, West Bengal with her husband and three sons. Her daughter is married. She is a mother of four children (three sons and one daughter). All of the sons are involved in painting houses. Her husband works as a small contractor.

Besides doing all the household chores, Asima wants to be independent. So she started a puffed rice business five years ago. Puffed rice is a very popular snack in most of the rural areas. She purchases the rice, makes the puffed rice and sells it in her locality and the local market. Now she is confident about it and her strong determination provides the courage for her to continue the business and become an entrepreneur. Now Asima wants to expand the business so that she can generate more profit. Thus, she seeks a loan from BJS (Kiva’s field partner).

Asima will purchase more rice for her business with this loan so that she can earn a good profit from her business by satisfying the demands of her customers. She conveys her heartiest thanks to Kiva and BJS for their kind support.

loans.use: to purchase more rice for her puffed rice business.

loans.name: Laxmi

texts.en:
Laxmi is a woman of 32 years who lives in Falakata with her husband and two sons. She has a primary level education, and her husband studied up to 9th grade. Both her sons are receiving education and read in grade 6 and grade 4, respectively. They live at a remote village of Falakata in West Bengal.

Her husband is a farmer by profession. He cultivates different kinds of vegetables, crops, fruits, etc., to sell in the local market. They are from a humble family of scarce economic resources, and that is why Laxmi's husband has been working with agriculture for many years.

Due to their low income, Laxmi is facing problems to manage her family expenses and their sons’ educational costs properly. Her husband is struggling hard all day, but fails to earn according to the expectation. So to earn more profits, they have decided to cultivate paddy (rice) in large quantity because it has a huge demand in the markets. So Laxmi has requested a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase seeds, fertilizers and pesticides for cultivating paddy in the same field to increase the family income.

She is very ambitious and hopeful that she will succeed in her target of fulfilling the villagers' great demand for paddy, it being the staple food. She hopes to upgrade her family's financial status with the profit of their business.

She is thankful to BJS and Kiva for the loan.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies for paddy cultivation.

loans.name: Payel

texts.en:
Payel is a 27-year-old, married woman from Kandi. She is married to Udaybhanu, who is engaged with a medicine business. They are raising their only son who is a kid.

Being a housewife, she takes care of her animal husbandry after doing all her household chores.

Her husband’s income is totally spent on household basic needs, and nothing is left for their savings. To give financial support to her family, Payel started her own milk-selling business and has done it for the last two years. She takes great care of her cow and sells cow milk to her neighbors, as well as dairy shops in the local market.

She wants to buy one dairy cow along with its fodder like straw, husks, etc., to increase her income through milk production. It will also help in getting cow dung, which she can sell as fertilizer to the farmers.

With the aim to expand this business, Payel seeks to take a loan from Kiva's partner BJS to buy a dairy cow. She is expecting an increase in her monthly income. With the increased income and savings, Payel wants to strengthen the family economy and dreams to provide better education to her son.

She is thankful to her generous lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow for her milk-selling business.

loans.name: Anima

texts.en:
Anima is 18 years old and a rural woman from a small village of Kandi. She is very enthusiastic in nature. Besides managing her household, she is involved with sewing work so that she can become self-dependent and contribute to the family. Her husband, Sujit, is a house painter by profession who is engaged with painting work on houses.

Sujit takes contracts for house painting from his village as well as nearby villages. He is very efficient in his field so he has a lot of demand for his painting work. He strives hard to make more profit from his business, but now he needs to invest money to expand his business and increase the profit to overcome the financial hurdles. But money is the main hindrance; thus, Anima takes the step to help her husband by applying for a loan from Kiva via BJS.

After having the loan they will purchase branded paint colors, brushes, and other tools so that her husband can get more contracts for painting houses. Anima hopes this loan will give a boost in this business.

Anima and her husband convey their heartiest thanks to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase varieties of paint colors and other necessary tools for her husband's house-painting business.

loans.name: Noureen

texts.en:
Noureen is 24 years old and the mother of a son. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been running a food stall, where he sells different types of edible items e.g samosa, vegetable rolls, chicken tikka, Kabab paratha, etc. Her husband is the only one responsible for feeding the entire family and managing the household.

Noureen's husband needs to purchase different types of eatables and other items for his business purpose so that he can increase the size of his business, improve his sales growth and earn the maximum profit. But due to his unfavorable financial position, her husband is not in a condition to purchase these items for his business purpose.
Therefore, Noureen has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan so that she can help her husband to purchase the above items.

She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's food stall business.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a 42-year-old married man with seven children living in Masindi, Uganda. He deals in selling dry foodstuffs and has been in this business since 2006. He has high hopes of educating his children and looking after his entire family.

Charles requests a loan to buy rice, millet, dry cassava and maize to sell so that he can serve the people more. His business is affected by constant price changes yet he stocks too much, expecting to make big sales.

loans.use: to buy rice, dry cassava, maize and millet to sell.

loans.name: Ena

texts.fr: Ena est une femme mariée qui vit à Tokoin avec ses deux enfants à charge. Ena est âgée de 28 ans et  s’active parfaitement  pour avoir une bonne situation financière. Ena est une revendeuse de pagnes qui s’approvisionne une fois par mois au marché et le revend en parcourant les quartiers. Pour atteindre ses objectifs, Ena demande ce prêt pour commander des pièces de pagnes afin de répondre favorablement aux attentes de ses clients et avoir une bonne marge bénéficiaire pour aider ses enfants dans leur éducation scolaire.
texts.en:
Ena is twenty-eight years old, married and has two children in her care. She lives in Tokoin and works hard to earn a good living. She sells pagnes (traditional wrap-around clothing) which she buys once a month from the market. She then sells them on foot in the local area.

In order to achieve her goals, Ena has requested this loan to buy more pagnes to meet the needs of her customers. This will earn her a good profit and enable her to support her children with their education.

loans.use: to buy pagnes (traditional, wrap-around clothing).

loans.name: Aïcha

texts.fr: Aïcha est âgée de 43 ans et est une femme mariée. Aïcha vit avec ses cinq enfants à charge à Tokoin où elle prépare de la bouillie faite à base du maïs pour ses consommateurs qui en trouvent satisfaction dans son activité. Aïcha s’approvisionne une fois par mois au marché et désire commander des bols de maïs et de sucre afin de gagner une bonne marge bénéficiaire pour ainsi promouvoir l’éducation de ses enfants et bien réorganiser son commerce.
texts.en:
Aïcha is forty-three years old, married and has five children in her care. She lives in Tokoin and makes and sells maize porridge for her customers. She buys her supplies once a month from the market.

Aïcha has requested this loan to buy bowls of maize and sugar to earn her a good profit and enable her to support her children with their education and reorganise her business.

loans.use: to buy 200 bowls of maize and 20 bowls of sugar.

loans.name: Adoh

texts.fr: Adoh est une femme mariée âgée de 40 ans qui vit à Tokoin. Ayant trois enfants à charge, Adoh   s’efforce  pour gagner son revenu  en revendant des produits d’alimentations générales. Pour s’approvisionner Adoh se rend une fois par mois au marché. Pour commander des paniers de tomates fraîches, des plateaux d’œufs et des sacs de riz, Adoh nécessite ce fonds pour financer son approvisionnement. Avec la marge bénéficiaire qui en résultera, Adoh va pouvoir aider son mari dans les charges quotidiennes de la famille et favoriser l’éducation scolaire de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Adoh is forty years old, married and has three children in her care. She lives in Tokoin and works hard to earn a good living. She sells general food products which she buys once a month from the market.

Adoh has requested this loan to buy baskets of fresh tomatoes, trays of eggs and sacks of rice. This will earn her a good profit and enable her to help her husband pay the day-to-day expenses of their family, and support her children with their education.

loans.use: to buy 5 baskets of fresh tomatoes, 50 trays of eggs and 2 sacks of rice.

loans.name: Abra

texts.fr: Mère de deux enfants, Abra est une femme divorcée âgée de 49 ans habitant à Tokoin. Abra est une revendeuse de bananes torréfiées qu’elle achète six fois par mois au marché  et les revendent au bord de la route non loin de son domicile. Abra sollicite ce prêt pour commander des sacs de bananes plantains afin d’augmenter son stock puis gagner plus de bénéfices en vue de soutenir sa famille dans les différentes charges et permettre une bonne éducation à ses enfants.
texts.en:
Abra is forty-nine years old, divorced and mother to two children. She lives in Tokoin and sells grilled bananas. She buys her supplies six times a month from the market. She then sells them at the roadside, not far from her home.

In order to increase her stock levels, Abra has requested this loan to buy more sacks of plantain bananas. This will earn her a good profit, enable her to pay various expenses for her family and provide her children with a good education.

loans.use: to buy 2 sacks of plantain bananas.

loans.name: Yawa

texts.fr: Agée de 30 ans, Yawa est une femme mariée et mère d’un enfant vivant ensemble à Tokoin. Pour soutenir sa famille, Yawa vend des mèches et tissages et s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au marché. Yawa réalise sa rentabilité dans son activité et pour bien satisfaire aux besoins de ses clients, Yawa désire ce prêt pour commander des douzaines de mèches et des unités de perruques afin d’agrandir son stock puis bien vendre et aider son enfant dans son éducation scolaire et à couvrir les besoins quotidiens de la famille.
texts.en:
Yawa is thirty years old, married and mother to one child. She lives in Tokoin and sells hair extensions and weaves which she buys three times a month from the market. She earns a good living.

In order to satisfy the needs of her customers, Yawa has requested this loan to buy dozens of hair extensions and wigs to increase her stock levels. This will earn her a good profit, enable her to support her child's education and pay for the day-to-day needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy 8 dozen hair extensions and 13 wigs.

loans.name: Rebeca Antonia

texts.es:
Los números y la honestidad, son grandes fuertes de Rebeca, una joven de 25 años de edad, que desde secundaria decidió que se profesionalizaría en Contabilidad Pública y Auditoria. Durante toda su carrera, siempre ha contado con el apoyo de su madre, quien es ama de casa y de su padre, quien es chofer. 
Rebeca tuvo la oportunidad de hacer pasantías en una empresa privada, donde le permitieron quedarse trabajando como secretaria ejecutiva, hace más de un año. Ahora quiere optar a un mejor puesto, acorde a lo estudiado, por lo que solicita un préstamo para pagar su curso de titulación y su diploma, de manera que tendrá la oportunidad de aplicar a la plaza de contabilidad en la misma empresa. En sus planes está llegar a estudiar una maestría para seguir adquiriendo mayores conocimientos.
texts.en:
Numbers and honesty are the great strengths of Rebecca, a young person of 25 years. After high school she decided to professionalize in Public Accounting and Auditing. Throughout her career, she has always had the support of her mother, who is a housewife, and her father, who is a driver.

Rebeca had the opportunity to do some internships in a private company, where she has been allowed to stay on as an executive secretary for more than a year now. Presently she wants to qualify for a better job, reflecting her studies, which is why she is requesting a loan to pay for her degree program and diploma. That way she will have the opportunity to apply her new skills in accounting with the same company. She plans to study to the Master level to continue acquiring more knowledge.

loans.use: to pay for her degree program.

loans.name: Tom

texts.en:
Being as a fish seller, Tom, who is 42-year-old married woman, can only make 7 USD per day to support her family. Tom is living with two children in the community of Khsach Kandal District, Kandal Province, Cambodia. Until now, she has been involved in this small business for nearly fifteen years.

Tom would like to get a Kiva loan now in order to build a hygienic latrine in her house, since she has never had it before. She is very happy with this loan as it will promote good health, environmental and living standards in her house. Tom would like to thank all of her lenders for their generosity in providing such a great loan for poor people like her.

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine

loans.name: Ihab

texts.en:
Ihab is a 21-year-old single man from Rafah city, which is located in the Gaza Strip. He works as an employee in the public sector, where he gets a low income. This income barely covers all of his family's needs, but he wants to make his family more comfortable and improve their standard of living.

Ihab took a USD loan from FATEN, which will enable him to buy a solar-powered system for heating water for the family house. By taking this loan, he will be able to decrease electricity expenses, while using a cleaner form of energy (rather than gas). Ihab’s family will have an easier time heating water for showers, cooking, and also washing clothes and dishes. 

Ihab appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a solar-powered system to heat water in his family's house.

loans.name: Yehowa Akwe Group

texts.en:
Gifty is a member and the leader of the group, Yehowa Akwe (Jehovah sees). She lives together with her family: husband and children. She started her business with the first loan she got from ID Ghana. The Yehowa Akwe group is into the sale of silver products, pepper, rice, plastic chairs, tables, ice chests, foodstuffs and other provisions. Gifty and her group are from the city of Teshie, Accra, one of the poor urban areas in the country. The area's economy depends mostly on trade and fishing. 

Gifty is receiving her 10th loan from ID Ghana. Each previous loan has been repaid satisfactorily, and she has made good investments. She is currently selling ice chests, plastic chairs and tables. She is planning to use the new loan to increase her inventory.

Gifty will save her profits because she wants to improve on her business and her family. Her favorite pastime is to do business, and her main challenge is to live in a safe home.

She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: to buy an ice chest, plastic chairs and tables, which she will sell to her customers.

loans.name: Villa Quiquijana Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “VILLA QUIQUIJANA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Quiquijana perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis

La socia es la Sra. Augusta ella es casada y tiene 48 años y tiene 3 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, leche y galletas, la socia por medio de este negocio quiere salir adelante, la socia es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar arroz, azúcar, leche y galletas.

La persona que sale con la cara tapada no pertenece al banco comunal Villa Quiquijana.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de animales, negocio de venta de granos, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurant.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the community bank Villa Quiquijana. This bank is located in the Quiquijana district, which belongs to the Quispicanchis province.

The member Señora Augusta is 48 years old, married, and has 3 children. She works by managing her grocery store, where she sells basic consumer goods such as rice, sugar, milk, and cookies.

The member strives to move forward by way of this business. She is an enterprising and hard-working woman whose dream is to expand her business. She is applying for this loan to buy rice, sugar, milk, and cookies.

The person whose face is covered does not belong to the community bank Villa Quiquijana.

The other members do business by selling animals, grains, managing grocery stores, and managing restaurants.

The member is very grateful to those who help her reach her dream and she promises to make all of her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, milk, and cookies

loans.name: Renante

texts.en:
Renante earns a living by way of gathering tuba (coconut) wine. He sells tuba wine to the locals in his place. Aside from coconut-wine vending, he engages in animal husbandry. He raises and sells pigs and goats. He is a married man with ten children. His oldest was 19 while the youngest is one.

Renante decided to avail the loan to boost his sources of income. He is asking for a loan to purchase piglets and goats and pay for school fees.  With these, he would be able to improve his earnings and help the studies of his children. Eventually, he can start to improve and seek ways to expand his earnings to become more sustainable.

loans.use: to purchase piglets and goats and pay for school fees.

loans.name: Hayat

texts.en:
Hayat is a Lebanese woman living with her son in Beirut. She is divorced and owns a clothing shop as her only source of income. Hayat's son is an employee in one of Beirut's malls, which allows him to help his mom with the household expenses. She opened her business in 2013, and since that time, Hayat has been working on developing her project to improve her work. Hayat has 15 years' experience in the retail field. 

For the first time, Hayat is asking for a loan of 1,337,000 Lebanese pounds from Kiva's partner Ibdaa to buy a new clothing collection for the Eid season. Hayat believes that she will attract more clients with her new collection, especially in this period. Her priority right now is to boost her shop's sales, increase her income and improve her living situation.

Hayat is well known in the area where she lives; and most importantly, she has a very good reputation among her clients and suppliers.

loans.use: to buy a new collection of clothes.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 30 years old and is married with three children living in Masindi-Uganda. He deals in the motorcycle transportation (boda boda) business, a very lucrative type of business employing many people in his area, which makes him happy. He has managed to look after his family with the income he gets from this business. Joseph has high hopes of educating his children and owning a good house. 

From his business, he has managed to save some money to buy land, though it is not enough, and he now requests a loan to top up and buy land for settlement.

loans.use: to buy land for settlement.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Hello! Meet Eunice (pictured above) from the Kitale area of Kenya, an area that is very fertile. Eunice is 37 years old and a proud mother of angel-looking children whom she really adores and cherishes. Other than doing some small business, Eunice is a very hardworking farmer who has been farming for the past five years. She has gained so much experience through those years of farming. Eunice practices mixed farming. That is, she grows maize and keeps dairy cows, and through these activities she has been able to earn a decent and honest income. Because of the passion she has for farming, she has even nicknamed one of her cows. She really enjoys taking care of her cows. 

Although Eunice has been making profits through farming, not everything has been easy for this humble and industrious mum. Her farm has not been producing as much of a harvest because of the lack of fertilizer and good seeds and the presence of pests and diseases. That is why she is seeking a loan to buy farm implements. Through the loan, Eunice will be assured of a bumper harvest, and this will translate into more profits and cash. Through the use of good seeds and fertilizer, she will increase her profit margins. Through this loan, Eunice will be able to expand her farming business. 

She sees a lot of room for improvement and growth. What is lacking is the capital to drive the positive change. With your loan, Eunice will make enough income to take care of her family and other farming expenses. She wakes up early and goes to sleep very late every day to give her family a decent living and afford her children proper education. Eunice has many dreams. The main one is to make her farming business successful so that one day her children can inherit it and keep it so they have something to provide for themselves. You can help Eunice to accomplish this dream and all her goals with just a loan.

loans.use: to buy farm implements.

loans.name: Wiñay Kury Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “WIÑAY KURY”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Flor ella es soltera y tiene 20 años; La socia trabaja en su negocio de ganaderia, la socia los hace engordar y crecer a los ganados y luego los vende en las diferentes ferias, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia por medio de este trabajo quiere salir adelante, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de ganados. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar un ganado.
El socio que está pegado a la foto grupal se les tomo la foto después de la reunión porque pidio permiso por motivos de trabajo.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de golosinas, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de librería.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the "Wiñay Kury" communal bank, located in the Cusco district, part of the Quispicanchis province and the Cusco department.

One member of the group is 20-year-old Flor, who is single. Flor works at her cattle-raising business where she fattens up and raises cattle before selling the animals at different markets. Flor works from 8am to 6pm. She wants to move forward through this work. Flor's dream is to expand her cattle business. She is applying for this loan in order to buy one animal.

The extra photo in the image was taken after the main meeting as the member could not attend owing to work commitments.

The other members of this group work selling sweets, clothing, groceries and stationery.

Flor is grateful to those who are part of her dream through this loan, and promises to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia was able to buy grocery items for her variety store through the loan assistance she has received from CCT four months ago. She’s now able to provide on-demand products to customers which has made her store become more viable. She wants to extend her sincerest appreciation to lenders and to CCT for the financial assistance they’ve provided. She’s now earning about PHP12,000 every month. 

Virginia plans a lot of things for her family. She aims to have complete sets of products to sell from her variety store and to earn more profit daily. She dreams of being able to give her children a good life in the future by giving them the best education they can acquire. To make this happen, Virginia is applying for a new loan that is worth PHP20,000. She’s hoping that CCT will once again approve her loan application, for she believes that this will make a great impact on her business.
