Despite being a busy entrepreneur and housewife as well, Virginia spares time attending CCT group fellowship that consist of 10-15 individuals where she can gain strength and spiritually and where she can hear testimonies from other CCT partners and hear God’s word, study the Word of God, build social relationship with other partners, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for beverages and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Blanca Flora

texts.es:
Blanca, de 32 años de edad, estudio hasta séptimo grado, debido a su situación económica decidió trabajar y no seguir estudiando; es madre soltera de una niña de 10 años de edad y que estudia cuarto grado y en su casa solo vive con su hija y una sobrina. 

Blanca, tiene 4 años de trabajar como sastre, pero también vende tamales dos días por semana, estos oficios los aprendió de su madre, ya que ella hacia ventas cuando era más joven y ella al ver que no tenia otra opción tomo la decisión de preparar ventas y dedicarse a hacer costuras.- Anteriormente, trabajaba en la ciudad como empleada domestica; ahora el lugar a donde sale a vender está a 2 kilómetros de su casa y se transporta a pie y a veces en bus y generalmente sale a vender en la mañana.

Blanca, necesita el crédito para comprar materia prima como maíz, especias, pollo y para comprar verduras para salir a vender en el vecindario, de esa manera podrá tener más ingresos y tener una mejor situación económica que le ayudara a solventar los gastos de su familia.

Los sueños de Blanca, son que su hija sea una profesional y mejorar la casa donde vive.
texts.en:
Blanca is 32 years old and has a seventh-grade education. Owing to her financial situation, Blanca decided to stop studying and begin working. Blanca is single mother to a ten-year-old girl who is in fourth grade at school. Blanca lives with just her daughter and one niece.

Blanca has been working as a seamstress for four years, but also sells tamales two days per week. She learned these trades from her mother, who sold goods when she was younger. Seeing as she had no other options, Blanca decided to sell goods and work as a seamstress. Previously she worked as a domestic servant in the city. She now goes out to sell her products just two kilometres from her home. Working usually in the morning, she arrives there on foot or, at times, by bus.

Blanca needs this loan in order to buy supplies such as corn, spices and chicken, and vegetables to go out and sell in the neighbourhood. She can thus earn a higher income and improve her financial situation. This will help her to cover family expenses.

Blanca's dreams are that her daughter learn a profession, and to make improvements to her home.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as corn, spices and chicken, and vegetables to go out and sell in the neighbourhood.

loans.name: Rohi

texts.en:
Rohi is a 32-year-old active borrower of Kiva and BRAC Pakistan. She is a mother of two children and her husband has been running an auto spare parts shop for past 12 years.

Rohi wants to expand the size of her husband's business so that her husband can fulfill the demands of his daily customers and provide better reselling services of auto spare parts, but due to financial problems he is not in such a position to bear these expanses.

Therefore, she has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable him to afford all relevant expanses in the expansion of his business and buy the above relevant items to fulfill his customers' needs. For this financial assistance, Rohi is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's spare parts business.

loans.name: You Light Up My Life - N11Tphúcnlộc Group

texts.en:
Mrs Hân is 36 years old and married with three children. She has been operating a food stall selling seafood for more than 10 years.

Hân lives in Hau Loc district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in the village; moreover, this region often suffers from natural disasters such as storms because it is near the sea. So the price and the amount of seafood she can collect from the fishermen is unstable.

The main hardship that Hân faces is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more fresh seafood to resell. This is Hân's first loan with Thanh Hoa Microfinance institution. She hopes that this loan will improve her living standard.

She is the group leader of the "You light up my life - N11TPhúcNLộc", which consists of six members.

In the future, Hân hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to study well in school.

loans.use: To purchase more fresh seafood to resell

loans.name: Sami

texts.en:
Sami is a 39-year-old married man from Rafah city, which is located in the Gaza Strip. He works as an employee in the public sector, where he gets a low income. This income barely covers all the family needs, but he wants to make his family more comfortable and improve their standard of living.

So, Sami took a USD loan from FATEN, which will enable him to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house. By taking this loan, Sami will be able to decrease the electricity expenses, while using a cleaner form of energy (rather than gas). Sami’s family will have an easier time heating water for showers, cooking, and also washing clothes and dishes. Sami appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house.

loans.name: Marta Angelica

texts.es: Marta de 40 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella se dedica a la venta de trenzas de ajo desde hace mas de 6 años, vende de manera ambulante por los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa, con lo que obtiene de sus ganancias es como logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella esta solicitando un credito para la compra de mas trenzas de ajo por mayor para continuar con su trabajo y asi poder tener ejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en: Marta is 40-years old and lives in her own house with her family. She has worked selling garlic braids for more than 6 years. She sells on the street in the different markets that are near her house. With the earnings that she gets, she manages to resolve some household expenses. She is asking for a loan to buy more wholesale garlic braids to continue with her work and be able to have a better income.

loans.use: to buy more wholesale garlic braids.

loans.name: Santa Maribel

texts.es:
Santa, de 28 años de edad, estudio hasta primer año de bachillerato, no logro continuar por muchas circunstancias que se le presentaron, en sus familia ella era la mayor de sus hermanos y por esa razón tuvo que trabajar mucho para ayudar a sus padres y a sus hermanos pequeños.- Ahora, está casada, su esposo se dedica a trabajar en estructuras metálicas y a la agricultura, tienen 2 hijos, de 7 y 4 años de edad.

Santa, desde pequeña es muy laboriosa, esto le permitió involucrarse en muchas actividades productivas, tales como la agricultura y la ganadería; actualmente se dedica al comercio de ropa, ella vende en su comunidad y en las zonas cercanas, muchas veces tiene que madrugar para preparar la alimentación de sus hijos y salir a vender la ropa.

Santa, junto a su esposo decidieron solicitar un crédito para cultivar sus alimentos, porque no dispone de recursos económicos para las actividades agrícola, es por eso que está solicitando un préstamo para comprar insumos agrícolas como: semillas, fertilizantes y productos para proteger las plantaciones, esto mejorara grandemente sus condiciones familiares, porque podrán tener el dinero para invertir en sus cultivos y disponer de alimento suficiente para el consumo de su familia.

Santa, quiere aprovechar la época lluviosa para obtener buenas producciones en sus cultivos; además quiere mejorar su vivienda porque la que tiene no reúne las condiciones básicas de seguridad.
texts.en:
Santa is 28-years old. She went to school until the first year of high school. She was not able to continue for many circumstances that happened to her. In her family, she was the eldest of her siblings and for that reason, she had to work a lot to help her parents and her little siblings.

Now, she is married and her husband works with metallic structures and in agriculture. They have 2 children ages 7 and 4. From a young child, Santa has been a very laborious worker which has allowed her to get involved in many productive jobs, such as agriculture and livestock. Currently, she works selling clothing. She sells in her community and in the nearby areas. Many times she has to wake up early to prepare her children's food and go out to sell clothing.

Santa and her husband decided to ask for a loan to grow their food, because they do not have the economic resources for their agricultural jobs. For that reason, they are asking for a loan to buy agricultural supplies such as seeds, fertilizers and products to protect the plantations. This will greatly improve their family conditions because they will be able to have the money to invest in their crops and have sufficient food for the family to eat.

Santa wants to take advantage of the rainy season to get a good production in her crops. She also wants to improve her house because the one that she has does not have basic security.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies such as seeds, fertilizers and products to protect the plantations.

loans.name: Romy

texts.en: Romy earned a living through services. He is a glass and aluminum installer for almost 13 years. He is a married man and a father of three children ages 12, nine and six years old. He is asking a loan to buy glass, aluminum and accessories. In the future, 37 years old Romy wishes to improve his business to enhance their livelihood. Presently, he lives in the town of Carles in Iloilo, Philippines.

loans.use: to buy glass, aluminum and accessories

loans.name: Hayde

texts.en:
Hayde is 59 years old, married and has six children.

Hayde is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Hayde requested a PHP 30000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vaccine, vitamins and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Hayde has been in this business for 25 years now, and has borrowed 7 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vaccine, vitamins and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Evancy

texts.en:
Evancy is 45 years old, married and has six children with four children who are currently in school.

Evancy is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Evancy requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to purchase vitamins and other supplies for her business.

Evancy has been raising livestock for 20 years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Evancy would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase vitamins and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Rosita is 62 years old and has  children who are in school.

Rosita has a food vending business in the Philippines. Rosita requested a PHP 7000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her business such as, rice, oil, sugar, etc..

Rosita has been in this business for 4 years. In the future, Rosita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her business such as, rice, oil, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Makvala

texts.en: Makvala is 59 years old. She is married and lives in Zugdidi district. Makvala is unemployed and wants to start her own business. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables her to get a loan of 1400 USD. With the received credit she will purchase cheese to resell. Makvala will generate income and will be able to improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to begin trade cheese

loans.name: Hisham

texts.en:
Hisham is a 28-year-old, Married man from Jabalia city, which is located in the Gaza Strip. He works as an employee in the public sector, where he gets a low income. This income barely covers all the family needs, but he wants to make his family more comfortable and improve their standard of living.
 So, Hisham took a USD loan from FATEN, which will enable him to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house. By taking this loan, Hisham will be able to decrease the electricity expenses, while using a cleaner form of energy (rather than gas). Hisham’s family will have an easier time heating water for showers, cooking, and also washing clothes and dishes. Hisham appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house

loans.name: Uzinduzi Group

texts.en:
Hellena who is in her early 40's is a married with three children who are still at school. She has been running a beauty salon for eighteen years now. She works from 09am to 09pm daily and is able to make a very good monthly profit.

This will be 4th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to a dryer and a steaming machine  plus other salon products. She has paid back all her loans successfully.  She is happy with the loan and appreciates Kiva for the support of their group. She used the profit to pay school fees,loan repayment,bought a plot of land and covered household expenses. She will use this loan to buy another dryer and up to date  salon products to meet her customer's request. She dreams of owning her own salon shop.

Hellena will share this loan with her loan group Uzinduzi which has two members who will hold each accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy another dryer and up to date salon products to meet her customer's request.

loans.name: Phalla

texts.en:
Being as a farmer, Phalla, who is 43 years old married woman, can only make USD 6 per day to support her family. She is living with three children in a community of Khsach Kandal District, Kandal Province, Cambodia. Until now, she has been involving in this small business for nearly fifteen years.
Phalla would like to get KIVA loan now in order to build a hygienic latrine in her house since she has never had it before. She is very happy with this loan since it will promote good health, environment and living standard in her house. Phalla would like to thank for all lenders for their generosity in providing such a great loan for poor people like her.

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is an 18 year old Lebanese single man who lives with his parents and four siblings still studying. Her father and mother cooperates together with the aim to ensure them a heavy life. Today, he is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to pay the school stationary and to buy a school bag. He is very ambitious and he intends to study harder so as to obtain high grades.

loans.use: to pay the school stationary and to buy a school bag

loans.name: Gie

texts.en:
Gie is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Gie is 41 years old and has three children who are in school.

Gie has a food vending business in the Philippines. Gie requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her business such as, oil, flour, etc..

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Gie has been in this business for 6 years. In the future, Gie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her business such as, oil, flour, etc.

loans.name: Siraji

texts.en: Siraji is a forty nine year old man with six children living in Masindi-Uganda. He a very hard working man who operates a taxi as his major business and he has managed to get the basic necessities of life especially looking after his children. He has high hopes of buying a new car for transportation because the one he has has become costly in terms of repairing due to the poor road network. Siraji requests for a loan to make general repairs of his car. Siraji appreciates Kiva for the funds advanced to him that he used for buying tires for his taxi to replace the worn out ones and it has kept him working for almost two years.

loans.use: to make general repairs on his car, which he uses as a taxi.

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en: Day by day increasing expenditures and not having ability to meet them compelled Shazia to initiate her own business selling animals. She is 29 years old, married woman doing a business of animals’ purchase and sale with the help of her husband for many years. Her business has provided her family with a decent life. She is a mother of 3 children. She is working very hard for providing her family with the basic necessities of life. She has requested a loan of 60000 PKR. She intends to utilize this loan amount to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater more customers. She is confident that she can further expand her business with the help of future loans

loans.use: to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater more customers

loans.name: Sou's Group

texts.en: Sou’s group live in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Sou works as farmer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.	.

loans.name: Muong Phang 33 Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hien, 44, is Thai ethnic lady who has been married and isthe mother of an adult girl and a 11-year-old boy. She lives with her husband and her children in an old small Thai ethnic traditional house. Mrs. Hien, her husband and her daughter all work at agricultural production to earn a living. Indeed, they cultivate rice, breed pig, fish, chicken and duck. Mrs. Hien is complimented by the neighborhood on her diligence and good experience in farming.

This is the second time she has taken out a loan from the Anh Chi Em Program and she will use the loan to buy food to feed the pigs she is raising. She hopes that the pigs will not get disease and grow fast, healthily, then help her reap good benefit.

Mrs. Hien dreams that her family will have a more sufficient and stable life, and her children will have bright future. In the picture, she stands at the first from the right.

loans.use: to buy food to feed the pigs she is raising

loans.name: Al-Majed 50095 Group

texts.en:
Farah is the featured borrower of Al-majed 50095 group, she got along with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, because they have always been neighbors and friends, and they work hard to improve and develop their living.
Farah is the 19-year-old single lady sitting at the far left side of the picture. She works as a sales person in a clothes shop for one year now, in order to make her living and pay for her education expenses.
Her limited monthly income is barely enough to cover her family's increasing living needs.
Thus, for this reason an acquired loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua will be invested in paying for her school tuition fees.
As for the other group members, Elham is the lady at the center with white veil covering her hair, and Layal is the lady at the far right side of the picture.

loans.use: To pay for her school tuition fees

loans.name: Ma. Luz

texts.en: Ma. Luz is a 49-year-old woman who lives in Carles, Iloilo. She is married and a mother of four children. Her oldest child is 21 years old while her youngest child is 13 years old. Her husband is a fisherman while she helps her husband financially through her sari-sari store business. She has been proficient in running this sari-sari store business for 23 years. Thus, she is asking a loan to buy soft drinks, laundry soap, toiletries, mosquito repellent, chips, biscuits, candies, cooking oil, eggs, noodles, spices, sugar, coffee, powdered chocolate drink and juice. She wishes in the future to improve their business to enhance their livelihood.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, laundry soap, toiletries, mosquito repellent, chips, biscuits, candies, cooking oil, eggs, noodles, spices, sugar, coffee, powdered chocolate drink and juice

loans.name: Joylyn

texts.en: Joylin and his family lives in the town of Carles in Iloilo, Philippines. She is 48 years old married woman and has four school aged children ages 18, 17, 16 and 10 years old. Her husband is a chainsaw operator while she helps her husband in doing this business. She is asking a loan to buy additional chainsaw to enhance their livelihood. In the future, she dreams to improve their business for sustainability.

loans.use: to buy a chainsaw for her husband's business.

loans.name: Sopheak's Group

texts.en: Sopheak’s group live in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Sopheak makes a living cultivating rice and raising pigs and she also does extra work as farmer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.	.

loans.name: Azra

texts.en:
Azra is responsible mother of 4 children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transport facilities by driving a taxi for 25 years. Her husband needs to make maintenance of his taxi because the current condition of his taxi is not good and it requires more maintenance charges on a daily basis.

Due to insufficient financial means her husband is unable to make maintenance of his taxi. Therefore Azra has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan.
With the help of this loan Azra's husband can afford the maintenance cost easily. And provide the better transport facilities to earn the profitable income. Azra also plans to make savings with the profit amount of her husband's income to meet her family's needs in future.
Azra is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to repair her husband's taxi.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en: Stella is a repeat borrower to ugafode, She is a married woman with 2 children and a resident of matuga katalemwa. She has applied for a loan of UGX1,500,000 millions to increase stock of her shoe selling business. However she is faced with challenges of low working capital that leads to poor turn up of customers and business.  And she is so hopeful that if financed she will attract more customers for her shoes and is very  grateful with ugafode microfinance and Kiva funds that have helped to boost her business. Her dream is to expand her business as well as educate her children.

loans.use: adding shoe stock to increase her business.

loans.name: Rene

texts.en: Rene is a 55-year-old man from Carles, Iloilo. He is married and has three adult children. He and his wife earn a living by doing the sari-sari store business. They have been doing this for almost 20 years. Aside from this, he also engaged in buying and selling scrap. They work together to enhance their livelihood. Thus, he dreams in the future to buy a motorcycle for easy transportation of his business. As for now, he is asking a loan for additional capital to buy grocery items such as canned goods, noodles, spices, eggs, cooking oil, toiletries, laundry soap, chips, biscuits, bread, candies, sugar, coffee and soft drinks. He also used the money he is asking to buy more scrap to sell.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles, spices, eggs, cooking oil, toiletries, laundry soap, chips, biscuits, bread, candies, sugar, coffee and soft drinks

loans.name: Jehad

texts.en:
Jehad is a 30-year-old, single man from Dier El Balah city, which is located in the Gaza Strip. He works as an employee in the public sector, where he gets a low income. This income barely covers all the family needs, but he wants to make his family more comfortable and improve their standard of living. 

So, Jehad took a USD loan from FATEN, which will enable him to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house. By taking this loan, Jehad will be able to decrease the electricity expenses, while using a cleaner form of energy (rather than gas).  Jehad’s family will have an easier time heating water for showers, cooking, and also washing clothes and dishes.  Jehad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house.

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Pacita is a vendor from Barili, Cebu. She sells ready-to wear items like blankets, towels, shorts, pants, and foot wear like slippers. In addition to that, she raises and sold hogs, as supplemental income. She is married with six children. Her youngest child is 19 and still attending school. Her husband is a tailor.

She is determined to avail the funds, and continue improve her livelihood. She is asking for a loan to purchase more ready-to-wear supplies and piglets. She could able to raise more pigs and in few months to come, her earnings will improve.

Pacita hopes that she will be productive in the years to come and continue to support the schooling of her child.

loans.use: to purchase more ready-to-wear clothing supplies and piglets.

loans.name: Sameera

texts.en:
Sameera is a active borrower of Brac, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is responsible mother of child. Her husband has been running a medical store for past 10 years.
Sameera's husband wants to purchase different types of medicines for reselling purpose, but due to insufficient financial means her husband is not in position to buy these medicines for his business purpose. Therefore Sameera has applied for Kiva loan from BRAC Pakistan. This loan will help her husband to purchase these medicines and enable him to fulfill his business needs, so that her husband can earn profitable income. Her husband also plans to make savings with the income from his business to meet the uncertain events in future.
Sameera is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: increase her husband's pharmacy business with more stock.

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en: Jonathan is 19 years old. He is single and has no child.  His business is motorcycle taxi. He has been in this business for two years. He earns a monthly income of twenty thousand Kenya shillings. This is his first loan from VisionFund Kenya. He will use the loan to buy a motorcycle. He will use the profits from expanded business to save towards buying another motorcycle. His hopes and dreams are to own a fleet of motorcycle taxis.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Thea's Group

texts.en: Thea’s group live in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Thea makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as seller and tailor to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.	.

loans.name: Roberto Antonio

texts.es: Roberto de 32 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, el cliente es electricista se deica a esa actividad desde hace varios años, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar alguno gastos de su hogar, el quiere mejorar su vivienda contruyendo un muro de contencion, pero como no posee suficiente capital esta solicitando a INTEGRAL un credito para para la compra de materiales de construccion y asi poder tener una vivienda segura para su familia.
texts.en: Roberto is 32 years old and lives in his own home with his family. He has been an electrician for several years, and with his earnings, he has been able to pay for some of the upkeep on his home. He wants to improve his house by building a retaining wall, but he doesn't have sufficient capital to do so. Therefore, he is requesting a loan from Apoyo Integral to buy construction materials so that he can have safe housing for his family.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Chanthou's Group

texts.en: Chanthou’s group live in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Chanthou makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as farmer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.	.

loans.name: Maria Manuela

texts.es: Doña Maria de 51 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella posee un molino nixtamal ubicado en su lugar de residencia desde hace 3 años, posee muchos clientes especialmente las señoras que elaboran tortillas ya que ahí llegan a moler el maíz,  adicional a eso también tiene una pequeña tienda, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra cubrir algunos gastos de la casa, la clienta solicita un crédito para comprar lo necesario para el molino como fajas, discos, cuchillas, etc. y así tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en:
Doña Maria, 51, lives in her own home with her family. She has owned a corn mill located at her residence for 3 years. She has a lot of customers, particularly women who make tortillas since they come to her to grind corn. In addition to the mill, she also has a small shop. With the income from her sales she manages to cover some of the household bills.

Doña Maria is asking for a loan in order to buy the things she needs for the mill, such as belts, discs, blades in order to increase her income.

loans.use: to buy belts, discs, blades for her corn mill.

loans.name: Claudette

texts.fr:
23 ans, mariée, Claudette est mère de deux enfants dont le premier qui a 5 ans es scolarisé mais le second non car encore en bas âge. 
Elle exerce avec son mari une activité de boucherie depuis leur mariage en 2009. Avant, elle était femme de ménage ou gens de maison. A part la boucherie, elle démarche aussi des meubles  et des appareils électro-ménager d'occasion.. C'est une femme débrouillarde et travailleuse.
Elle projette de construire sa propre maison car actuellement, elle loue la maison d'habitation. Elle s'efforce de faire des économies.
texts.en: Claudette is 23 years old, married and mother to two children; the elder child, who is five years old, goes to school but the younger is not old enough yet. Claudette has run a butcher's business together with her husband since their marriage in 2009. Before that she was a cleaner or looking after people at home. Apart from the butcher's business, she is also getting into second-hand furniture and electrical household goods. She is a resourceful and hardworking woman, and is planning to build her own house, since presently she rents. She is trying hard to save some money.

loans.use: to buy meat.

loans.name: Dinora Elizabeth

texts.es:
Dinora, de 32 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, debido a su situación económica no pudo seguir estudiando; es madre soltera y tiene un hijo de 14 años de edad que estudia octavo grado.

Dinora, tiene 15 años de ayudar a su padre en los oficios agrícolas, desde pequeña ella acompañaba a su papá al campo, luego poco a poco fue aprendiendo a sembrar frijol, maíz y a fertilizarlos.- El lugar donde trabajan está a 20 minutos de su casa y se transporta a pie.

Dinora, necesita el préstamo para comprar insumos agrícolas como: 3 galones de herbicidas y dos quintales de fertilizantes, específicamente sulfato; el préstamo le ayudara para asegurar buenas cosechas y esto le generar más ganancias para cubrir los gastos de su familia.

Los sueños de Dinora, es que su hijo salga adelante academicamente y también quiere tener su propia vivienda, para estar más cómodos y con más privacidad.
texts.en:
Dinora, 32, studied up to 6th grade, as due to her economic situation she could not continue studying. She is a single mother and has a son who is 14 and studying in the 8th grade.

Dinora has been helping her father with agricultural tasks for 15 years. Since she was small she has gone with her father to the fields and then little by little she learnt how to sow beans, corn and how to fertilise them. The place is 20 minutes from her home and she goes on foot.

Dinora needs this loan in order to buy agricultural supplies such as 3 gallons of weedkiller and 200 lbs of fertilisers, specifically sulphate. The loan will help her to assure good harvests and this will increase her income to cover the household bills.

Dinora's dream is that her son will get ahead academically and she also wants to have her own home to be more comfortable and have more privacy.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies such as weedkiller and fertilisers.

loans.name: Jose Mauricio

texts.es: Jose de 57 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, el se dedica desde hace 4 años a la venta de agua de coco, su negocio lo tiene ubicado a la orilla de la carretera, sus principales clientes son los automovilistas, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el cliente esta solicitando nuevamente un crédito para la compra de mas cocos por mayor ya que ese negocio lo genera buenos ingresos para poder darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Jose is 57-years old and lives in his own home with his family. He has worked for 4 years selling coconut water. His business is located on the side of the road. His main customers are drivers. With the earnings from his sales, he manages to resolve some household expenses. He is asking for a new loan to buy more wholesale coconuts because this business generates a good income for him to be able to give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more wholesale coconuts.

loans.name: Marie Sabine

texts.fr:
Agée de 43 ans, Marie Sabine est mariée. Son mari est un chauffeur de taxi. Les revenus tirés de l’activité de son mari sont saisonniers. Le nombre d’enfants est de trois (22, 16 et 8 ans). Les deux derniers sont encore en classe de seconde et de septième (niveau primaire) dans une école privée. L’ainée participe  également au financement des dépenses de la famille.
Avant 2005, Marie Sabine était vendeuse ambulante de friperies en milieu rural, elle a arrêté cette activité car dans l’ensemble, les ventes étaient  réalisées à crédit. Elle travaillait dans une société en zone franche qui a fermé ses portes. 
L’activité de petite épi-gargote a été commencée en 2005.  Elle n’a pas cessé de chercher les moyens pour développer cette activité. Elle est actuellement à son cinquième prêt. Le prêt servira à acquérir un frigidaire et des produits (jus star et  yaourt )  pour diversifier les produits de l’épicerie gargote. 
Son objectif  est de devenir un grossiste dans le secteur d’activité. La famille prévoit également d’acquérir un véhicule (taxi) pour le mari car actuellement, il loue encore le véhicule. Le rêve de la famille est de pouvoir améliorer leur maison d’habitation.
texts.en:
Marie Sabine is 43 years old and married. Her husband is a taxi driver, and his earnings from this activity are seasonal. They have three children (22, 16 and eight years old). The two younger children are still in second and seventh grade of a private primary school. The eldest contributes to the household expenses.

Prior to 200,5 Marie Sabine sold second-hand clothing on a door-to-door basis in the countryside, but she abandoned this activity because as a rule the sales were made on credit. She also worked in a company in the tax-free zone which closed down. She began her small grocery store/café in 2005 and has not stopped searching for the means to build up this business.

She is now on her fifth loan which will be used to get a refrigerator as well as "star" juice and yogurts, so she can diversify the product base of her grocery store/café. Her aim is to become a wholesaler in this field. The family is also planning to acquire a vehicle (taxi) for her husband, since at the moment he is still renting a taxi. The family's dream is to improve their home.

loans.use: to buy a second-hand refrigerator, healthy drinks, and different brands of yogurts.

loans.name: Javier Alonso

texts.es: Javier es un microempresario de la ciudad de Cartagena de Indias que cuenta con una amplia experiencia en producción de embutidos; actividad que aprendió en el vínculo de su familia quienes por tradición conservan esta herencia ancestral y algunos de ellos se sustentan con el producido de sus microempresas, inclusive tienen puntos en otras regiones del país.   Javier laboró en una empresa donde logró ahorrar su capital, el cual no tardo en invertirlo en su proyecto de negocio que ha sido todo un éxito, los Cartageneros están cautivados con el delicioso sabor de chorizos y butifarras que elabora a base de carnes, condimentos, especias y aderezos que acompañados con bollo de cualquier sabor son la mejor combinación.  Javier desea que su negocio esté más tecnificado y que sus productos puedan conservase mejor, es por ello que está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para comprar una maquina selladora que le permita hacer embalajes de sus productos.  Esta inversión le permitirá acercarse a su meta de implementar mejorar a sus productos, así mismo a futuro está considerando aperturar un local y adquirir equipos que ayuden a agilizar su producción.
texts.en:
Javier is a micro-entrepeneur from the city of Cartagena de Indias, who has extensive experience in producing cold meats. He learnt this trade through his family, who by tradition conserve this ancestral heritage and some of them make a living with the produce of their micro-businesses, including some in other regions of the country.

Javier worked in a company where he managed to save capital, which he soon invested in his business project which has all been a success. The people of Cartagena are captivated with the delicious taste of chorizos and butifarras (a catalan sausage) that he makes from meats, condiments, spices and seasonings. Together with a bread roll of any flavour, they make the best combination.

Javier wants his business to be more technical and also to have his products keep for longer. This is why he is asking for a Kiva loan, which is the first financing he has taken with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. He will buy a sealing machine which will allow him to package his products. This investment will allow him to get closer to his goal of improving his products, and in the future, to open a premises and hire teams that will help to speed up his production.

loans.use: to buy a sealing machine for packaging his products.

loans.name: Nieves

texts.en:
Nieves is a 46-year-old married woman with seven children, ages 7 to 19 years, of whom six are still attending school. Her husband is a construction worker.

Nieves is a merchant residing in the town of Dumanjug, Cebu. She sells rice and corn, which serve as staple foods in her place. She also raises raises pigs and chicken, for additional income.
 
Nieves has requested a loan in the amount of 20,000 PHP to purchase supplies like rice and corn, and livestock like piglets and chickens. With these she could able to maintain the inventory of her stocks. Thus, her income will improve and enable her to pay her obligations.
 
Slowly, Nieves could now start to expand and able to improve her livelihood for improvement of the family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase supplies like rice and corn, and livestock like piglets and chicken.

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es:
Andrea requiere de un nuevo financiamiento para poder comprar granos básicos, jabón, lejía, pan, huevos entre otros productos de la canasta básica, reactivara la tienda con productos que sus clientes necesitan y que le ayudaran a tener ventas e ingreso mayores.
El financiamiento anterior le fue de utilidad para equipar la pupusería y surtir un poco la tienda, actualmente tiene estabilidad económica y ha no presentado problemas para atender su negocio.
texts.en: Andrea needs new funding to be able to buy basic grains, soap, bleach, bread, eggs and other staple items to reactivate the store with products that her customers need. It will help her to have better sales and income. The previous loan was useful to supply her pupusas (stuffed tortillas) shop and to supply the store a little bit. Now she has economic stability and has not had any problems tending to her business.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, soap, bleach, bread, eggs and other staple items to reactivate the store with products that her customers need.

loans.name: Santos Sixto

texts.es:
Sixto, de 40 años de edad, estudio hasta segundo grado, no siguió sus estudios debido a la falta de recursos económicos, está soltero y no tiene hijos, solo vive con su madre y dos hermanos.

Sixto, tiene 18 años de trabajar como jornalero, este oficio lo aprendió con sus padres y sus abuelos, ya que ellos realizaban esta actividad diariamente y él se iba siempre a dejarles los alimentos a las parcelas donde trabajaban. Él decidió seguir en esto porque como no contaba con otra actividad que le generara ingresos para ayudar a sus padres.

Sixto, necesita el préstamo para comprar insumos agrícolas para sus cultivos, como: herbicidas, fertilizantes y pagar mano de obra, que le ayudara a realizar las diferentes labores que requieren los cultivos.- Con la ayuda del préstamo podrá   mejorar sus cosechas y obtener más ganancias para cubrir las gastos de su familia.

Los sueños y aspiraciones de Sixto, son hacer más rentable sus cultivos para tener una mejor calidad de vida, una mejor salud, mejor alimentación y mejor vestuario.
texts.en:
Sixto is 40-years old. He went to school until the 2nd grade but did not continue with his studies due to lack of economic resources. He is single and does not have any children. He lives with his mother and two siblings. Sixto has been working as a day laborer for 18 years. He learned this job from his parents and grandparents, since they used to do this job every day and he would always go give them food at the plot of land where they were working.

Sixto needs the loan to buy agricultural supplies for his crops such as herbicides, fertilizers, and to pay labor. This will help him to do the different jobs that his crops need. With the help from the loan, he will be able to improve his harvests and get more earnings to cover his family's expenses. Sixto's dreams and aspirations are to make his crops more profitable to have a better quality of life, better health, better food, and better clothing.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies for his crops such as herbicides, fertilizers, and to pay labor.

loans.name: Robinah

texts.en:
Robinah is a repeat client in Ugafode microfinance. She has applied for a loan of 1,000,000 UGX. She is a married woman with children.

Robinah is a business woman owning a retail shop. In a bid to increase on her working capital to expand on the business, she has applied for a loan of 1,000,000 UGX to buy stock of rice, corn flour, beverages, toiletries and other items that will meet her customers' demands and also increase her income.

She is at times faced with a challenge of competition and limited capital, but this will soon be a challenge of the past if she gets a financial boost.

She is very grateful for the support Ugafode microfinance and Kiva lenders offered to her since she is now able to fund her business.

Pictured is Robinah with the UGAFODE credit officer in charge of her loan.

loans.use: to buy stock of rice, corn flour, beverages, toiletries and other items

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda has a variety store business in front of her house where she sells grocery items by piece, kilo or volume. She also has a mini food stall business. Erlinda is a hardworking mother who is 40 years of age and a loyal member of Center for Community Transformation (CCT) in Intramuros, Philippines. She has been an entrepreneur for 5 years and earns about 12,000 PHP every month.

Erlinda has started to save money to make other future investments someday. Like other entrepreneurs, she wants to have other sources of income and likewise make her businesses flourish in order to be able to continually support her family. She applied for a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase grocery items for her variety store and raw ingredients needed in her mini food stall. She believes that this will be the start of her business’ growth.

Despite being busy with her businesses, Erlinda uses her spare time attending CCT group fellowship that consist of 10-15 individuals where she can gain strength spiritually and where she hear testimonies from other CCT partners and able to hear God’s word, study the Word of God, build social relationship with other partners, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To add grocery items for her variety store business and daily ingredients for her mini food stall.

loans.name: Rabee

texts.en:
Rabee is a 41-year-old married man from Rafah city, which is located in the Gaza Strip. He works as an employee in the public sector, where he gets a low income. This income barely covers all the family needs.

He wants to make his family more comfortable and improve their standard of living, so Rabee took a USD loan from FATEN, which will enable him to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house. By taking this loan, Rabee will be able to decrease the electricity expenses, while using a cleaner form of energy (rather than gas). Rabee’s family will have an easier time heating water for showers, cooking, and also washing clothes and dishes.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house.

loans.name: Nikki

texts.en:
Nikki was able to fully use her previous loan. She bought a computer, upgraded and repaired her old units and paid for the maintenance cost of her shop. She’s thankful for the financial support and kind consideration of Center for Community Transformation (CCT) and all lenders. As the business grows she’s able to earn PHP 20,000 every month. Youths are mostly her patrons since they rent computers to play online games as well as do projects and homework. 

She works hard in running the business for she dreams to invest and have their own house. Nikki still needs to add another computer to accommodate all of the customers. That is why she applied again for a new loan of PHP 30,000. She’s hoping that the loan will be granted to her again. 

Nikki believes that if you want success to come, you need God to be your greatest foundation. She is consistent in attending a weekly fellowship group for CCT partners that consists of 15 to 30 members where she gains spiritual strength from members' life changing testimony, shares her own experience of God’s love, pays microfinance loans and hears about religion every week.

loans.use: To buy an additional computer unit for her business.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
In December 2014, Ali borrowed 3,083,000 Lebanese pounds from Kiva partner Ibdaa. As planned, he used to loan to buy new collections of clothes for children and women as well as other supplies for his store. As a result, he saw the demand for his products increase as well as his daily income without having to compromise on the quality of the clothes he sells or their prices.

He used to live alone, but now lives with his mother, who is aging and cannot live by herself anymore.

Maintaining his ambition to see the demand in his shop grow, Ali is now asking for another 3,083,000 Lebanese pounds loan to increase once again his stocks with new collections of clothes. In fact, Ali is aiming at boosting his sales during the back-to-school season as he is expecting an increase in demand in the upcoming weeks.

loans.use: to increase his stock of children's clothes.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a forty-three year old married man living in Masindi, Uganda. John's business is making bricks and he enjoys it because it has enabled him to cater for the needs of his family since 2007. He hopes to educate his children and have a better house for his family despite the challenge of seasonal changes - especially too much rainfall - that spoil the bricks. John requests for a loan to buy firewood to help him make more bricks to sell.

loans.use: to buy firewood to help him to make bricks.

loans.name: Fatayat Group

texts.en:
Khayrat is the featured borrower of Fatayat group. She got together with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua because they have always been close friends and they work hard to develop their living.

Khayrat is a 30-year-old married mother of two children who works hard to support her husband in developing their beloved family's living.

In 2013, she established her current clothes selling shop, and she is working hard as much as she can to develop it and increase its capital to make sure she can meet her family's and her customers' needs.

For this reason, she will invest an acquired youth loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua in increasing her business merchandise with a new autumn and winter collection especially for school and Adha Eid occasion.

Khayrat is the lady at the center of the picture. As for the other group members, Sarah is the lady at the far left side of the picture, while Zahraa is the lady at the right side of the picture.

loans.use: To increase her business merchandise with a new autumn and winter collection especially for school and Adha Eid occasion

loans.name: Charity

texts.en:
Davao has fertile lands and huge forested areas that are favorable to fruit-bearing trees as well as vegetable farming. The tropical weather condition in Davao, or the Mindanao region in general, is more stable compared to the Visayas region. Typhoons seldom visit the area. 

Charity, 32, has a stall of vegetables beside her house in Matina, Davao City. She also sells repacked condiments and seasonings to match her vegetables. The profits derived from her business help provide for the basic needs of her family. However, the risk that she faces is the possibility of vegetables rotting if they are not sold on time. Somehow, Charity has learned the trade tips from her eight years of experience in vegetable vending. She also knows how to compete with other vendors by opening her store much earlier than others. 

Now she desires to buy more vegetables to display in her stall in order to attract more buyers. Aside from this, she plans to add various grocery items and beverages to widen the selection in her store. She implores your kind support to make these things possible. A loan worth PHP 15,000 will surely go a long way. 

Charity is married to Renades and they have four children in high school and elementary levels. The couple diligently works towards their goal to improve their business, uplift their lives, and finish the schooling of their children.

Charity is a devoted member of CCT Credit Cooperative and she meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and their religion. *All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study religion, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to display in her stall.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
Miguel, de 21 años de edad, estudio hasta séptimo grado, está casado y es padre de un niño de 1 año de edad, en su casa solo vive su esposa y su hijo.

Miguel, trabaja como auxiliar de albañilería desde hace un par de años, en su trabajo tiene que viajar a diferentes lugares donde se requiera de su servicio y en el tiempo libre trabaja como jornalero.

Miguel, necesita el préstamo para comprar insumos agrícolas para el cultivo de maíz y frijol, ya que estos serán para el consumo del hogar y así no tener que comprarlo.

El sueño de Miguel, es que sus cultivos sean prósperos y poder darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Miguel, 21 years old, went to school up to the seventh grade. He is married and the father of a 1-year-old boy. Only his wife and son live in his house.

Miguel has worked as an assistant bricklayer for a few years. In his work, he has to travel to different places where his services are needed and in his free time he works as a day laborer.

Miguel needs the loan to purchase agricultural supplies for the corn and bean crops since these will be for household consumption so he won't have to buy them.

Miguel's dream is that his crops are prosperous and to be able to give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies for the corn and bean crops.

loans.name: Amantur

texts.en:
Amantur became a freshman this year and asked AUCA administration for financial aid to pay for his tuition costs. Despite receiving financial aid, his family came to the conclusion that they were still unable to pay the remaining amount, and so had no other choice but to apply for a Kiva loan. He hopes that Kiva lenders will not be indifferent to his request and that they will support him in getting a good education for a bright future.

There are 4 members of Amantur’s family: his parents, himself and his younger sister. 4 years ago his father got seriously sick and from that time he was disallowed to do any exercises. As he needs someone’s help daily, his mother tries to be with him and earn money at the same time. She rents the rooms of their house and, in this way, alone supports their family. Of course, it does disturb them and bring in some inconvenience, but they have to get used to it if they want to earn a living.

Family conditions don’t prevent Amantur from dreaming and going forward. He says that all these circumstances make him stronger, smarter and more responsible for his life. He understands that as the eldest son of his parents, he is responsible for their future and he should prove their expectations. With the help of higher education gained at AUCA, he wants to make his family’s life better so that they can become financially independent and self-developed in different fields.

loans.use: to pay for his higher education costs in the Software Engineering (SFW) Program at AUCA.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 41-year-old married man from Rafah city, which is located in the Gaza Strip, next to the refugee camp with the same name. He works as an employee in the public sector, where he gets a low income. This income barely covers all the family needs, but he wants to make his family more comfortable and improve their standard of living.

So Mohammad took a USD loan from FATEN, which will enable him to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house. By taking this loan, Mohammad will be able to decrease the electricity expenses, while using a cleaner form of energy (rather than gas).

Mohammad’s family will have an easier time heating water for showers, cooking, and also washing clothes and dishes. Mohammad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house.

loans.name: Edina

texts.en:
She is Edina, 48 years old and a resident of Batasan Philippines. She’s a dedicated member of Center for Community Transformation (CCT). Edina has been involved in a pig farming business for more than ten years now. Pigs are a popular livestock in the Philippines since they are raised for human food and ingredients for processed foods. Their skins are also used to make clothing. She earns approximately 15,000 PHP each month. However, she is unable to put all the profit back into the business because she also has a family to raise.

Pig farming is exhausting since cleaning each pig including each pig pen and feeding them is not an easy job. Moreover, feed and vitamins are expensive. That’s why Edina applied for a loan of 25,000 PHP support for the business. With this, she will be able to buy feed, vitamins and other supplies and necessary items needed in pig farming. She wants to thank lenders for helping entrepreneurs like herself in terms of monetary support. She believes that God will sustain more blessings to those who are compassionate in helping others.

Edina has been consistent in attending CCT fellowship group that consist of 15 to 30 members where she hears the word of God and testimonies from partners, this made her to become strong spiritually and dependent to God on every occasion.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and other necessary items for pig farming.

loans.name: Orbelina Elizabeth

texts.es: Orbelina de 38 años de edad es madre soltera vive en casa propia con sus dos hijas, ella se dedica a la venta de antjitos desde hace varios años, su negocio esta ubicado cerca de su lugar de residencia, y con lo que obtiene de sus ganancias es como logra salir adelante, ella quiere mejorar su vivienda construyendo las paredes y encementar el piso pero como no posee de suficiente capital, esta solicitando un credito para la compra de materiales de contruccion y asi poder tener una vivienda digna para sus hijas.
texts.en: Orbelina, 38 years old, is a single mother. She lives in her own house with her two daughters. She has worked selling snacks for some years. Her business is located near her home and with what she gets from the earnings, she manages to get ahead. She wants to improve her house, building the walls and cementing the floor, but as she doesn't have sufficient capital, she is asking for a loan to purchase construction materials and, so, to be able to have a dignified house for her daughters.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
From Pasay City, Philippines, Nenita is making her own mark by managing her very own buy-and-sell business of ready-to-wear clothing for men and women, and a food stall business at the same time. Nenita and her husband are helping each other in running the business to earn a living and support their children’s education. Both her children are in the elementary level.

Nenita has been an entrepreneur for one year already. The businesses that she has are helping support them to pay their bills and other household expenses. Revenue of the business is always affected during the rainy season. Thus, Nenita plans to have additional sources of income for the family, and generate a significant amount of savings for their future.

Nenita is applying for a loan of Php 10,000. This will be a great help for her businesses. It will be an added capital or a revolving fund for her businesses which will be used to buy a stock of ready-wear-clothes clothes for her buy-and-sell business and raw ingredients for her food stall.

On a weekly basis, Nenita regularly meets with her co-fellowship members to share her life’s testimony, experience on the business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and listen to the Word of God. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 members. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social relationship with other partners, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy stock of ready-wear-clothes clothes for her buy-and-sell business and daily ingredients for her food stall business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase firewood and corn to make and sell tortillas, and also she will do maintenance on the corn mill, the end is to offer quality service to her customers.

loans.name: Shabana

texts.en:
Shabana is a 27-year-old woman and mother of four children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband is fruit seller by profession; he sells fruits e.g. apples, bananas, grapes, etc. Her husband is the only one responsible to feed the entire family and manage the household.

Shabana's husband needs to purchase different types of fruits for reselling purposes so that he can increase the size of the business, improve his sales growth and earn maximum profit. But due to an unfavorable financial position, her husband is not in a condition to purchase fruit for his business purposes.

Therefore Shabana has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that she can help her husband purchase the above items for business purposes.

She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's fruit business.

loans.name: Sam Art's Group

texts.en:
Sam Art is a resident living in Kampong Cham province who has been growing rice as her main source of income to support her family’s living. Beside this, she spends her free time working as a laborer to get additional income.

She is a 34-year-old mother of two schoolchildren. She has been involved with her business for 16 years. Her rice does't grow well because it was destroyed by insects, and her income is lower than before.

This is her second loan cycle with VisionFund and she fully repaid her past loan successfully. Her family’s business has improved gradually with her earlier loan.

Now she will spend her entire loan portion to purchase fertilizer and rice seed to increase her crop yield. She wishes that she could earn more income from her rice farm to expand her farmland and she to support her children’s education, as well.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and rice seed to increase her crop yield to earn more income for supporting her children's studies.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Tamer

texts.en:
Tamer is a 35-year-old, married man from Gaza city, which is located in the Gaza Strip, next to the Refugee Camp with the same name. He works as an employee in the public sector, where he gets a low income. This income barely covers all the family needs but he wants to make his family more comfortable and improve their standard of living.

Tamer took a USD loan from FATEN, which will enable him to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house. By taking this loan, Tamer will be able to decrease the electricity expenses while using a cleaner form of energy (rather than gas). Tamer’s family will have an easier time heating water for showers, cooking, and also washing clothes and dishes. Tamer appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house.

loans.name: Iyad

texts.en:
Iyad is a 35-year-old, married man from Rafah city, which is located in the Gaza Strip, next to the Refugee Camp with the same name. He works as an employee in the public sector, where he gets a low income. This income barely covers all the family needs but he wants to make his family more comfortable and improve their standard of living.

Iyad took a USD loan from FATEN, which will enable him to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house. By taking this loan, Iyad will be able to decrease the electricity expenses while using a cleaner form of energy (rather than gas). Iyad’s family will have an easier time heating water for showers, cooking, and also washing clothes and dishes. Iyad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house.

loans.name: Daisy Yanira

texts.es: Daisy de 38 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida, ella se dedica a la venta de tortillas desde hace varios años, su negocio esta ubicado en su lugar de residencia, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas y con la ayuda del esposo, logran salir adelante, ella quiere mejorar su vivienda terminando de construir la pared de la parte principal de la casa pero como no posee suficiente capital esta solicitando un credito para la compra de los materiales de construccion y asi podr tener una vivienda mas segura.
texts.en: Daisy, 38 years old, lives in her own house with her life partner, she has worked selling tortillas for some years. Her business is located in her home. With what she earns from her sales and with the help of her partner, they manage to get ahead. She wants to improve her house, finishing the construction of the wall in the main part of the house, but as she doesn't have sufficient capital, she is asking for a loan to purchase construction materials and, so, to be able to have a more secure house.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 21 years old. He is single and has no children. His business is motorcycle taxi. He has been in this business for three years. He earns a monthly income of eighteen thousand Kenya shillings.

This is his first loan from VisionFund Kenya. He will use the loan to buy a motorcycle. He will use the profits from expanded business to save towards buying another motorcycle. His hopes and dreams are to expand his business and have a fleet of motorcycle taxis.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase furniture and supplies to make pastries to improve her sales and generate more income for her family.

loans.name: Islam

texts.en:
Islam is a 29-year-old married man from the city of Jabalia city, which is located in the Gaza Strip next to the Refugee Camp. He is employed in the public sector and earns a low income which barely covers all the family needs. He wants to make his family more comfortable and improve their standard of living.

Islam requests a loan to buy a solar system to heat water for the family's house. He will be able to decrease the electricity expenses while using a clean form of energy. Islam’s family will have an easier time heating water for showers, cooking, and also washing clothes and dishes.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is a 29-year-old married woman with one child, who has been working as a tutor since 2011. Her husband works abroad seeking a better income to support his family.

Sarah is well known in her region for being well educated and talented. She runs a home-based tutoring business and works hard to develop her skills and take good care of her child.

Her income is limited and she requests a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to pay for her child's school registration fees.

She hopes to spread education in her region and plans to open a special tutoring center in her own.

loans.use: to pay for her child's school registration fees

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson is a fifty-eight-year old married man with eight children living in Masindi, Uganda. He operates a retail shop which helps him to look after his family and, in addition, educate his children. He works very hard to maintain his business and promises to develop it even more. He is a retired civil servant and earns a pension.

He requests for a loan to buy salt, sugar,and cooking oil for his shop. Wilson is grateful to Kiva funders for the previous loan which helped him get enough profit to boost his business.

loans.use: to buy salt, soap, and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Nofous

texts.en:
Nofouz is a 42-year-old married woman with five children who lives in a village near Ramallah called Kufur Neema.

She decided to be an effective women in her family and produces special embroidered items such as pillows. Nofouz requests a loan from Kiva partner Alibdaa to buy more fiber and fabric to produce more embroidered products. She hopes to earn more income and pay her son's tuition fees.

loans.use: to buy more sewing materials.

loans.name: Lyn

texts.en:
Lyn is a 26-year-old woman with a 2-year-old child. She runs a sari-sari(variety) store to sell biscuits, noodles, chips, eggs, sugar, spices, shampoo, tooth paste, tuba(coconut) wine, and soft drinks.

She requests a loan to purchase feed, rice, and groceries. She can maximize her resources and expand as needed.

She is determined that she can improve her livelihood to be more productive in the years to come.

loans.use: to purchase feed, rice and assorted groceries

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is a member of Center for Community Transformation (CCT). She is 61 years old and has four children. Helen runs a variety store/Sari-sari. “Sari-sari” is a Tagalog word which means “variety of choices”. You can buy grocery items individually or by volume, kilos of rice, and bottled drinks. She’s able to sustain their day-to-day expenses and has been in business for 10 years.

Business’ revenue is always affected every time there are late payments. She takes advantage of CCT's business mentoring. There are lenders who are considerate in helping other people. She dreams of having a stable fund for the business and requests 15,000 PHP to buy grocery items and to start a loading business for all mobile networks. She’s hoping that CCT would consider her application since it would be of great help.

She wants to thank the lenders, CCT, and Kiva.

Helen regularly meets with her co-fellowship members to share her life’s testimony, experience on the business, to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship, and listen to the Word of God. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 members. The fellowship groups gather weekly to study the Word of God, build social relationship with other partners, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items for her variety store.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David who has a retail shop in Masindi, Uganda, is a married man who is very hard working and also drives a taxi to supplement his incomes. He has managed to look after his family with the proceeds and hopes to buy a new car for transportation.

He requests for a loan to to buy sugar, sodas for the shop and clear the balance to service his car. He is grateful to Kiva funders for the previous loan which he used to add stock in his business.

loans.use: to buy sugar, sodas and clear the balance to service his car.

loans.name: Elias Antonio

texts.es:
Elías es carpintero, oficio que práctica  desde hace cinco años, actualmente es su fuente de ingresos, elabora muebles y hace reparaciones a  muebles que sus clientes le solicitan, él es casado, vive con su esposa de 20 años, no cuenta con apoyo económico de sus parientes.
Con el crédito comprara una cierra de mesa, pegamento y madera para poder desarrollar sus actividades con mayor calidad, fortalecerá su negocio esperando dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes y tener un negocio más rentable.
Sus aspiraciones son ampliar su negocio y tener mejor situación económica para subsistir junto a su familia.
texts.en:
Elías is a carpenter, a trade that he has practiced for five years. Currently, it is his source of income. He makes furniture and repairs furniture as his customers ask. He is married and lives with his 20-year-old wife, he doesn't have any economic support from his relatives.

With the loan, he will purchase a table saw, adhesive and wood to be able to develop his work with better quality. He will strengthen his business hoping to give his customers better service and have a more profitable business.

His aspirations are to expand his business and have a better economic situation so to survive with his family.

loans.use: to purchase a table saw, adhesive and wood.

loans.name: Neslie

texts.en:
Neslie diligently runs a variety store and fish vending business. She plans on growing and improving her businesses. She knows that she needs sufficient capital for all of the hard work to be worthwhile. Her previous loan did make a great impact on the business. She used it to improve her inventory. She wants to thank lenders because the amount they’ve provided became a way for her to increase sales.

Neslie is also grateful as CCT conducts seminars for entrepreneurs. She is requesting 50,000 PHP to restock grocery items and buy fresh fish.

Neslie believes that if you want success to come, you need God to be your greatest foundation. She attends weekly fellowship groups for CCT partners to gain spiritual strength, share experience of God’s love, pay Micro Finance loans, and hear God’s word..

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages which are needed in her business.

loans.name: Adeline

texts.en:
Adeline, 29 years old, is a dedicated member of CCT Credit Cooperative in Butuan City, Agusan Del Norte. She manages a variety store that sells various commodities such as toiletries, canned goods, snack items and condiments. Simultaneously, she buys stock of firewood and retails it by bundle to her neighbors. She works hard in order to earn financial resources she needs every day and set aside some savings for the future. She prays for a child with her partner, Marlon, a self-employed worker.
 
As she prepares for the future, she aims to expand her variety store and firewood vending. She wants to purchase additional grocery items and bundles of firewood for her store. She also plans to invest in a refrigerator for storing cold beverages as added items to sell. She requests for 20,000 PHP. She hopes that your help will bring positive steps towards her dream of having a successful and stable business. She prays for a happy family life with sustained finances. She meets weekly with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God. *All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery items and bundles of firewood for her store.

loans.name: Chhem's Group

texts.en: Aged 47, Chhem is a mother of one child living in Tbaung Khmum province. For her living conditions, she can earn income via rice cropping and cassava growing. She has been in this business for ages and from her income she can save about 10 USD per day. She leads a group of two members in seeking a new loan and this is her first time with VisionFund. As the leader of the group, she will use her loan portion to purchase fertilizer for her rice farm to produce good yield and spend a part of her loan to pay labor fees to improve her cassava farm to get more yields. She wishes that she can gain more income than last year to upgrade her living conditions, and make them better than before.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for her rice farm to produce good yield and increase her income in order to save for her future needs.

location.town: Tbaung Khmum District, Tbaung Khmum Province

loans.name: Robina

texts.en:
Robina is a 38-year-old woman residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She has 2 children and her husband has run a general store for 9 years. Her husband is responsible for fulfilling the needs of his entire family.

Robina's husband wants to purchase rice, sugar, tea bags, milk, and other items for his business but does not have the funds. Robina has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan to buy all these commodities and help her husband to earn an income to manage his house hold and business.

Robina is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: her husband  to increase his general store business.

loans.name: Samer

texts.en:
Samer is a 27-year-old Palestinian refugee who owns a shop specializing in gypsum since 2013. He is married and lives with his wife and two young children. His wife is unemployed. His income is the family's only source of income.

Samer has been working in gypsum for more than 12 years as an apprentice in several projects. After graduating from school, Samer worked as a full time construction worker for several years to gain more experience. He decided to open his own business two and a half years ago and relys on himself and the help of a close friend.

He now has one employee and he needs to increase his supplies in gypsum molds and boards. He will buy them in bulk at lower prices which increases his profitability.

Samer is asking for a 1,543,992 Lebanese pounds loan for the first time from Kiva partner Ibdaa. He is expecting to buy enough quantities to secure a good price. He is hoping that this strategy will ensure his business' financial sustainability and growth which will directly impact his family's well being.

loans.use: to buy gypsum molds and boards

loans.name: Kaneez

texts.en:
Kaneez is a 45-year-old married woman with seven children who lives in the area of Multan, Pakistan.

She is taking loan for her husband who is a salesman with 30 years of experience. He purchases large quantities of mud pots to sell in the market. He earns the money for his family. He uses his motor bike to transport the goods from one place to another.

The needs of his family have increased a lot but his earnings are insufficient to cope with his needs.

Kaneez requests a loan for her husband to buy new inventory to increase his work.

Kaneez is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy mud pots for her husband

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is a 33-year-old married woman with three children, who has farmed since 2010 to support her husband in his farm business.

Fatima decided to start her own business and is working hard to make her dream come true. She is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to buy new clothes and accessories to start a new business for the autumn and winter seasons.

She will work hard to develop her business.

loans.use: to buy clothes and accessories to start a new business

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
The loan amount that Lilibeth applied for previously and was approved for by Center for Community Transformation (CCT) made a vast impact on her internet café. She was able to buy a computer unit which improved her daily earnings as she can now accommodate more customers. She wants to thank all the lenders for the support they have given her.

Lilibeth is thankful that in the span of two yers she was able to gain loyal customers already and earns approximately 8,000 PHP every month. The revenue of the business helped her with school expenses and other bills. She wants her children finish their studies. This is why she is very dedicated to growing her business.

Lilibeth dreams of having a bigger internet café someday and being able to add computer units as well. Lilibeth wants to apply for a loan of 20,000 PHP. She will be using the amount for the said purpose and hopes that CCT would once again grant her request.

Lilibeth is consistent in attending weekly fellowship group for CCT partners that consists of 15 to 30 members where she gain spiritual strength for member’s life changing testimony, share her own experience of God’s love, pay Micro Finance loans and  hear God’s word that  was conveyed to them every week.

loans.use: to buy an additional computer unit.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia is a repeat client with Ugafode micro-finance and requests a loan of 3000,000 UGX. She is a married woman with children.
