She owns a clothing shop and needs working capital to expand the business. She is challenged by competition and lack of capital.

She is very grateful for the support Ugafode microfinance and Kiva lenders.

loans.use: improve her business.

loans.name: Rene Armando

texts.es:
Rene, de 34 años de edad, no tuvo el privilegio de asistir a la escuela, debido al conflicto armado que vivió el país; está acompañado su pareja se dedica a los oficios del hogar y a cuidar de sus hijos, con ella han procreado 6 hijos de 15, 13, 10, 8, 5 y 2 años de edad y junto a ellos vive la mamá de Rene.

Rene, se dedica al trabajar la agricultura desde que era un niño, aprendió este oficio de su padre y actualmente labora en una finca cuidando las plantas de café y su jornada de trabajo inicia a las 5:30 a.m. y termina a las 12:00 del mediodía y por la tarde trabaja en sus cultivos de maíz y frijol.- El lugar donde trabaja está a 20 minutos de su casa y tiene que caminar para llegar a ese lugar; decidió dedicarse a este tipo de trabajo, porque en la zona donde vive no hay muchas posibilidades de otro tipo de trabajo y con la agricultura él ha podido salir adelante con su familia.

Rene, necesita el préstamo para comprar abono, insecticidas y herbicidas para aplicarlos a sus cultivos, específicamente él está cultivando hortalizas tales como repollo, güisquil y ejote; debido a lo extraviado de la zona donde vive, no puede realizar muchos viajes para comprar sus productos, es por eso que el préstamo le ayudará a tener los insumos necesarios para aplicarlos en el momento oportuno. 

Rene, sueña con poder construir su casa de un material más resistente como ladrillo, con ello les dará una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos y mayor seguridad; además, desea poder apoyar a sus hijos para que estudien y puedan alcanzar las metas que él no pudo.
texts.en:
Rene is 34 years old and did not have the privilege of attending school due to the conflict in the country. He is married to a partner who works on household chores and care for their children. They have six children at the ages of 15, 13, 10, 8, 5 and 2. They all live with Rene’s mother.

Rene has worked in agriculture since he was a child. He learned the trade from his father and currently works on a farm tending the coffee plants. His workday begins at 5:30 am and ends at 12:00 noon. In the evening, he works on the corn and bean cultivation. His workplace is 20 minutes from home and have to walk to get there. He decided to pursue this type of work because there are not many other opportunities in the area. With agriculture work, he has been able to get ahead with his family.

Rene needs the loan to buy fertilizer, insecticides and herbicides for crops. He is cultivating vegetables such as cabbage, chayote and green beans. Fertilizers have been missing from the area where he lives but he cannot make many trips to buy the products. The loan will help him get the inputs needed to be applied at the right time.

Rene dreams to build a house of a stronger material such as brick. It will give his children a better quality of life and greater security. He also wants to support his children to study so that they can achieve the goals that he could not.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, insecticides and herbicides for crops.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida has been in the food vending business for years and earns 15,000 PHP each month. She uses the earningor her business and daily expenditures.

The previous loan that Center for Community Transformation (CCT) approved was used to purchase dozens of fertilized duck eggs and packs of crackers. She’s thankful and considered CCT and lenders as God’s blessing to her.

Her business enables her to support her children’s education. She prays that God will continually send customers to her. She wants to extend her business and start another stall in a different area. But for now, she’ll focus on how to acquire more customers and add more products. She applied for 50,000 PHP to buy fresh fertilized duck eggs and other food items to sell.

Zenaida meets weekly with her co-fellowship members to share her life’s testimony, business experiences, draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship, and listen to the Word of God. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 members. The fellowship groups gather weekly to study the Word of God, build social relationship with other partners, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy eggs, crackers, "balut" (fertilized duck eggs), and other food items.

loans.name: Sopheao's Group

texts.en: Sopheao’s group live in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Sopheao makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.	.

loans.name: Bushra

texts.en: Bushra lives in Multan, Pakistan with her 4 children. She owns a bangles shop which is the only source of income for the family. She wants to purchase a variety of  bangles and requests a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase costume jewelry. She is hopeful that the loan will help her business to be productive.

loans.use: to buy bangles for her shop

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia has 3 children and they live in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has provided taxi services for 18 years. He is responsible to fulfill the needs of the entire family. Her husband needs to repair his taxi because it requires more maintenance on a daily basis.

Razia has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her husband can afford the maintenance cost.

He wants to provide better transportation services and earn a profitable income. Razia also plans to save the profit to meet her family's needs in future.

Razia is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: and her husband to repair his taxi.

loans.name: Rosa Amelia

texts.es: Doña Rosa de 56 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hijo, ella se dedica a la venta de hamacas desde hace 20 años vende de manera ambulante por los diferetes mercados y colonias, su hijo le ayuda en el negocio y con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella esta solicitando un credito para la compra de mas hamacas por mayor para poder continuar con sus ventas ya que le genran buenas ganancias.
texts.en:
56-year old Sra. Rosa lives in her own house with her son. She has earned her living peddling hammocks for 20 years in different markets and communities. Her son helps with the business. With the money she earns, Rosa manages to pay for some household expenses.

She is seeking a loan to buy more hammocks at wholesale prices so she can continue making sales and generating a good income.

loans.use: buy more hammocks at wholesale prices

loans.name: Merenciana

texts.en:
Merciana’s previous loan enabled her to improve the business and buy grocery items for her variety store. She thanks all lenders and CCT for the money they have provided.

Merciana is now managing two businesses. She sells meat and operates a variety store. This income helps to support her children’s school expenses. It’s her dream to support her children’s education through college.

Revolving fund is what Merciana aspires for her business so that she’ll be able to buy grocery items daily and fresh meats to resell. She applied for a loan amount of Php 12,000 and she has faith that CCT will grant once again her loan application.

Merciana has been consistent in attending CCT fellowship group that consist of 15 to 30 members where she hears the word of God and testimonies from partners, this made her to become strong spiritually and dependent to God on every occasion.

loans.use: to purchase clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics.

loans.name: Haward

texts.en: Haward is a 36-year-old man living in Masindi-Uganda who requests a loan to buy salon equipment. He is very hard working and loves his business since it is his source of income.  He is able to pay school fees, medical bills,  and provide for the family's welfare. He also has rentals that supplement his income, he hopes to build more rentals to stabilize his income.

loans.use: to buy salon equipment.

loans.name: Sreytom's Group

texts.en:
Sreytom is a 22-year- old woman (with one child) who is local farmer from Kampong Cham province. She has grown rice for 4 years and works as a laborer.

The insects have destroyed her rice. She earns 10 USD per day. Sreytom leads a group of two to seek a new loan. This is her second micro loan with VisionFund. She successfully repaid her previous loan and her family's lifestyle has improved.

As the group leader, she will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer and rice seed. She hopes that she can get more yield and more income to upgrade her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and rice seed.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Maysaa

texts.en:
Maysaa is a 20-year-old single lady who started working as a tutor from her house one year ago. Her earned monthly income isn't sufficient to cover her needs and expenses.

Today, Maysaa is requesting a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, in order to cover her engagement expenses, such as the dress and necessary requested needs.

Maysaa hopes to finish her studies and expand her business so she can increase both  her income and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To cover her engagement expenses, such as the dress and necessary requested needs

loans.name: Ra Group

texts.en:
Ra is a 53-year-old, married rice farmer with two adult children and resides in the Prey Veng Province in Cambodia. She has been cultivating rice for over thirty five years. Her husband is a 52-year-old a rice farmer as well, and one of her two children attends school and another one is a factory worker. Both of them can earn approximately $10 per day.

Ra is pictured 1st from the right, as a group leader, would like to request a loan as part of four members and she will use her portion to buy fertilizer and to pay for plowing expenses. This loan will help her have enough money to buy fertilizer for rice cultivation, so she will be able to gain better rice crops to support the family. In the future, she is going to buy more farmland, renovate a proper house and support her youngest child to earn bachelor’s degree.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to pay for plowing expenses

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John 45 years old. He is single and has one child.  His business is farming. He has been in this business for 5 years. He earns a monthly income of five thousand Kenya shillings. This is his 2nd loan from VisionFund Kenya. 


He will use the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer and pay for labour. He will use the profits from expanded business to dig terraces to reduce soil erosion. His hopes and dreams are to buy a farm to expand his business

loans.use: to pay for labour and buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Wael

texts.en: Wael is a 46-year-old, married man from Rafah city, which is located in the Gaza Strip. He works as an employee in the public sector, where he gets a low income. This income barely covers all the family needs, but he wants to make his family more comfortable and improve their standard of living. So, Wael took a USD loan from FATEN, which will enable him to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house. By taking this loan, Wael will be able to decrease the electricity expenses, while using a cleaner form of energy (rather than gas). Wael’s family will have an easier time heating water for showers, cooking, and also washing clothes and dishes. Wael appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house.

loans.name: Sobhiye

texts.en: Sobhiye is a 39 year old single woman. She is living with her parents and only sibling still attending university. Her father works in order to satisfy their needs. Due to the hard financial situation, today, she is asking to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l; she will be utilizing the loan to pay her sister’s educational fees. In the future, she plans to take new Kiva loans and keep on covering he study fees.

loans.use: to pay her sister’s educational fees

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma has run her direct selling business with great dedication. It is a business that doesn’t need to have high capital to start. She’s thankful to the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) that granted her the financial assistance to buy herbal products.

Gemma is grateful for having the business because it helps to sustain their daily needs. She works hard to make the business flourish which is one of her dreams. This year, Gemma wants to apply for 30,000 PHP to have additional products to put on her display cabinet. Availability of products is one thing that should be considered in a direct selling business because customers will not wait for weeks for their orders. Gemma is anticipating that her request will be granted since this will be a big help for the business, attract more patrons, and increase her sales.

Gemma regularly meets with her co-fellowship members to share her life’s testimony, experience on the business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and listen to the Word of God. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 members. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social relationship with other partners, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to purchase herbal medicines and food supplements.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 63 years old and married with five children. One of her children is in school, Erlinda works very hard to provide for them.

Erlinda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like junk foods, canned goods, egg, home product care, and other groceries.

Erlinda has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items. 

In the future, Erlinda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like junk foods, canned goods, egg, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Hoeurn's Group

texts.en:
Hoeurn is a 46-year-old woman with three dependent children living in Kampong Cham province. She has grown rice for 26 years to earn an income to support her living conditions. She also works for others for a fee.

She earns 10 USD per day. She did not get a good yield from her rice crop because it was destroyed by insects.

She leads a group of two members to request a new loan; this is her first loan with VisionFund. She will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and pay the labor fees to improve her farmland. She hopes to have a good yield and earn more income in order to upgrade her living condition.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica is a married woman with ten children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Jessica is 46 years old and has five children are presently in school.

Jessica has a buy and sell bamboo business in the Philippines. Jessica requested a PHP 20000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more bamboo to sell to her customers.

Jessica has been in this business for 12 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more bamboo to sell to her customers

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is a 47-years-old married woman, living in the area of Multan, Pakistan. Her husband polishes single beds, tables, and other furniture. He started this business and has 22 years experience.

Her husband has many regular customers andtakes orders for polishing and repairing wooden accessories. This business yields a good income but his family's needs are increasing day by day. They need more money to afford household expenses. He wants to buy materials to expand the business. Razia, came to BRAC Pakistan to obtain a loan for her husband.

She hopes that this loan will prove beneficial and productive for her husband's business and family.

Razia thanks Kiva and their field partner, BRAC Pakistan for this support.

loans.use: to buy furniture polish for her husband.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
PARVEEN is a 58-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of four children. Her husband owns a clothing business. His practice is to buy clothing from a wholesaler and sell it to the retailers. He has lot of customers who like to buy clothing from him; sometimes he purchases clothing from out of the city at a low cost and sells it to the retailers. He has a good reputation in the market and his current customers refer his clothing to the other retailers which becomes good advertising. One of her sons also helps her husband in the clothing business; both give part of their time to the shop. 
PARVEEN has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband will be able to buy more clothing of various colors and designs to fulfill the demand. She is in a repeated loan cycle and has shown an excellent repayment behavior. She has already been taking the loan from BRAC and investing in the business. PARVEEN hopes that the savings will much increase so she can arrange the marriage ceremony for her daughter. 
PARVEEN dreams of the bright future of her children, the establishment of their business, and a better living standard for her family. She is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more clothing of various colors and designs for her husband's clothing business to fulfill the demand.

loans.name: Juana Martha

texts.es:
Juana es una mujer de 50 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene hijos independientes, y su negocio es la venta de comida rápida. 
Ella es emprendedora, independiente y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘villa Fátima’ caracterizada por ser la salida de la ciudad a poblaciones del norte y donde se encuentra la terminal de buses.
Juana es morena de baja estatura y rostro arrugado, su lengua materna es el Aymará y habla español. Su vida la comparte con su pareja que trabaja como transportista, viven en un cuarto propio construido de ladrillo que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de comida rápida como; hamburguesas, hot dogs, sándwiches y otros, “inicie mi negocio por la necesidad de ayudar a mi esposo…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que se encuentra ubicado en un área comercial, la desventaja es la falta de dinero para comprar un anaquel para exponer la comida. Su sueño es terminar de construir su casa, ella desea comprar un anaquel para exponer los alimentos de su negocio. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 15 años que se dedica a esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Juana solicita un préstamo para la compra de un anaquel para exponer alimentos en su negocio.
texts.en:
Juana, 50, lives with her partner and has independent children.  Her business is selling fast food.  She is an independent, very hard working entrepreneur who runs her business in the area called "Villa Fatima", where the bus station is located on the way out of the city toward villages in the north.

Juana has a dark complexion, a wrinkled face and is short in height.  Her mother tongue is Aymara and she speaks Spanish.  Her partner works as a driver and they live in their own brick house which has running water, electricity and a sewage system.

Her business involves selling fast food, including hamburgers, hot dogs, sandwiches and other items.  "I began the business out of necessity to help my partner..." she says.  The advantage of her stall is that it is near a shopping area.  The disadvantage is the lack of money to buy shelving for her food.

Her dream is to finish building her house and buy shelving for her business.  This is her first loan through the institution in the 15 years she has been in business.

The loan will be used to buy shelves to display her products.

loans.use: To buy a shelf to display her products.

loans.name: Chicas Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
El grupo Chicas Emprendedoras está integrado por siete mujeres trabajadoras quienes tienen el firme propósito de superarse y sacar adelante a sus familia. Todas están orgullosas de pertenecer a su comunidad ya que resguardan la cultura mazahua conservando su lengua y muchas de las tradiciones que les dan identidad.  
   Doña Cecilia es quizás la más alegre del grupo, siempre está haciendo reír a sus compañeras; tienen tres hijos de los cuales sólo uno, el más chico, se encuentra estudiando la preparatoria. Desde hace aproximadamente 3 años, se ha dedicado a la elaboración de tortillas, anteriormente se dedicaba a la cría de cerdos y pollos pero tuvo que vender todos los ejemplares debido a una emergencia médica. 
     Ceci, como le llaman de cariño, trabaja todos los días desde las 8:00 am y hasta las 5:00 pm; cuenta con la ayuda de dos empleadas para cubrir los fines de semana o bien algún pedido especial. Una de sus metas es que su hijo realice su sueño de convertirse en militar y para eso le inculca el valor del trabajo y la responsabilidad. En cuanto a su actividad desea abrir una nueva sucursal en una comunidad aledaña.
   Tiene tres ciclos solicitando préstamos a VF México y siempre los aprovecha en la comprar de maíz, cal, bolsas, prensas, papel etc. para continuar con su actividad. Huelga decir que se encuentra muy agradecida con los préstamos ya que con ellos mejora su productividad y con sus ganancias ha podido comprar muebles y lo más importante sigue apoyando a su hijo con sus estudios. "Mi negocio está avanzando muy bien porque me agrada mucho la actividad que realizo" comentó.
   Las demás integrantes del grupo son María Teresa quien invertirá en pan y botanas; Diana, en artículos de fantasía; Natalia, en abarrotes; Mónica, en vegetales; Rachel, en blancos y Rufina, en productos para la belleza.
*La fotografía fue tomada en la casa de Doña Ceci quien viste el suéter color azul.
texts.en:
Chicas Emprendedoras (Entrepreneurial Girls) group is comprised of seven working women who have the firm intention to excel and raise their families. All are proud to be part of their community and to guard the Mazahua culture, preserving its language and many traditions that give it its identity.

Cecilia is perhaps the most cheerful of the group. She is always making her colleagues laugh. She has three children. Only the youngest is studying in school. Since about three years ago, she has been making tortillas. She was previously engaged in raising pigs and chickens but had to sell all livestocks because of a medical emergency.

Ceci, as they call her affectionately, works every day from 8:00 am to 5:00 pm. She has two employees to cover the weekends or any special requests. One of her goals is that her child realize his dream of joining military and that instills the value of work and responsibility. In terms of her work, she wants to open a new branch in a neighboring community.

This is her third loan cycle with VF Mexico and has always been advantageous in buying corn, lime, bags, presses, paper etc. to continue her work. Needless to say, she is very grateful for the loans and that they improve productivity and profits. She was able to buy furniture and, most importantly, to support her child continues his studies. "My business is going very well because I really like what I do," she said.

Other group members are Maria Teresa who invests in bread and snacks, Diana in novelty items, Natalia in grocery, Monica in vegetables, Rachel in linen and Rufina in beauty products.

* Picture was taken at the home of Ceci who is wearing a blue sweater.

loans.use: to buy corn, lime, bags, newspapers, paper etc.

loans.name: Rosa Mabel

texts.es:
Rosa es una persona responsable de sacar adelante a sus hijos, únicamente vive con ellos, esporádicamente tiene ayuda de sus parientes, su actividad económica es la venta de tortillas, frutas y verduras, inicio por motivación propia con la venta de tortillas hace ya varios años, el cual ha ido creciendo poco a poco, posteriormente logro incorporar la venta de frutas y verduras.
Se decidió por trabajar con un créditos para comprar maíz, leña, cal, bolsas, papel, frutas y verduras, tendrá un inventario más surtido para atender las demandas de sus clientes, aumentar las ventas e ingresos, espera que los resultados de la inversión sean de beneficios.
Sus aspiraciones son construir su propia casa, vender otro tipo de productos en un local propio y sacar adelante a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Rosa is responsible for bringing up her children and lives solely with them. Sporadically she has help from her relatives.

Her economic activity is selling tortillas, fruit and vegetables. She started selling tortillas by her own initiative several years ago, and has been growing little by little. Later she was able to add the sale of fruits and vegetables.

She decided to use a loan to buy corn, firewood, lime, bags, paper, fruits and vegetables to have more variety so she can meet the demands of her customers and increase sales and earnings. She hopes that the results of the investment will be beneficial.

Her dream is to build her own home, to sell other types of products in her own facility and to bring up her children.

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood, lime, bags, paper, fruit and vegetables to have more variety so she can meet the demands of her customers.

loans.name: Said

texts.en:
Said, who works in stone carving, borrowed 3,083,000 Lebanese pounds in late 2014 in order to buy some electrical tools he needed to improve his working conditions. With this loan and his new tools, he was able to expand his business by taking new projects that he could not complete before upgrading his toolkit. This expansion significantly improved his income and allowed him to move into his new house. 
Eager to always see his business grow, Said is now asking for a 3,854,912 Lebanese pounds loan from Kiva partner Ibdaa. He is planning on using the loan to buy a car that will allow him to move his heavy equipment more easily between projects and decrease his transportation costs.

loans.use: to buy a car so that he can move his building equipment between his job sites.

loans.name: Seingly's Group

texts.en:
Seingly’s group lives in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Seingly makes a living cultivating rice, and she also does extra work as farmer and seller to support her family.

In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Reina Concepcion

texts.es:
Reina es madre soltera, vive con su hijo de 12 años de edad, su negocio es elaborar tortillas para vender, lo tiene desde hace cinco años, sus ingresos son de subsistencia pero es una persona responsable con sus compromisos.
Será de utilidad para comprar materia prima como maíz, leña, cal y bolsas para preparar la venta de tortillas, la finalidad es incrementar la producción, atender a nuevos clientes y mejorar las ventas, tiene la esperanza de generar mejores ingresos para disminuir las necesidades de su hogar.
 Aspira a ser reconocida por sus clientes como una persona honesta y responsable, así como también  ser ejemplo de superación para su hijo.
texts.en:
Reina is a single mother with a 12-year-old son.  For five years she has been in business selling tortillas.  Although her income is only enough to survive on, she is a responsible person who fulfills her commitments.

She needs to buy raw materials such as corn, firewood, lime and bags to increase tortilla production and attend to new customers.  This will improve sales and, hopefully, generate more income to cover household needs.

She aspires to being known among her customers as an honest, responsible person, and also wants to be an inspiration to her son.

loans.use: To buy raw materials such as corn, firewood, lime and bags to increase tortilla production.

loans.name: Margress

texts.en:
Margress 56 lives in Kabwe District, Zambia with her family of ten. She is asking for a Kiva loan to buy an engine for a maize milling machine so that she can provide a milling service to 300 families in her community.

The maize milling machine takes raw maize (corn) and creates a maize flour which is the staple food in Zambia. Most rural families in Kabwe District grow maize on their small farms and store it and use it as their primary supply of food for the year. After the kernels are removed from the cob, they then have to be milled to create flour, which can then be boiled to make what is locally called Nshima.

Rent-to-Own has done market research in Margress community and has determined that the location for this equipment is good. The closest maize mill is about 5 km away, This means most potential customers have to travel about 5 km, and since most will walk or use their bicycles to travel to the maize mill, it is certain they will prefer to use this maize mill rather than traveling a longer distance.

Equipment such as a maize mill can be a major boost for many enterprising farmers such as Margress, as it allows for her to diversify her business. Unfortunately, the upfront costs of such a maize mill are very prohibitive. Once she secures a loan, Margress will be able to get an engine for a maize mill from Rent-to-Own, which will deliver the equipment, as well as provide training on how to use and maintain it. This loan will help Margress on the path to building up a viable business that can provide for her community throughout the year. It is for this reason Margress is asking Kiva lenders to help her with the loan so that she can secure a maize mill as soon as possible.

loans.use: to pay for a hammer mill engine to grind maize in her community.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy new clothing lines for the Adha Eid festival.

loans.name: Dina Maribel

texts.es:
Dina, de 43 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar por las condiciones económicas, está casada y su esposo se dedica a trabajar en la agricultura, ella es madre de 7 hijos de los cuales 1 de ellos ya está casado y vive aparte, los demás están estudiando.

Dina, se dedica a los oficios domésticos y a la agricultura, junto a su esposo han desarrollado esta actividad desde hace mucho tiempo, ellos venden una parte de sus cosechas y el resto es para consumo familiar.- En los oficios de la casa le ayudan sus hijas y en los trabajos agrícolas le ayudan sus hijos cuando tienen tiempo libre.

El préstamo lo necesita para comprar 4 sacos de abono fertilizante y además pagar la mano de obra en los cultivos; en la primera cosecha tuvo pérdidas, debido a la sequía que sufrió el país, es por eso que necesita el dinero para comprar nuevamente los insumos y poder sembrar otra vez.

Los sueños de Dina son, que todos sus hijos se preparen académicamente y se gradúen de una carrera universitaria; además desea reparar su casa porque está deteriorada.
texts.en:
Dina, 43, was unable to get an education for economic reasons.  She is married and her husband works in agriculture.  They has seven children, one of whom is married and lives independently.  The others attend school.

Dina is a homemaker and also works in agriculture with her husband.  They have been in the business for quite some time and sell part of the produce they grow.  The rest is for family consumption.  Her daughters help with the housework and all the children help with the farm work in their free time.

The loan will be used to buy four sacks of fertilizer and hire workers for the crops.  In the first harvest there were losses due to the drought suffered in the country.  Therefore she needs money to buy supplies in order to plant more crops.

Dina dreams of giving her children a good education with a university degree.  She also wants to carry out home repairs because of the deterioration.

loans.use: To buy four sacks of fertilizer and hire workers for the crops.

loans.name: Seab's Group

texts.en:
Seab’s group lives in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Seab makes a living cultivating rice, and she also does extra work as a farmer to support her family. She has two young children in her family.

In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Hei's Group

texts.en:
Hei’s group lives in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Hei makes a living cultivating rice, and she also does extra work as a farmer to support her family.

In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Karima

texts.en: Karima is a 28 year old married woman of two children. Her husband represents the main income source for the family in order to fulfil their family needs and being always ready to meet always their demands. Today, in order to pay her children study fees, she is applying for a new loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. She said that she is very happy and satisfied as she is able to help them and ensure them a suitable educational path.

loans.use: to pay her children's study fees.

loans.name: Florinda

texts.pt:
A sra Florinda tem 52 anos de idade, solteira e mãe de dois filhos maiores de idade. Vive em casa própria. Tem mercearia e bar no quintal da sua casa. Vende produtos da primeira necessidade e cerveja diversa. Com o empréstimo pretende reforçar a mercadoria adquirindo refrescos, sumos, lâmpadas, arroz, pão, amendoim, farinha de trigo e de milho, peixe, frangos, vorse, carne de porco e de vaca para revender.
Ela  sonha em ampliar o seu negócio e abraçar outros negócios, visto que o mercado está saturado de mercearias. O seu desafio é reembolsar o empréstimo dentro do prazo estabelecido
texts.en:
Florinda is 42 years old. She is single, and the mother of two adult children. They own the house where they live. She has a store and a bar in her yard. She sells essential products and different types of beer.

With this loan, she is planning muy more products to sell. She will buy sodas, juices, light bulbs, rice, bread, peanuts, corn and wheat flour, fish, chickens, vorse (South African sausages), pork, and beef for resale.

Her dream is to expand her business and explore other business opportunities, considering that the market is saturated with products. She faces the challenge of paying off the loan according to plan.

loans.use: to buy sodas, juices, light bulbs, rice, bread, peanuts, corn and wheat flour, fish, chickens, sausages, pork, and beef.

loans.name: Islam

texts.en:
Islam is a 40-year-old, married man from Rafah city, which is located in the Gaza Strip. He works as an employee in the public sector, where he gets a low income. This income barely covers all the family needs, but he wants to make his family more comfortable and improve their standard of living.

So, Islam took a USD loan from FATEN, which will enable him to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house. By taking this loan, Islam will be able to decrease the electricity expenses, while using a cleaner form of energy (rather than gas).

Islam’s family will have an easier time heating water for showers, cooking, and also washing clothes and dishes.

Islam appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house.

loans.name: Farac

texts.en:
Farac is 56 year old, married and he has 3 kids. Farac is is IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with his family in Bilasuvar region. His wife is a teacher. He grows and sells fruits (pomegranate,apples, pears, lemons) and vegetables (greens, potatoes, tomatoes, cucumbers, onions) at the local bazaar. His monthly income is 190 AZN. I Farac's elder son helps him to grow fruits and vegetables.

Azeri people like eating delicious and fresh vegetables. Beside that vegetables are used in preparing different soups (tomato soup, lentil soup), salads, national dishes such as roasted eggplant and etc.. Peoples' demand in fruit is also high. They use fruits to make fresh juice, fruit pies, different sorts of jam.

He wants to expand his business and improve his family's life condition. Therefore he applied for 1200AZN loan. He will use this money to buy more fertilizers and garden tools.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers and garden tools.

loans.name: Mojarritas Group

texts.es:
En el estado de Oaxaca se localiza una comunidad cuya actividad económica principal es la pesca de un pez llamado “mojarra”. La mayor parte de los habitantes se adentra a la gran presa a bordo de pequeñas barcas llamadas “chalupas” que tienen su origen desde tiempos prehispánicos. Asimismo dicha presa es estimada por los  lugareños ya que les ofrece energía eléctrica por medio de una planta construida en sus límites. 
   Huelga decir que el porqué del nombre del grupo ubicado allí, Las Mojarritas; los integrantes son: Selene quien vende garrafones de agua; Alejandra, Marina y Valentina, comida típica; Juana, ganado; Reyna, ropa; José y Felipa, madera; Pedro, pescado y Cristina junto con Alejandra, pez mojarra. 
   Doña Juana y su esposo Hugo son personas muy amigables y trabajadoras quienes toda su vida se han dedicado al campo. Quien motivó a Juana para iniciar con la cría de ganado fue su hijo pues comenta que, “de niño siempre nos decía que él quería tener un rancho con muchas vacas y fue entonces cuando le regalamos la primera vaquita a la que llamo Toñita”. Desde entonces no han secado su actividad y ahora cuentan con un potrero donde los bovinos suelen pastar, correr, dormir y procrearse; en puntos estratégicos han colocado comederos y bebederos de tal manera que el ganado se desarrolla en óptimas condiciones.
   Mientras ella aporta el capital para la inversión, su hijo se dedica a comprar el ganado, además de darles todos los cuidados e incluso llevarlos al veterinario si es necesario. Las ganancias obtenidas le han sido de utilidad para solventar los gastos de su hogar y personales. De igual modo, ha comenzado la  cría de pollos y ovejas, “espero poder consolidar mi sueño y tener una pequeña granja” expresa con una sonrisa en el rostro.
   Por otro lado, cada uno de los préstamos que Visión F México le ha otorgado han sido en beneficio de su actividad por lo que se encuentra muy agradecida. El préstamo actual le permitiría comprar dos vacas.
*Ellos son los integrantes del grupo Mojarritas, la fotografía fue tomada en la novia del sol, Doña Juana viste blusa color rojo.
texts.en:
In the state of Oaxaca there is a community where the majority of the inhabitants earn their living fishing for a type of sea bream called mojarra. The local people go to a large dam on their small boats called chalupas which date back to prehispanic times. The dam is well-regarded by the local people as it provides electricity from a plant built on the edge of the dam. It isn't surprising that the group from this area is called Las Mojarritos.

The members of the group are Selene who sells bottled water; Alejandra, Marina and Valentina who sell local dishes; Juana who raises cattle; Reya who sells clothing; José and Felipe who sell wood; Pedro who sells fish; and Cristina and Alejandro who fish for sea bream.

Sra. Juana and her husband Hugo are very friendly and hardworking people who have lived all their lives in the countryside. It was her son who encouraged Juana to start to raise cattle. Ever since he was a child he always wanted to have a ranch with many cows, and when they gave him his first calf, he called it Toñita. Since then they have continued with this work and now have a paddock where cows can eat the grass, run around, sleep, and breed. In various advantageous spots they have built feeding and drinking troughs where the animals can develop in optimum conditions.

While Juana brings loan money to the table, her son buys the cattle as well as looking after them including taking them to the vet when necessary. The money they earn is used to pay for household and personal expenses.

In a similar way Juana has started raising poultry and sheep. With a smile on her face she says that she hopes to fulfil her dream and own a small farm. Every one of the loans she has had with Visión F México has been of great benefit to her business, and for that she is very grateful. The current loan will allow her to buy two cows.

The members of Los Mojarritos can be seen in this photo. Sra. Juana is wearing a red blouse.

loans.use: buy two cows.

loans.name: Genoveva

texts.en:
Genoveva owns and operates a trisikad (rickshaw). She earns rent from that vehicle. Aside from that, she also raises and sells hogs and poultry. She is a 51 year old married woman with two grown children. She hails from the town of Barili, Cebu. She is in need of funds.

She would like to improve her both sources of income. She decided to avail the loan. Genoveva has requested a loan to buy another rickshaw and purchase piglets and chicken. With these, her income will slowly improve. She will now be able to buy more pigs and able to roll-over her capital.

Thus she could now start to expand her both sources of income to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy another rickshaw and purchase piglets and chicken.

loans.name: Madelyn

texts.en:
Madelyn is a woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Madelyn is 25 years old and has one child in school.

Madelyn has a dried fish vending business in the Philippines. Madelyn requested a PHP 6000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more variety of fish to sell.

Madelyn has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, Madelyn would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more variety of fish to sell

loans.name: Gulshan

texts.en:
Gulshan is an active borrower of Kiva and BRAC Pakistan. She is a mother of 3 children and her husband has been running a auto spare parts shop for past 23 years. Gulshan wants to expand the size of her husband business so that her husband can fulfill the demands of his daily customers and provide better reselling services of auto spare parts,. But due to financial problems her husband is not in such position to bear these expanses.
Therefore she has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable him to afford all relevant expanses in the expansion of his business and buy the above relevant items to fulfill his customers needs. On this financial assistance Gulshan is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's spare parts business.

loans.name: Zosan

texts.en:
Zosan runs a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells items ranging from powdered milk, coffee, sugar, vinegar, bread and biscuits to mosquito repellent and condiments.

She is 44 years old and a married woman with three children. Her oldest is 20, while the youngest is 10.

She hails from the town of Pilar, Bohol.

A loan of 23,000 PHP would help Zosan to buy groceries for the store like seasonings, soft drinks, toiletries and canned goods. These will fill her store with abundant supply to display, which could attract more consumers to purchase.

Slowly, she could be able to continue to provide her growing children with good food and better shelter in which to live.

She is determined that she will be handling her source of income successfully for the welfare of her family.

loans.use: to buy groceries for the store like seasonings, soft drinks, toiletries and canned goods.

loans.name: Anne

texts.en:
Anne is 28 years old. She is single and has one child. Her business is beauty products and farming. She has been in the business for 10 years. She earns a monthly income of 25,000 Kenya shillings.

This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to purchase stock of hair bands, lipsticks, sanitary pads, bangles, chains, caps, etc.

She will use the profits from her expanded business to reinvest into the business. Her hopes and dreams are to grow her business and have a stable family.

loans.use: to purchase stock of hair bands, lipsticks, sanitary pads, bangles, chains, caps, etc.

loans.name: Petrolina

texts.en:
Petrolina is 54 years old. She is married and has three children. Her business is rearing dairy cows and mangoes, maize and cow peas farming. She has been in the business for 21 years. She earns a monthly income of twenty five thousand Kenya shillings. 

She has applied for her second loan from VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to purchase animal feeds and seeds.  She will use the profits from expanded business to improve the standard of living of her children. Her hopes and dreams are to grow her business to become a big dairy farmer

loans.use: to buy animal feeds and seedlings

loans.name: Najma

texts.en:
Najma is an active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. She lives with her five children and husband in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband is the guardian of her family and has been running a mobile phone shop for the past 12 years.
 
Najma's husband wants to purchase different types of mobile accessories for his business purpose, but due to insufficient financial means he is unable to purchase these accessories. Therefore, Najma has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan, she’ll enable her husband to purchase relevant items for his business so that he can earn more income to manage his business and household.

Najma is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband increase his mobile phone business.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is 36 years old, married, and has two children. He has a grinding machine project in which he uses the machine for grinding corn for people for bread.

He is requesting 10,000 EGP to buy corn to grind it and sell it to the people in his village, since all the other people who present the same service are located in remote areas.

loans.use: to buy corn to grind for sale.

loans.name: Nisrine

texts.en:
Nisrine is a 35-year-old married mother of three children. Five years ago, she started working in agriculture to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their family. She is a hard worker and a sacrificing mother who is trying desperately to provide her children with decent living conditions.

Today, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay her children's school tuition fees. She hopes to stay capable of providing her family with a better life.

loans.use: to pay her children's school tuition fees

loans.name: Candelaria  Del Carmen

texts.es:
Candelaria es una mujer adulta de cincuenta y dos años de edad, madre de seis hijos, que junto a su negocio de venta de comida, ha logrado sacar adelante. Su esposo es el principal apoyo que ella tiene para emprender cada día con fuerza y empeño. Ella ya ha trabajado con un financiamiento de Kiva junto a MiCrédito, por el cual está profundamente agradecida y confía fielmente en ambas instituciones. 
Su negocio siempre requiere inyecciones de capital, por lo tanto ella ha vuelto a tocar las puertas de Kiva junto a MiCrédito, para que se le brinde un préstamo que le permita comprar arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, verduras, entre otras cosas que utiliza como materia prima. Luego de cancelar este financiamiento planea solicitar uno de saneamiento para instalar un inodoro y asi mejorar las condiciones de higiene de su hogar.
texts.en:
Candelaria is 52 years old and a mother of six children. She sells food to get ahead. Her husband is the main supporter in undertaking each day with strength and determination. She has worked with Kiva through MiCrédito. She is deeply grateful and has a faithful trust in both institutions.

Her business always requires capital inputs. For this reason, she has returned to Kiva with MiCrédito. She requests a loan to buy rice, beans, sugar, oil, vegetables among other things. After paying off this funding, she plans to request one for sanitation to install a toilet and improve the hygiene of her home.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, sugar, oil, vegetables among other things.

loans.name: Fozia

texts.en:
Fozia is a 28-year-old woman, and she lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her three children. Her husband is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the family. Fozia also provides sewing services, earning an income to contribute with her husband toward managing the household.

She needs different kinds of goods such as needles, threads, pieces of clothes, and machine oil for her business, but due to insufficient financial means she is unable to purchase these accessories. Therefore she has applied for a Kiva loan from Kiva's field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her to purchase these above accessories and will also help her to increase monthly sales and profits by providing better sewing services.

Fozia is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: purchase supplies to improve her tailoring business.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is 22 years old, married, and has one child. She is very ambitious and her willpower will help her to achieve her dreams and be a successful woman in the future. She increased her challenge raising her child and working at the same time. 

Fatima started her business selling clothes in her home to improve the standards of living for her family. She now wants to expand her business to increase her income. She requested a loan, which she will use to buy winter clothes to be ready for the season and to increase her profits.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en:
Zainab started her own business two years ago to help her husband with the household expenses and to educate her four children.

Zainab is selling curtains in her home that is located in a crowded area in West Irbid, and she is getting good income from this business.

Because she wants to help her husband more and more, she decided to apply for a loan to help her buy more fabrics to sew curtains to sell.

Zainab wants to improve the standards of living for her family.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and new tools to make curtains to sell.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.pt:
A sra Julieta tem 44 anos de idade, separada e mãe de 03 filhos dos quais 02 estão com o pai e 01 está na sua responsabilidade. Vive em casa dos pais juntamente com o seu filho menor de idade. Tem uma capoeira em casa da sua mãe e cria frangos. Fornece em grandes mercearias da sua zona. Com o emprestimo, pretende aumentar o volume de pintos, ração e vacinas pois, tem muitos cliente e não consegue fornecer os frangos devidamente.
Ela sonha em ampliar o seu negócio e construir a sua casa. O seu desafio é reembolsar o empréstimo dentro do prazo estabelecido
texts.en:
Julieta is 44 years old. She is separated, and the mother of three children; two of them live with their father, and one is under her care. She lives at her parents', together with her underage son. She has a pen there, where she raises chickens. She buys what she needs from large local stores.

With the loan, she is planning to increase the number of chicks, and buy animal feed and vaccines, since she has many customers and is not able to deliver them as she should.

She dreams of expanding her business and building her house. Her challenge is to pay off the loan according to plan.

loans.use: to buy chicks, animal feed, and vaccines.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane owns a farm. She works the land and grows rice. She is 27 years old with a three-year old dependent. Her partner is a construction worker.

Jane has been engaged in rice farming for almost three years. She decided to take a loan to boost her farming livelihood. She is asking for a loan to buy seeds and fertilizers. These could enhance the ongoing yield of her farm and produce quality rice. This will cause her income to improve and she will be able to start to settle her finances. She could then set aside some savings for the welfare of her growing child.

Jane is determined that her farming livelihood will become successful in the years to come.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Joazinho

texts.pt:
O sr Joaozinho, de 50 anos de idade, casado e pai de 05 filhos dos quais, uma casada, um a frequentar o ensino superior e os restantes no ensino secundário. Para além dos seus filhos, sustenta ainda uma sobrinha que também frequentam o ensino secundário. É técnico de contabilidade no Estado e tem uma mercearia no quintal de casa vendendo produtos da primeira necessidade e, com este financiamento vai comprar açúcar, arroz, óleo, amendoim, vinhos, refrescos, cervejas para reforçar o volume do seu negócio.
Este,  sonha em ampliar o seu negócio e futuramente comprar uma viatura para facilitar nas compras de produtos. O desafio é financeiro e vai redobrar o esforço para reembolsar o empréstimo em menos tempo.
texts.en:
Joaozinho, 50, is married and the father of five children. One of her daughters is married, a son goes to the university, and the remaining children go to secondary school. Besides his children, he still sustains a niece that goes also to secondary school.

He works for the State, as an Accounting Technician. He also has a store in his yard, where he sells essential products. With this loan, he will buy sugar, rice, cooking oil, peanuts, wine, sodas, and beer to increase his store's stock levels.

He dreams of expanding his business, and in the future, buying a vehicle to purchase the products more easily. His challenge is financial in nature, and he will work double as hard to pay off the loan before the agreed date.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, cooking oil, peanuts, wine, sodas, and beer to increase his store's stock levels.

loans.name: Nicholas

texts.en:
Nicholas is 22 years old. He is married and has two children. His business is a motorcycle taxi. He has been in this business for nine years. He earns a monthly income of 20,000 Kenya shillings.

This is his first loan from VisionFund Kenya. He will use the loan to buy a motorcycle. He will use the profits from his expanded business to pay school fees for his children and meet the family budget.

His hopes and dreams are to expand his business, have a better business and better his family.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Hussain

texts.en:
Hussain is 44 years old and he is a caring father. Hussain is working very hard to provide a living for his family; he wants to ensure a better life and educate them in the best schools.

He is working with a low income, and because of the high cost of living he decided to open his own business, which is a grocery store. Now he is trying to apply for a loan to buy food supplies and new drinks to increase his income, so that he can enlarge his business.

Hussain needs your support to achieve his dreams.

loans.use: to buy food supplies and new products to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy various fabrics, elastic, and thread.

loans.name: Kinaz

texts.en:
Kinaz, a 34-year-old ambitious Lebanese woman, lives in the Chouf mountains of Lebanon. She is married to a construction worker and together they have four kids.

Kinaz was always talented at knitting since she used to practice it with her mother when she was younger. In 2012, she decided to start selling her products in order to earn extra income. She works from home, keeping a balance between raising her children and supporting her husband financially. Being honest and professional with her clients, Kinaz has made herself a very good reputation among those in the area who know her.

In order to buy some wool and new knitting equipment, Kinaz is asking for a 1,234,327 Lebanese pound (LPB) loan for the first time from Kiva's partner Ibdaa. Kinaz believes that by buying the new equipment, she will be able to improve the quality of her work, raise her income and increase her contribution to her family's expenses.

loans.use: to buy wool for knitting before the winter season.

loans.name: Minerva

texts.en:
Minerva is a 29-year-old married Lebanese woman living with her husband and one child, who is studying. Her husband is the main income provider, and as for her, she doesn't work, she cares for their home and family.

Currently, with the aim to pay her child's study fees, she is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. She is a permanent customer and she insist that she will always ask for Kiva’s support to ensure a good educational path for her children as this is their only target.

loans.use: to pay for her child's study fees.

loans.name: Abizeranye Bugesera Group

texts.en:
Annonciata is 46 years old and married with 4 children, ages 9-19. Annonciata, president of the group ABIZERANYE BUGESERA, is the one with her hand raised.

For the past four years, she has been running a boutique store selling sugar, salt, cooking oil and lotions. There are 18 members in the group, but only 14 are shown because 4 members had children who were sick.

She requested this loan through Vision Finance Company to purchase more sugar, salt, cooking oil, rice, etc, and she says that the extra income from this loan will help her improve her family status and increase her business level.

In the future, she would like to be a wholesaler.

loans.use: to expand her boutique by purchasing more sugar, salt, cooking oil, etc to sell.

loans.name: Ekome Feemo 2 Group

texts.en:
The Ekome Feemo 2 Group will start its tenth loan cycle with ID-Ghana as a part of the branch loan system. It is made up of two members and is led by the group leader Mary O. The businesses that the members of this group have are varied. Among them are selling banku (cooked corn and cassava paste) and fry fish, firewood, sachet water and fish.

The loan she will take out will benefit the micro-businesswomen, including Mary O. She indicates that she joined ID-Ghana five years ago at the invitation of a friend who is a part of the institution. At this time, she has a business selling Banku (cooked corn and cassava paste) and fry fish, firewood and sachet water. She says that she started this business several years ago, with a relative. This is her third loan from Kiva.

The loan she will take out now is to increase capital to buy corn and cassava paste, fish, firewood and sachet water, with which she will prepare banku to sell to customers. She will acquire them from sellers in the city of Accra to later sell them in her sales space. This type of work allows her to generate resources to support her family financially because she is a widow working with her children to take care of her grandchildren.

When asked what she likes about ID-Ghana, she responds that she likes the loans and the area of health that the institution offers.

loans.use: to increase capital to buy corn and cassava paste, fish, firewood and sachet water with which she will prepare Banku to sell to customers.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is 27 years old. She is a single mother blessed with two children. She has had a retail business for three years, and currently she earns a monthly income of 30,000 KES. She has borrowed 60,000 KES from Visionfund Kenya as her second loan after successfully paying the previous loan. She will use the loan to purchase household goods to sell. Grace hopes that the anticipated profit will help her buy food for the family, pay school fees for her children, pay for medical care, expand the business, and repay her loan. Her hopes and dreams for the future are to have a well established  business and enjoy a better live with her family."

loans.use: to purchase household goods.

loans.name: Islam

texts.en:
Islam is 30, married and has one son.

Islam has a small cleansers sales project, which is the only source of income for his family.

Islam is requesting a 6,000 EGP loan to buy more cleansers to increase his sales for his family.

loans.use: to buy more cleansers.

loans.name: Kamila

texts.en: Kamila is 51 years old and owns an accessories shop in the heart of Beirut. She is married to a retired military officer, and together they live with their son and two daughters also in Beirut. She opened her shop three years ago and sells all types of souvenirs, accessories, stationary, and gifts. Since establishing her own business, Kamila became well known in the area and now has her own clients. She is asking for a 1,543,658 Lebanese Pounds loan for the first time from Kiva partner Ibdaa. She needs the loan to buy new products to sell during the week of Eid. This increase in her supplies is expected to have a positive impact on her income that will allow her to support her family.

loans.use: to buy additional products to sell

loans.name: Muslim

texts.en: Muslim is 35 and married to a housewife. They have one son and one daughter. He has a small grocery store, which is the only source of income for the family. He is requesting 4000 EGP loan to buy grocery products such as biscuits, pasta and rice to sell in his store.

loans.use: to buy grocery products to sell.

loans.name: Basila

texts.en:
Basila is a Lebanese married woman. She’s 34 years old and has four children. She is really attached to her family. She and her husband works tirelessly to be able to cover the heavy expenses in order to live a respectable life.

Today, because a new school year is coming, she is asking for a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to pay her children's educational fees.

The family's only target and dream is to see those children achieve higher positions.

loans.use: to pay her children's educational fees.

loans.name: Wahida

texts.en:
Wahide is a 34-year-old married woman living with her husband; she is the mother of five children. Her husband is the main income source in the family, but she works also a part-time job in order to help him financially.

Due to the hard financial circumstances and with the aim to help her children with their education, she is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to be able to pay their school educational fees.

Her only dream is to ensure them a full life, help them to achieve high educational levels and always being able to satisfy their needs.

loans.use: to pay school educational fees.

loans.name: Nahil

texts.en:
Nahil is a 59-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and four children. Her husband is the income source in the family in order to fulfil their family needs and improve their lifestyle. He works as a farmer. Nahil doesn't work.

Today she is in need of a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to pay her daughter's technical school fees.

It would make her very happy to be able to ensure her daughter a suitable education and secure a brilliant future.

loans.use: to pay her daughter's technical school fees.

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Leonila works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from charcoal vending. Leonila is borrowing PHP 14000 through NWTF to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies for her fishing business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Leonila has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other  fishing supplies

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 55 years old and married with six children. With two children in school, Erlinda works very hard to provide for them.

Erlinda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like junk foods, noodles, canned goods, home product care, and other groceries.

Erlinda has been in this business for 3 years and sells a variety of items. 

In the future, Erlinda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like junk foods, noodles, canned goods, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: purchase a supply of adults' and children's outfits.

loans.name: Arely Del Carmen

texts.es:
Arely, se siente satisfecha por los resultados obtenidos al invertir el crédito anterior en su negocio, ya que puede aportar más ingresos para los gastos de su hogar, está mejorando el equipo del comedor y el núcleo familiar se mantiene.
Considera que debe atender mejor a su nueva cartera de clientes, por lo que se decidió a solicitar un nuevo crédito para poder comprar una mesa térmica en la que conservara la comida caliente durante el día.
texts.en:
Arely feels satisfied with the results from investing her previous loan into her business, since now she can contribute more income toward the expenses of her home. She is improving the dining room equipment and supports her family.

She believes she should look after her customers better, which is why she decided to request a new loan to buy a warming table to keep food warm during the day.

loans.use: to buy a warming table to keep food warm during the day.

loans.name: Marta

texts.en: Marta is a business women and she has a small kiosk, so she is requesting a loan of $ 1000.00 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business. She will use the loan to buy some additional supplies to keep in her kiosk, such as noodles, biscuits, soy sauce, sardines, candy, coffee, aqua, sugar, hand body, including soft drinks, hard drinks and other things to sell. Marta started to open her kiosk in 2013 with her own working capital of $150.00. She is happy with the loan that offered from Tuba Rai Metin for her to have more working capital to buy more goods and to repair her kiosk.

loans.use: to buy noodles, biscuits, soy sauce, sardines, candy, coffee, aqua, sugar, hand body, including soft drinks and hard drinks.

loans.name: Odinakhon

texts.ru: Одинахон очень веселая женщина в возрасте 37 лет, она замужем имеет 2 детей. Ей нравиться заниматься откормом скота, это ремесло имеет много препятствий и трудностей, потому что скот может заболеть если не вовремя сделать прививку или другие необходимые лекарства. Если плохо ухаживать и плохо кормить скот может похудеть и не давать потомство. Поэтому в бизнесе помогает сын и муж. Одинахон положительная женщина имеет большую дружную семью. Для содержания своей семьи Одинахон приходится много трудиться. Она занимается животноводством и переработкой молока. В этом деле ей помогает и муж. Полученный доход от содержания крупного рогатого скота и продажи молока они расходуют на семью и понемногу помогают пожилым родителям. Одинахон хочет дать хорошее образование детям . Это является её мечтой так, как сама он не смогла получить хорошее образование. Для воплощения её мечты в реальность она должна трудиться ещё больше и увеличивать свой бизнес. Для увеличения поголовья ей не достает небольшой суммы. Одинахон брала в прошлом кредит в "Арванде" и так, как обслуживание и условия предоставления кредита в этом банке удовлетворяют его потребности она решила повторно обратиться в Арванд.Сейчас она обратилась в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку скота. Она очень надеется на поддержку.
texts.en:
Odinakhon is an upbeat 37-year old woman. She is married and has two children. She  enjoys raising livestock; this work involves many challenges and difficulties, because the animals can get sick if they do not get their vaccinations or other necessary medications on time. When animals are neglected and underfed, they can lose weight and stop producing offspring. Therefore Odinakhon’s son and husband help her in this work. Odinakhon is a reliable person and has a close-knit family. In order to provide for her family, Odinakhon has to work hard. She raises livestock and processes milk. Her husband also helps her in this. They use their income from their cattle business and milk sales to support their family, and also help their aged parents as much as they can. Odinakhon would like to give a good education for her children. This is her dream because she did not have access to a good education herself. 

In order to realize her dream, Odinakhon needs to keep working and developing her business. She lacks a small amount of money to increase her cattle headcount. In the past Odinakhon already took out a loan from Arvand, and since she found the loan conditions and the bank services satisfactory, she decided to reach out to Arvand again. At present she applied for a loan to buy cattle. She is really hoping for support.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Shazia's Group

texts.en:
Shazia is a 39-year old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She has requested a loan for her husband's fruit selling business. He owns a fruit selling business in a nearby fruit market. With the increase in the household expenses, she wants to grow the business also.

Therefore, she has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her husband will be able to buy fresh and seasonal fruits. She wants to save the profit amount so that she can face any sudden incidents or for medical treatment for her children.

Shazia hopes that this loan will prove productive for her and she will save a reasonable amount soon. She is very thankful to Kiva and field partner Brac Pakistan.
Note: Shazia stands with a raised hand in the given picture.

loans.use: to buy fresh and seasonal fruits for her husband's fruits selling business.

loans.name: Zaynahom

texts.en:
Zaynahom is 38, married, and has one son and two daughters. She started a small clothing sales project to help her husband with the family income. She previously requested 4,000 EGP and successfully repaid it on the due date.

She is requesting an 8,000 EGP loan to buy more clothing to sell to increase her income for the start of the school year.

loans.use: to buy more clothing to sell.

loans.name: Flor De Anonas Group

texts.en:
The people of the small town of Las Anonas need to take a micro-bus to and from the main city of San Miguel Uspantan in the far Western Highlands of the State of Quiche.  Seven women formed the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Flor de Anona”.  They have an elementary education.  On-the-other-hand, many of them speak four languages - Spanish, Uspanteko, K’iche and Kaqchikel.  The women have an average of four to six children.  In their small businesses, they raise animals - pigs, goats, and cows.   

Isabel is 42 years old and married with six children ages 8 years to 21 years old.  Her children are all attending school from elementary to high school.  She is very proud that she can provide a good life and education for her children with the earnings from her business.  When she first began receiving loans from Friendship Bridge five years ago, she did not see much growth in her income but little by little her income has grown to the point where she has been able to buy 3 properties where she has raised goats and chickens.  Now, in a first loan cycle with KIVA investors, she is asking for a loan to buy two goats and two cows. 

The women of “Flor de Anona” enthusiastically report that they have been very prompt in repaying their loans and look forward to the monthly educational sessions that the Friendship Bridge Facilitator provides.  The women grow stronger, more empowered and have more self-esteem that they then pass on to their families.  The generosity of KIVA investors helps to make this happen.  Thank you!

loans.use: to buy two goats and two cows.

loans.name: Lemuel

texts.en: Lemuel is a 57-year-old man from Carles, Iloilo. He is a father of a 17-year-old school aged child. He earns a living with a fishing business. He has been doing this for 10 years. He is asking a loan to buy fishing net to improve his catch. In the future, he dreams to improve their livelihood to have enough money to send his daughter to college and finished a degree.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es: Don Francisco de 58 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hija, el se dedica desde hace varios años al cultivo de maiz, comercializa sus prodcutos en los pubelos aledaños y ya tiene muchos clients con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el esta solicitando un credito para la compra de insumos agricolas como abonos, fertilizantes, controles de plagas, etc. para tener una buena cosecha y asi tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en:
Francisco, 58, lives in his own house with his daughter.  For several years he has been growing corn which he sells in neighboring villages.  He has many customers and is able to cover household expenses with the profit he earns.

The loan he is requesting is to buy farm supplies including manures, fertilizers, pest control agents, etc. for a good harvest and in order to increase his income.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies such as manure, fertilizers, pest control agents, etc.

loans.name: Goodness 1 Group

texts.en:
The group is called Goodness 1. It is in its cycle number 7 of the loan program of the branch. They all have their different work which includes groceries, stationery, underwear, wigs, liquid soap, dresses, trousers, cosmetics and tops. They are from an urban poor area and are working hard to better their family lives and also secure more safe and sustainable work.

One of the members is Rita, a hard-working and determined woman. Her work is the sale of wigs and cosmetics. She says she starts her work very early, as she starts to sell cosmetics and wigs to her clients. She says that she has very good clients and that she is doing all her best to improve every day. Part of this work is to expand her business so that she could satisfy her customers better

She asks for this loan to invest in the purchase of wigs and cosmetics in large quantities, so that in this way she can continue with her work, working hard to be able to improve. She is thankful for the opportunity she receives to be able to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase wigs and cosmetics in large quantities, so that in this way she can continue with her work, working hard to be able to improve.

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.en:
Francisco is a man in his middle 30's. He has no kids and is not married, but he has a girlfriend named Carolina and he has been waiting to have a fair income to marry her.

Today, Francisco makes a living by selling clothes on a street stand. He sells new clothes and claims it is a humble but honest business, that has given him a good economical support, is one of the biggest achievements of his live to be able to raise this busines. The business is also his biggest long term dream, he wants to see it grow as much as possible.

Francisco is pictured at his stand while waiting for clients. He has been in this business long enough to know when a good selling season is coming and he thinks this is the time to create a bigger stock for the upcoming demand. In order to be able to meet with the season demand he is seeking a 8,422.00 MXN loan that will let him buy a variety of clothes like shirts, jeans, shoes and so on.

loans.use: to buy clothing stock for the season .

loans.name: Alcatraz Group

texts.es:
Una comunidad oaxaqueña es célebre porque la vía que transporta la gran locomotora conocida como “la bestia” atraviesa toda su extensión. Muchas historias van y vienen sobre los rieles desde los trabajadores que tienen que transportar melaza, vidrio o azúcar hasta las personas que viajan en busca del “sueño americano”. De igual modo es notable el servicio que llevan varios médicos a la comunidad por medio del tren de la salud.
   En dicha comunidad se formó un grupo llamado Alcatraz, las integrantes escogieron nombre pues les gusta dicha flor, los miembros son: Martina y Hermenegilda quienes venden tacos; Adriana, comida típica; Yesenia, botanas; Rufino, pescado; Teodora, hielo y Guadalupe y Constantina, refresco. 
   Desde hace ocho años Doña Hermenegilda se ha dedicado a la venta de tacos debido a que su esposo es heredero de una tradición familiar cuyos miembros han realizado desde hace muchos años. La carne que ocupan es de oveja y su sabor es único pues la receta que ocupan tiene ingredientes especiales que la familia ha usado por generaciones. 
   Todos los días Hermenegilda se levanta desde muy temprano para tener lista la verdura, las salsas y, desde luego, las tortillas; cualquier esfuerzo vale la pena con tal de consentir a sus clientes. Por su parte, su esposo Crescencio de dedica a preparar la carne, en promedio venden de dos a tres ovejas por semana dependiendo la temporada. “Mientras yo preparo los tacos mi esposo despacha los refrescos y, por higiene, se encarga de cobrar a los clientes” comenta. 
El préstamo le será de utilidad pues lo invertirá en la compra de chile, maíz, servilletas, platos, vasos, leña y  refresco. Las ganancias les permiten solventar los gastos de la casa, reinvierten en la compra de materia prima y animales; “soy feliz con mi actividad, con mi familia y con mi escuela pues nunca es tarde para iniciar, gracias por cada oportunidad que nos brindan de crecer”.
   Por otra parte, está contenta ya que asiste a una escuela para adultos en donde le han enseñado a leer y escribir, y ahora comienza a realizar cuentas matemáticas. 
*La fotografía fue tomada en casa de Guadalupe, Doña Hermenegilda viste blusa estampada, pantalón rojo y está cargando a su nieto.
texts.en:
A community in Oaxaca is famous because the large train known as "la bestia" (the beast) passes through it.  Many stories come and go on the railway, from workers who come to transport molasses, glass or sugar, to people in search of the "American dream".  Many doctors also come to the community by way of the health train.

The community is where the communal bank called Alcatraz was formed.  The name is for a flower that the members like, they are: Martina and Hermenegilda who sell tacos; Adriana who sells typical foods; Yesenia, snack foods; Rufino, fish; Teodora, ice; and Guadalupe and Constantina who sell soft drinks.

For eight years Hermenegilda has been selling tacos since her husband inherited the tradition from his family who were in the business many years.  The meat they use is lamb and they have a unique recipe with special ingredients the family has used for generations.

Every day Hermenegildo gets up very early to prepare the vegetables, sauces and, of course, the tortillas; making every effort to please her customers.
