Her husband, Crescencio, prepares the meat and they sell an average of two or three sheep's worth per week, depending on the season.  "While I prepare the tacos my husband serves soft drinks.  For hygiene reasons, he also collects payment from the customers," she says.

The loan will be used to buy chilis, corn, napkins, plates, cups, firewood and soft drinks.  The earnings will be used to cover household expenses and to reinvest in raw materials and animals.  "I am pleased with my business, my family and my school, since it is never too late to start.  Thank you for every opportunity you give us to grow."

*The photo was taken at Guadalupe's house.  Hermenegilda is the one wearing a print blouse, red pants and holding her grandson.

loans.use: To buy chilis, corn, napkins, plates, cups, firewood and soft drinks.

loans.name: Hải

texts.en:
Mrs Hải is 36 years old and she is married. She has had a retail business selling dry food and general things for more than 10 years.Hải lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.
Her family is a low-income household in village. And the income from this job is not high enough to do what she really needs to comfort her life.

One of the most difficult problems in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase cement, brick, sand and equipment to build a new toilet.
This is Hải first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. She hopes that this loan could make her little dream come true.
In the future, Hải hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy and to make enough money to provide for her kids.

loans.use: to purchase cement, brick, sand and equipment to build a new toilet.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is 65 years old. He is married and has six children. He does various businesses of dairy farming, selling livestock and selling cereals. He has been in this business for 21 years. He earns a monthly income of 15,000 Kenya shillings.

This is his second loan from VisionFund Kenya. He will use the loan to buy animal feeds and medication for the cows. He will use the profits from his expanded business to expand the business and improve the standards of living of his family.

His hopes and dreams are to expand his business to be able to provide well for his family.

loans.use: to buy animal feeds and medication for the cows.

loans.name: Lialyn

texts.en: Lialyn is married with two grown children. She is 45 years old and lives in Sibutad, Zamboanga Del Norte, Philippines. Lialyn is planting eggplants and different kind of vegetables in order to sell it in the market. She has been selling crops for over 3 years and has made favorable returns. Her spouse works as a private employee. Lialyn joined and gain access in GDMPC.  She requests a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers to enhance the growth of crops. In the future, Lialyn hopes to expand the cultivated area and raise more of these plants to gain more profit.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for her vegetables garden

loans.name: Joventino

texts.en:
Joventino is single and has a pig fattening business in the Philippines.

Joventino requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds and other supplies to raise his pigs.

Joventino has been in this business for eight years now.

In the future, Joventino would like to save money to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and other supplies to raise pigs.

loans.name: André

texts.fr:
Agé de 29 ans, André  est marié. Sa femme exerce comme activité le taxi phone. Le couple a un enfant de 2 ans. La famille habite dans une maison qu’elle loue. 
Avant, André vendait des œufs et des produits agricoles  séchés  il a abandonné cette première activité à cause  sa faible  rentabilité : hausse du prix à l’approvisionnement. 
Actuellement, Il vend des produits tels que torche, lampe, pile, montre, radio, carte, prise. Il dispose de 6 années d’expérience dans l’activité de petit commerce et , est actuellement à son cinquième prêt pour développer son activité.
L’objectif du couple est de pouvoir faire une épargne pour l’acquisition d’un terrain. La réussite de leurs enfants dans leurs études et leur vie est le rêve du couple.
texts.en:
André is married and 29 years old. His wife works in phone sales. The couple has a two-year-old child. The family lives in a house that they rent.

Previously, André sold eggs and dried agricultural products. He left this business due to its low profitability and increase in the price of supplies.

Currently, he sells products such as flashlights, lamps, batteries, watches, radios, cards, sockets. He has six years of experience in this small business and is currently on his fifth loan to expand his business.

The couple's goal is to save to purchase land. Their dream is to have their children succeed in their studies and in life.

loans.use: to buy wall clocks, lighters, radios, etc.

loans.name: Zeinab

texts.en:
Zeinab is a 25-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and two children. She is a housewife, taking care of her children while her husband provides for the family's needs.

Due to their difficult financial situation, and the fact that the new school year is near, she needs to borrow a loan from Kiva Partner Vitas s.a.l to buy school stationary. She said that she is very happy and always eager to borrow additional loans to help her children continue their education suitably.

loans.use: to buy school stationary.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 57 years old. He is married to Margaret, and they are blessed with three children, aged 16 years, 12 years and 8 years old.

He has had a farming business for 20 years, currently earning a monthly income of KES 15,000. He has borrowed KES 20,000 from VisionFund Kenya as his second loan, after paying the previous loan successfully.

David will be using the loan to purchase a cow. Therefore, he hopes that the anticipated profit will help him to buy food for his family, pay school fees for his children, cater for medical care, and expand his current business.

His hopes and dreams for the future are to have a successful crop and dairy business and enjoy a better life with his family.

loans.use: to purchase a cow

loans.name: Digna

texts.en: Digna operates their own vegetable garden for a living.She does planting, weeding and harvesting crops with her husband. For many years in farming, Digna sustained their living and had support her children's needs and was able to pay her previous loan. In order to increase farm produce, she borrowed a loan from GDMPC to buy new seedlings and fertilizer. With this, she is hopeful for a greener and more produce to deliver it in the market. In the near future, she wants to save some revenue and able to improve her vegetable garden to gain more for a better future of her family.

loans.use: to buy new seedlings and fertilizer

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha is a first-time borrower at Ugafode Microfinance, applying for a loan of 4,000,000 UGX. She is a married woman with children.

She is a businesswoman supplying and selling charcoal within the city. She is at times challenged with the problem of limited capital to meet the supply needed by her customers. In a bid to increase her working capital and expand the business, she has applied for a loan of 4,000,000 UGX so that she can buy charcoal in bulk and thereafter make increased profits.

She is also faced with the challenge of competition. She is very grateful for the support Ugafode Microfinance and Kiva lenders have offered to her, since she is now able to fund her business.

Pictured is Aisha (middle) with with her husband (right) and the UGAFODE Credit staff at the business.

loans.use: to boost her charcoal trade by buying more stock of charcoal.

loans.name: Hedra

texts.en: Hedra is 28, single, and has a small electrical goods sales project. He is requesting a 10,000 EGP loan to buy more electrical goods such as lamps, cables, and light starters to increase his monthly income and help his father with the family expenses.

loans.use: to buy more electrical goods such as lamps, cables, and light starters.

loans.name: Ghassan

texts.en:
Ghassan, is a 39-year-old married father of three children.
He has been working as a lift driver for five years now. His job is his only source for living and his limited monthly salary is barely enough to cover necessary daily living expenses.

Since his children's education is very important for him, he is requesting a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to pay for his children's school tuition fees and books expenses.
He hopes to be promoted in his work, to make sure he can provide his children with a better education in the future.

loans.use: to pay for his children's school tuition fees and books expenses.

loans.name: Felinas Group

texts.es:
Cerca de una de las fábricas azucareras más importantes de la región se encuentra una comunidad donde el sonido de los animales se convierte en música para los oídos de los habitantes. Por las mañanas, todos  los habitantes salen de sus hogares para ir a trabajar ya sea al campo ya sea al ingenio azucarero.  El ruido que produce el silbato dentro del complejo productor recuerda los cambios de turno que los obreros realizan. 
   En dicha comunidad se integró un grupo que lleva por nombre Felinas pues a sus miembros, mayormente mujeres, les encantas los gatos; actualmente está integrado por: Jessica quien vende dulces; Venancia, cosméticos y bordados artesanales; Alexis, ropa; Trinidad, lencería; María Luisa, tacos y Ma. Victoria, cosméticos. Por su parte María brinda servicios de enfermería y Anayanci, de estética. 
   Todos los fines de semana, a partir de las  6:00 pm, se puede encontrar un negocio dentro de  un pequeño corredor en donde cinco mesas y una parrilla son suficientes para elaborar los mejores tacos de la región. Dicho negocio es atendido por María Luisa quien con gran dedicación ofrece tacos de bistec, longaniza y carne de cerdo enchilada;  en una mesa al lado de la parrilla acomoda: los limones, la salsa, la sal, rábanos, pepinos y las indispensables tortillas.  
   Ella comenta que  “los tacos preferidos de mis clientes son los de tripa y bistec”  y no es raro ya que todo mexicano siente un gusto especial por dicha comida. Las ganancias le han permitido a Licha, como le llaman de cariño, apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa y comprar electrodomésticos sobre todo una lavadora con la que por fin pudo dejar de lavar a mano.
   El préstamo anterior lo invirtió en la  compra de mobiliario para su local, en esta ocasión planea comprar carne, aceite, chiles y tortillas pues afortunadamente  las ventas se han incrementado. “Gracias al apoyo de mi esposo, mi sazón y un buen trato al cliente la taquería seguirá creciendo” mencionó.
*La fotografía fue tomada en donde cocina los tacos, Licha es quien viste playera roja y pantalón azul.
texts.en:
Near one of the most important sugar factories in the region is a community where the sound of animals is music to the local inhabitants' ears.  In the morning all the residents leave their homes to go to work in the fields or at the sugar factory.  The sound of a whistle blowing in the manufacturing complex reminds workers of the change in shifts.

Felinas is the name of a communal bank group made up mainly of women who like cats.  The current members are: Jessica who sells candy; Venancia who sells cosmetics and embroidered goods; Alexis who sells clothing; Trinidad who sells lingerie; Maria Luisa who sells tacos and Ma. Victoria who sells cosmetics.  Maria provides nursing services and Anayanci offers esthetician services.

Every weekend, starting at 6:00 p.m. one of the businesses starts on a small porch where there are five tables and a grill to make the best tacos in the area.  The business belongs to Maria Luisa who makes steak, sausage and pork tacos.  On a table next to the grill are limes, sauce, salt, radishes, cucumbers and the essential tortillas.

She says that "the tacos preferred by her customers are the ones made of tripe and beeftsteak" and this is not rare because all of Mexico has a special liking for this food.  Her income has allowed Licha, as she is known lovingly, to support her husband in the household expenses and to buy domestic appliances, especially a washing machine.   So, finally, she no longer has to wash everything by hand.

Her previous loan was used to buy furniture for her shop.  Now she plans to buy meat, oil, chilis and tortillas because, fortunately, sales have increased.  "Thanks to the support of my husband, my recipes and good customer service, the taco business continues to expand" she says.

*The photo was taken in the taco shop kitchen.  Licha is wearing a red top and blues pants.

loans.use: To buy meat, oils, chilis and tortillas.

loans.name: Jamal

texts.en: Jamal is a 44-year-old, married man from Rafah city, which is located in the Gaza Strip. He works as an employee in the public sector, where he gets a low income. This income barely covers all the family needs, but he wants to make his family more comfortable and improve their standard of living. So, Jamal took a USD loan from FATEN, which will enable him to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house. By taking this loan, Jamal will be able to decrease the electricity expenses, while using a cleaner form of energy (rather than gas). Jamal’s family will have an easier time heating water for showers, cooking, and also washing clothes and dishes. Jamal appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house.

loans.name: Chok

texts.en:
Chok, 47 years old, is a farmer who lives in Baray district, Kampong Thom Province. She is a hard-working mother of three children. Her husband is also a farmer on their potato farmland. This couple can make a net profit approximately USD 10 a day.

During this time, Chok is faced with a financial issue in her family. She needs some money to hire workers to weed their potato fields. After getting to know that HKL provides Kiva loan with the lower interest rate than its normal loan, she has decided to apply for a Kiva loan for them to hire workers in the potato fields. She would like to thank to all lenders for their kindness.

loans.use: to hire workers to weed their potato fields.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Aspiring entrepreneurs are thankful for Kiva lenders for having a compassionate heart in helping people who needs financial support on their businesses. One of them is Erlinda. She was granted a loan of Php 10,000 previously, since she is one of the beneficiaries of CCT. She wants to thank lenders for helping her grow the business. The money was used to buy stocks of peanut butter and boxes of health drink for her buy and sell business.

Erlinda focuses on how to make the business flourish and how she will be able to attract more patrons. This year, she’s applying for a loan of Php 17,000 that will be used to buy stocks of peanut butter and boxes of health drink for her buy and sell business. She believes that this will help her pursue success in her business. She also prays that God will continually bless her family with good health.

Erlinda is consistent in attending weekly fellowship group for CCT partners that consists of 15 to 30 members where she gain spiritual strength for member’s life changing testimony, share her own experience of God’s love, pay Micro Finance loans and  hear God’s word that  was conveyed to them every week.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and purchase raw ingredients she needs in making yema.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis forty three years old is a married man with nine children living in Masindi-Uganda. With his ambition of having a better future for his family, he started a shop selling clothes and has hopes of educating his children and getting basic needs of life. The business has helped him to provide his family and given him good reputation in terms of  paying his first loan that he took. That's why he is requesting for another loan to buy more clothes for selling. Francis complains of changes in tastes and preferences of his customers. In spite of this he is determined to serve them beyond expectation.

loans.use: to buy clothes for selling.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay his university fees.

loans.name: Mchicha Group

texts.en:
Mwajuma who is in her early 30's is single with two children, who are still in school. She has been a food vendor for one year now. She works from 6am to 6pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Mwajuma’s 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She will use this loan to restock the out of stock items in her food store and thus meet her customer’s requirements. She dreams of expanding her business.

Mwajuma will share this loan with her loan group Mchicha which consists of three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to  restock the out of stock items in her food store

loans.name: Mario Alexander

texts.es: Mario de 33 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida y sus dos hijos, el se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras desde hace 13 años su negocio esta ubicado cerca de su lugar de residencia y ya posee muchos clientes, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el esta solicitando un credito para la compra de mas frutas y verduras por mayor para poser continura con sus ventas y asi tener ejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en:
Mario, 33, lives in his own house with his life partner and their two children.  He has been selling fruits and vegetables for 13 years at the business he has set up near his residence.  He has many customers now and is able to cover some of the household expenses with income from sales.

The loan he is requesting is to buy more wholesale fruit and vegetables to continue sales and increase his income.

loans.use: To buy more wholesale fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Sandra

texts.en:
Sandra is a 20-year-old single lady who works as a tutor from her house to cover her needs and expenses. She is still continuing her studies, as she really loves teaching. She is a hard worker and ambitious lady who is trying hard to develop her business.

Today she is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, to open a small education center in order to increase her student numbers. Sandra hopes this loan will help her make a step toward a better future as she hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to open a small education center in order to increase her number of students.

loans.name: Josefa

texts.en: Josefa is a farmer who is working for her own land. Her goal is to provide a more secure life for  her family. Annabelle needs to cover their household expenses. Josefa is requesting a loan to buy planting materials and organic fertilizer to improve her vegetable garden. She is striving for a better life through farming and is grateful for this opportunity.Josefa hopes to have a better life with her family in the future

loans.use: to buy planting materials and organic fertilizer for her vegetable garden.

location.town: LA ESPERANZA, RIZAL, ZAMBOANGA DEL NORTE

loans.name: Modesto

texts.en:
Modesto is a man, in his middle 60's and has been married for a long time to a loving wife. It has been long enough to see both their kids part away as grown up persons, so today Modesto and his wife only need to provide for each other.

Modesto earns a living by running a small convenience store. He is proud of this store because it has been enough to move the family ahead, was enough to support his children as long as they needed and now supports him.

He now wants to increase the store size. This includes the variety of products and space itself. He has tried before with other financial institutions, asking for loans to achieve his goal, but he hadn't succeed, although he paid his credits on time, the taxes were too high so all his profit was used to pay for the money he took.

At Kubo and Kiva, Modesto sees an opportunity to succeed on his project, so he is looking for a 26,316.00 MXN loan that will let him rent a little extra space and increase his stock by buying products like cheese, milk, ham, butter, bread and groceries.

loans.use: to expand his grocery store for better sales.

loans.name: Yun's Group

texts.en: Yun’s group live in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Yun makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Las Fresitas Group

texts.es:
En el mes de mayo un pueblo veracruzano se viste de gala en honor a la celebración de su santo patrono. Los habitantes locales y foráneos se dan cita para presenciar las actividades culturales, así como el desfile de carros alegóricos que recorre la calle principal. En dicha región se formó un grupo llamado  Las Fresitas el cual actualmente está integrado por: Miriam quien vende abarrotes; Emma y Brenda, tacos; María y Liliana, comida típica y Maritza quien maneja una cocina.
   Brenda es una mujer muy entregada al cuidado de sus cuatro hijos, todos son menores de edad y estudian en escuelas de la comunidad. Su hijo mayor, además de la escuela normal, tiene que acudir a terapias para rehabilitar sus piernas debido a un problema que le diagnosticaron. 
    “Desde niña ayudaba a mi madre en la taquería, posteriormente trabajé junto al padre de mis hijos y tiempo después, al separarnos, la taquería se me quedó ya que será el patrimonio para mis hijos, por quienes día con día brindo lo mejor de mi” expresa Brenda con orgullo. Hoy en día brinda empleo a tres personas y sus ganancias han incrementado favorablemente permitiéndole ofrecer tacos de distintos ingredientes. El éxito de su negocio lo atribuye al especial sazón de los tacos, al precio accesible y sobre todo al trato especial que brinda a cada uno de sus clientes. En agradecimiento por las ventas decidió agregar la promoción del dos por uno durante dos días de la semana. 
   Ha creado un verdadero equipo de trabajo con base en el respeto y el trabajo arduo, sabe que la mejor manera de enriquecer su labor es compartiendo sus éxitos con las personas que la han apoyado.  “Gracias a Dios la taquería ha dado buenos resultados que me han permitido ofrecer lo mejor a mis hijos y sobre todo  continuar con las terapias de mi hijo mayor” comenta Brenda cuyo más grande sueño es verlo caminar  y jugar como un niño normal.
   Por otro lado, los préstamos han sido de mucha utilidad pues siempre los ha invierte en la compra de carne, verduras, tortillas, aceite, azúcar, agua purificada, refrescos y gas.
*La fotografía fue tomada en “la novia del sol”, Brenda viste blusa blanca y pantalón negro.
texts.en:
In the month of May, a village in Veracruz dresses up to celebrate the day of their patron saint.  Locals and visitors meet to take part in cultural activities and the main street's parade of allegorical floats.  This is where a communal bank called Las Fresitas established itself.  The members are Miriam who sells groceries; Emma and Brenda who sell tacos; Maria and Lilliana who sell typical foods; and Maritza who runs a diner.

Brenda is a woman who is very dedicated to caring for her four children.  All are minors and attend the community school.  Her eldest son also receives leg therapy for a problem that he has.

"When I was a little girl I used to help my mother at the taco stand.  Then I worked with the father of my children but later we divorced.  I kept the taco business which will be inherited by my children, and work as hard as I can every day for them" says Brenda with pride.  

Now she employs three people and her earnings have increased favorably, allowing her to add more ingredients to her tacos.  She attributes her success to the special flavor of her tacos, the low price and, especially, to the good customer service she provides.  In appreciation of the good sales volume she decided to offer a 2x1 promotion two days a week.

She has created a true team through respect and hard work, knowing the best way to enrich her work is by sharing her success with the people supporting her.  "Thank God the taco business is going well and lets me give my children the best I can, including the therapy for my eldest son" says Brenda, whose greatest desire is to see him walk and play like any other child.

The loans have been very helpful to Brenda who has always used them to buy meat, vegetables, tortillas, oil, sugar, purified water, soft drinks and gas.

*The photo was taken at "La novia del sol".  Brenda is wearing a white blouse and black pants.

loans.use: To buy meat, vegetables, tortillas, oil, sugar, purified water, soft drinks and gas.

loans.name: Hantamalala Marie Zoé

texts.fr:
Hantamalala a 41 ans. Son mari, 43 ans, assure également la sécurité d’une pompe publique. Le nombre d’enfants est de quatre. L’ainé de 23 ans est marié et vit aussi avec eux en louant le même  local. Les trois autres âgés respectivement de 17 ans, 13 ans et 11 ans suivent leurs études auprès des établissements publics.
Les activités de l’emprunteur sont diversifiées.. La vente d’œufs est la première activité exercée depuis 2010. En raison de d’existence d’un marché sûr, le couple s’est aussi adonné à la livraison des volailles auprès des clients cibles. L’activité de taxi phone et de petit commerce en alimentation (bonbons et biscuits) a été commencée depuis 2012.
C’est le couple qui choisit l’activité à réaliser .Les activités sont réalisées avec l’appui de son mari ; Le couple est actuellement à son septième prêt pour développer ses activités.L’objectif étant de pouvoir satisfaire les clients et augmenter les ventes.
Le rêve du couple est de pouvoir éduquer leurs enfants et leur préparer un avenir meilleur. La construction d’une maison est aussi un projet afin d’éviter le paiement d’un loyer. Exercer un travail bien rémunéré est le but du conjoint
texts.en:
Hantamalala is 41 years old. Her husband, 43 years old, also maintains the security of a public water pump. They have four children together. Their eldest is 23 years old and lives with them while paying rent. The three other children are aged 17, 13, and 11 years old respectively and are following their studies in public schools.

This borrower takes part in various activities. Egg selling is her principal business, which she has done since 2010. Because there was a solid market for this business, the couple have also taken up delivering poultry to their target customers. They have also been running a taxi phone and selling foodstuffs (biscuits and candy) since 2012.

The couple make business decisions together. And the activities are carried out with her husband's support. This is currently the couple's seventh loan. The goal of this loan is to satisfy their customers and increase their sales figures.

The couple's dream is to be able to educate their children and offer them a better future. Building a house is also one of their future projects so they no longer have to pay rent. This couple is aiming to carry out a job which pays well.

loans.use: to purchase eggs, poultry, biscuits and candy.

loans.name: Irma Esperanza

texts.es:
Irma, de 41 años de edad,  estudio hasta noveno grado, pero debido a que tuvo que trabajar por la falta de recursos económicos tuvo que dejar de estudiar;  está casada,  su esposo se dedica a los trabajos de la agricultura y tienen 3 hijos de los cuales solo dos hijas viven en su casa.

Irma, se dedica a los oficios domésticos, sus hijas y su esposo le ayudan en su tiempo libre.

Irma, necesita el préstamo para comprar  5 quintales de abono fertilizante,  para la preparación de la tierra y  pagar mano de obra, de esta manera podrá tener mayores cosechas y también mayores ingresos económicos para ella y su familia.

Irma, desea que  sus dos hijos estudien y logren ser profesionales, además desea remodelar su casa para poder vivir más cómodamente con  su familia.
texts.en:
Irma is 41 years old and studied up to Grade 9. She had to leave her studies as she had to work due to a lack of economic resources. She is married. Her husband does agricultural work. They have 3 children, of which two daughters live in their home.

Irma works doing domestic duties, her daughters and her husband help her in their spare time.

Irma needs the loan to buy 5 quintals of manure to use as fertilizer to prepare the earth and pay for labor. In this way she can have better harvests and more income for herself and her family.


Irma wants her two daughters to study and manage to become professionals. She also wants to remodel her house to be able to live more comfortably with her family.

loans.use: to buy 5 quintals of manure to prepare the earth and pay for labor.

loans.name: Samina

texts.en: Samina is the age of 34, living with her four children in the area of Multan, Pakistan. Her husband owns a gold jewelry shop in the area of Multan, Pakistan and lives near his shop. His shop situated in the main market and it is challenging for him to sale his products with his competitors. This competition highly effects upon his daily sales. To grow his business, income and abstain from the competitors he decided to offer some additional and stylish jewelry items. Samina's husband hopes that this strategy will work positively and the customers will attract towards his new products. Therefore, Samina requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband would be able to buy some gold. She says thank to kiva and to its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy gold for her husband's shop

loans.name: Sahar

texts.en: With the amount borrowed at the end of last year, Sahar was able to complete some works in her apartment that she is now renting in return of some extra income. Since then, she has been providing her children with improved living conditions which is boosting their morale and pushing them to always succeed at school. She is now asking for another 1,543,658 Lebanese pounds loan from Kiva partner Ibdaa to make some home improvement to her own apartment in which she organizes private tutoring sessions. With an increased number of students attending her sessions, her goal is to create an environment more suitable for studies in which her students will feel more comfortable and focused.

loans.use: to improve her own apartment in which she organizes tutoring sessions

loans.name: Rafiatou

texts.fr: Célibataire et sans enfant, Rafiatou est une femme âgée de 29 ans résidant à Tokoin. Rafiatou est une revendeuse du cola et des épices qui s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché et le revend à domicile et dans les quartiers environnant. Rafiatou sollicite ce prêt pour commander des sacs de cola et des paniers des épices afin de bien vendre et pouvoir relancer son activité.
texts.en: Unmarried and without children, Rafiatou is a 29-year-old woman who lives in Tokoin. She makes a living selling kola nuts and spices which she purchases twice monthly from market and resells both out of her own home and as a street vendor. Rafiatou is requesting this loan to purchase kola nuts and spices so she can make a profit and kick-start her business.

loans.use: to purchase two bags of kola nuts and three baskets of spices.

loans.name: Yot

texts.en:
Yot, a 40-year-old farmer, lives in Yeav village with his wife and four children. He wants to expand his small business to something bigger and bigger. In addition to farming, Yot fishes during the peak season. With the help of his wife and support from his children, Yot never loses hope and is willing to do hard work. He wants to get up early in the morning and go back home late to spend more time on work. However, it is a challenge for him because his house doesn’t have enough energy to generate light. He has to get up when the sun is high enough to see things clearly and go back home before the road is too dark to travel.

As a result, he decided to apply for a Kiva loan to buy a solar home system. He believes he will have enough energy for his family to use, giving him more working hours.

loans.use: to pay for a solar home system.

location.town: Yeav Village, Kampong Cham Commune, Sambo District

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Fruit vending business is the source of income of Marissa who is from Tondo, Philippines. She is 34 years old and the wife of James. She runs the business on her own and her profit help support their daily expenses.

Perseverance and passion for what she is doing made Marissa stay in the business. Her children that she needs to support and raise are also her very reason for keeping the fruit stand. Income from this business is usually affected by competition. That is why Marissa is applying for a Php 9,000 loan to have a supporting capital to buy large quantity of fresh fruits and to have an edge against her competitors. She strongly believes that the amount she requested will be of great help for the business.

Marisa is consistent in attending weekly fellowship group for CCT partners that consists of 15 to 30 members where she gain spiritual strength for member’s life changing testimony, share her own experience of God’s love, pay Micro Finance loans and  hear God’s word that  was conveyed to them every week.

loans.use: To have supporting capital to buy large quantity of fresh fruits.

loans.name: Erasmus

texts.en:
Erasmus 69 lives in Kabwe District, Zambia with his family of twenty eight. He is asking for a Kiva loan to buy an engine for a maize milling machine so that he can provide a milling service to 300 families in his community. The maize milling machine takes raw maize (corn) and creates a maize flour which is the staple food in Zambia. Most rural families in Kabwe District grow maize on their small farms and store it and use it as their primary supply of food for the year. After the kernels are removed from the cob, they then have to be milled to create flour, which can then be boiled to make what is locally called Nshima.

Rent-to-Own has done market research in Erasmus's community and has determined that the location for this equipment is great. The closest working maize mill is about 10 km away, This means most potential customers have to travel about 10 km, and since most will walk or use their bicycles to travel to the maize mill, it is certain they will prefer to use this maize mill rather than traveling a longer distance. Equipment such as a maize mill can be a major boost for many enterprising farmers such as Erasmus, as it allows for him to diversify his business.

Unfortunately, the upfront costs of such a maize mill are very prohibitive. With this loan, Erasmus will get an engine for a maize mill from Rent-to-Own, which will deliver the equipment, as well as provide training on how to use and maintain it. This loan will help Erasmus on the path to building up a viable business that can provide for his community throughout the year. It is for this reason Erasmus is asking Kiva lenders to help him with the loan.

loans.use: to pay for a hammer mill engine for his maize mill, which will be used by 300 families

loans.name: Maria

texts.pt:
A sra Maria tem 40 anos de idade, casada e mãe de quatro filhos que estão na sua responsabilidade. Vive em casa própria e dos seus filhos, 03 estudam e 01 é menor de idade. Tem mercearia e com o empréstimo pretende comprar, refrescos, sumos, arroz, pão, amendoim, farinha de trigo e de milho, peixe, frangos carne de porco e de vaca, mayonnaise para revender.
Ela  sonha em ampliar o seu negócio e   criar condições para que os filhos continuem a estudar, visto que ela não conseguiu estudar devido a falta de dinheiro pois seus pais eram camponeses, so dependiam das machambas. O seu desafio é reembolsar o empréstimo dentro do prazo estabelecido e solicitar outros financiamentos.
texts.en:
Maria is 40 years old. She is married, and has four children who live under her care. She owns the house where she lives. Of her children, three go to school and one is still very young.

She has a store, and is planning to use the loan to buy sodas, juices, rice, bread, peanuts, corn and wheat flour, fish, chicken, pork and beef, and mayonnaise for resale.

She dreams of expanding her business and creating the right conditions so that her children can study. She could not study herself due to the lack of money, because her parents were peasants that depended on their plantations.

Her challenge is to pay off the loan according to plan, and apply for more loans.

loans.use: to buy sodas, juices, rice, bread, peanuts, corn and wheat flour, fish, chicken, pork and beef, and mayonnaise for resale.

loans.name: Famille Urbain Group

texts.fr: Urbain a orienté son précédent crédit dans l'entretien de son café. De là a pu découler la création d'une autre source de revenus dont l'installation d'une alimentation, le paiement de frais scolaires pour les enfants sous sa charge, l'agrandissement de son activité agricole et la constitution d'une petite épargne. Il sollicite un autre crédit car il est confiant qu'à partir du café, il pourra étendre d'autres activités génératrices de revenu.
texts.en:
Urbain used the previous loan to maintain his coffee field. From this followed the creation of another revenue source which has gone towards a regular food supply, the payment of school fees for the children living in his care, the expansion of his agricultural activity and the beginnings of some small savings.

He is requesting this additional loan because he is confident that with this coffee business as a base, he will be able to extend into different revenue-generating activities.

loans.use: to maintain their coffee plant field.

loans.name: Possible Nawathana Health Clinic

texts.en:
By funding solar at Nawathana Health Clinic, expecting mothers like Radhika (pictured in purple) will receive safe childbirth care. Radhika and her husband already have a son and a daughter. She is excited to have one more addition to her family. "I still don't feel like eating and feel tired all the time," Radhika said. She wants to start preparing for the baby as soon as she feels better. "I want to sew clothes and knit some sweaters," she smilingly added. With the help of her Community Health Worker Tulachha (pictured in a bright blue sari), Radhika will receive group antenatal care until the baby is born. 

Your Kiva loan will fund the installation of a 2.2 kW solar energy system to power modern medical services for Nawathana Clinic. Nawathana serves 2,400 patients a year and is expecting to deliver 36 babies in 2015. The current facility has zero access to electricity. Nawathana has recently partnered with Possible, an award-winning nonprofit that provides high-quality, low-cost healthcare. But before the clinic can improve services, they need access to electricity. Without it, no modern technology can be used. 

The solar energy system will be installed by SunFarmer (www.sunfarmer.org), a social enterprise that specializes in affordable and reliable solar for health facilities, schools, and farms. The loan will pay for the upfront costs of the installation, and SunFarmer will provide long-term monitoring and maintenance services to ensure that Nawathana has the electricity they need for years to come.

loans.use: To pay for solar equipment that will provide reliable electricity at their health clinic.

loans.name: Possible Gajara Health Clinic

texts.en:
Lalita's blue sari (pictured above) marks her as a Community Health Worker at the Gajara Clinic in Nepal. Lalita provides expecting mothers, like Kamala (pictured in a red and green sari), with prenatal counseling. Kamala lives with her two daughters, her son and her mother-in-law in a village in Achham district. Her husband does labor work in India and sends money home to feed their growing family of 6. Kamala will give birth at the Gajara Health Clinic in a few months. With solar powered medical equipment and lights at Gajara, nurses will be able to deliver safer and more advanced care to Kamala's newborn child.

Gajara Health Clinic is the primary medical treatment facility for 3,156 people. Currently, Gajara has zero electricity and is a hilly 40 minute trek from the nearest hospital. Gajara works closely with Possible, an award-winning nonprofit that provides high-quality, low-cost healthcare to Nepal’s rural communities. 

With your Kiva loan, SunFarmer will install a 2.2 kW solar system to bring Gajara’s technical capacity into the modern age. SunFarmer (www.sunfarmer.org) is a social enterprise  that installs affordable, reliable solar for hospitals, schools, and farms. The loan will pay for the upfront costs of the solar energy and battery storage system. In addition, SunFarmer will provide long term monitoring and system maintenance to guarantee electricity for Gajara.

loans.use: To pay for solar equipment that will provide reliable electricity at their health clinic.

loans.name: Mao

texts.en:
Mao is married and has six children, one of whom still lives with him. He is a retired agriculture officer living in Yeav village. Mao wants to have a comfortable life. He is still farming and he helps his children with their businesses. 

Mao has difficulty in using batteries for home energy. He needs to recharge them every week. Seeing the difficulty of using a car battery, Mao requested a loan, which he will use to buy a solar home energy system. He believes solar home energy can enhance his lifestyle in a comfortable manner.

loans.use: to pay for a solar home energy system

location.town: Yeav Village, Kampong Cham Commune, Sambo District

loans.name: Amigas Group

texts.es:
En Oaxaca hay una comunidad muy pintoresca cuya vista a la presa es grandiosa. El ver como se adentran los pescadores en la aguas para poder obtener el producto con el que satisfacen sus necesidades, las palapas colocadas a orillas de la laguna donde los lugareños ofrecen el pescado fresco cocinado en diferentes presentaciones y todo bajo un manto cultural arraigado en la cultura mazateca. 
   El gran lazo de amistad que mantienen las integrantes de un grupo ubicado en dicha región le dio origen a su nombre: Amigas.  Ellas son: Ana P. quien vende abarrotes; Romualda y Guadalupe, refresco; Julieta, ropa; Ana C., bisutería mientras que Yumeli maneja un auto lavado y Yurixvy, una carnicería. 
   Doña Julieta es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora quien al quedarse sola con sus hijos, debido a que su esposo emigró a los Estados Unidos, decidió vender  ropa dentro de su comunidad. En un inicio recorría las calles y de casa en casa ofrecía las prendas que adquiría por medio de su hermana. Tras siete años realizando dicha actividad y gracias a las ganancias obtenidas incorporó la venta de cosméticos para tener ingresos extras.
   Si bien las ganancias le permitieron brindar lo mejor a sus hijos ahora se hace cargo de un nieto quien la ve como una madre, “si hace  7 años luché por mis hijos, ahora lucho por mí y por mi nieto” comenta. Su negocio ha crecido de tal manera que ahora cuenta con un probador y un corredor en donde exhibe la ropa a sus clientes.
  El préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de pantalones, blusas, faldas, camisas y playeras puesto que son las prendas que más le solicita su clientela. Además menciona, “gracias a VF México y KIVA por el nuevo préstamo y por apoyarnos para lograr nuestros sueños”.
*La fotografía fue tomada en “la novia del sol”, Doña Julieta viste falda color negro.
texts.en:
En Oaxaca there is a very picturesque community whose view of the dam is magnificent: watching how the fishermen go deep into the waters in order to get their catch so that they can meet their needs or seeing the palm-frond huts on the banks of the lagoon where the locals sell fresh fish cooked with a variety of recipes.  All of this is rooted in the cultural mantle of the Mazatecan people.

The great ties of friendship binding the members of this group, located in the above-mentioned region, give them their name: “Amigas.”  They are Ana P., who sells groceries; Romualda and Guadalupe, drinks; Julieta, clothing; Ana C., costume jewelry; while Yumeli manages a car wash and Yurixvy, a butcher shop.

Julieta is a very happy and hardworking woman who, finding herself left alone with her children because her husband moved to the United States, decided to sell clothing in her community.  At the start, she went through the streets from house to house, selling outfits that she got from her sister.  After seven years of doing this, and thanks to the money she had earned, she added cosmetic sales in order to have extra income.

Even though the earnings allowed her to give the best to her children, now she is responsible for a grandchild to whom she is like a mother.  She says, “For seven years I struggled on behalf of my kids, and now I fight for myself and my grandchild.”  Her business has grown so much that she now has a showroom where she displays clothing to her customers, as well as a dressing room.

She will invest her loan in the purchase of pants, tops, skirts, shirts, and t-shirts, since these are the items that her customers ask for most.  She also says, “Thanks to VF Mexico and Kiva for this new loan and for supporting us as we achieve our dreams.”

This photograph was taken in “La Novia del Sol.”  Julieta is wearing a black skirt.

loans.use: to buy pants, tops, skirts, shirts, and t-shirts

loans.name: Mengthy

texts.en:
Mengthy is 20 years old and a university student from the Kampong Cham Province in Cambodia. He is pursuing a bachelors degree, majoring in Information Technology and is in his second year at a university in the city.

His parents are rice farmers and are totally dependent on farming as revenue. Because Mengthy is short on finances to cover his tuition fees from the third to the fourth year, he would like to request a loan. With this loan, he will be able to cover his university fees and earn skills to achieve his future goal. In the future, he is going to find a good job.

loans.use: to cover his tuition fees from the third to the fourth year

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia used her prior loans to sustain her bag-making business. Her earned income allowed her to provide for her family's daily needs. She has also started an upholstery business. 

Sonia requested another loan for 20,000 PHP, which she will use to buy more fabric, canvas, thread, and other materials needed to make different kinds of bags and for her upholstery business. 

Sonia wants to buy a new sewing machine to meet the growing demand of her upholstery and bags. She hopes to have her house reconstructed in the near future. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from God.

 *All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase materials such as canvas, fabric, zippers, buttons, and garters

loans.name: William David

texts.es: William es un joven residente en la ciudad de Cartagena de indias en donde tiene su propio negocio de venta de carnes, el cual inició con el apoyo de su padre quien le ofreció el capital inicial y un espacio en su tienda de víveres para que pudiese comercializar este producto que hace parte de la canasta familiar.  Diariamente atiende su negocio a la misma hora que su padre apertura su tienda a las 6 a.m. hasta las 6 p.m., y en estas doce horas logra el tope de ventas que le garantizan buenas utilidades.  William tiene como meta principal tener su propio local comercial y esta meta la alimenta con su esfuerzo y dedicación, él está completamente seguro que tendrá un expendio de carnes en la ciudad que lo vio crecer.  En la actualidad desea ampliar su surtido de carnes y para ello está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, que invertirá en pollo, carne de res y carnes frías.  Con esta inversión sus utilidades serán mucho mayores y su clientela estará satisfecha de encontrar todo lo que necesita en un solo lugar.
texts.en:
William is a young resident of the city of Cartagena de Indias where he has his own business which is selling meat. He started with the help of his father. He offered him the initial capital and space in a grocery store here he could sell this product which is part of the basic food basket.

Every day he takes care of his business with the same hours as his father's store from 6 am until 6 pm. In these twelve hours he manages to maximize sales that guarantee him good profit. William has a principal goal of having his own shop and this goal feeds his efforts and dedication. He is completely convinced that he will have a meat outlet that he sees growing.

Currently he wants to expand his assortment of meats and to do his he is applying for a loan from Kiva, the first financing he has had with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. He will invest it in chicken, beef and cold cuts. With this investment his profits will be much greater and his clientele will be satisfied to find all they need in one place.

loans.use: to invest in chicken, beef and cold cuts.

loans.name: Xalil

texts.en:
Xalil is 45 year old, married, and he has three daughters. Xalil is an IDP and they leave in an IDP settlement. He sells sanitary engineering goods in a consumer goods market. He loves his job and is very pleased.

His monthly salary is 260 AZN, but it is not enough to cover family needs. For this reason, Xalil wants a loan 1,200 AZN to repair his market. This is going to be his fifth loan and he has a good credit history. Please support him.

loans.use: to repair his market.

loans.name: Hong's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hong, born in 1981, is a Thai ethnic woman. She currently lives with her husband and her two children, one son and one daughter, in Yen Chau district, Son La province.

Her family's main income is from a civil servant salary so the income is just enough to cover the living expense of the family and save a small amount. Her elder son is learning at secondary school, her young daughter is at the first year of primary school. She wants to invest more in her children's education but she does not have enough money. Therefore, she wants to borrow for this purpose.

She hopes that the loan will help her children have a better condition for learning and then they will have a bright future.

loans.use: to invest more in her children's education.

loans.name: Alda

texts.en:
Alda and her family live in the town of Mahaplag, in Leyte, Philippines. She is married and has three adult children.

Her husband is a farmer, while Alda buys and sells fish. She has been doing this for two years to earn a living. Aside from fishing, she is also engaged in raising pigs. Thus, she is asking a loan to buy fresh fish to sell and to buy feed for her pigs.

In the future, she wishes to improve and expand her business. She also wishes to have a permanent place in the market to sell, to enhance their livelihood.

loans.use: to buy fresh fish and feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Fiely

texts.en:
Fiely is married and has three adult-aged children. She owns and operates a farm raising crops to earn a living. For many years in farming, she has been providing for the needs of the family and has been able to send her children in school.

She gained access in GDMPC and recently she took out a loan to purchase organic fertilizer for her crops. Improving their farm is her plan, because it is their main source of income and she wants to ensure a better living in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for her garden.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella learned about Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative and the financial assistance it gives start-ups. Estrella tried her luck at doing a business focusing on her farming activities.

She feels she owes her fortune to the Cooperative for having trusted her with the money she used as capital. Estrella borrowed another amount to pay for seedlings and compost.

This will give her farming income a big boost. Estrella looks for better business opportunities and would love to be in the position to help others.

loans.use: to pay for seedlings and compost

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en: Analyn and her partner own a “haba-habal” (a motorcycle with an extended seat to accommodate more passengers), which is a source of their daily income.  For two years, her husband has been driving this to earn a living.  Analyn is asking for a loan to buy spare parts for their motorcycle.  In the future, she wishes to launch a sari-sari store business to enhance their livelihood.  She is a 28-year-old woman and has four children (ages 10, 8, 6, and 11 months old).

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her motorcycle.

loans.name: Maria Heidi

texts.en:
Maria Heidi is 59 years old and a member of CCT General Trias branch. She is married to Efren and is thankful that three of her children are already working and the youngest is already in college. Education is of primary importance to Filipinos to uplift their lives.

She has derived income from her apartment for rent for seven years already. To improve her apartment, she is requesting funds in the amount of PHP 15,000 to pay for the construction materials. Her apartment badly needs a makeover to make it more attractive and attract more tenants. Ma. Heidi aims to build another apartment and sustain her child's education.

She prays for God to prosper her in all areas of her life. Every week, she faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members* to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the renovation cost of her apartment for rent.

loans.name: Phearom

texts.en: Phearom lives in a farming community and wants to expand his business from a small plot of land to larger and larger plots of land; he has a positive view for his future business.  In addition to farming, Phearom uses his free time to fish in order to earn extra money for his family.  With the help of his wife and with support from his children, he never loses hope or his will to work hard.  Phearom wants to save money to expand his business.  However, saving money is a challenge because he has to spend a lot of money on energy for his house.  He has to spend money to charge his battery every 3 or 4 days.  As a result, he decided to apply for a loan from Kiva to purchase a solar home energy system.  He believes he will have enough energy to cover his family's usage and to improve his working hours.

loans.use: to purchase a solar home energy system.

location.town: Yeav Village, Kampong Cham Commune, Sambo District

loans.name: Joselito

texts.en:
Joselito is a resident of Mahaplag, Leyte. He has been a driver of a habal-habal (a motorcycle with extended seat to accommodate more passengers) for almost five years to earn a living.

He is married and has six children. His oldest school aged child is 21 years old while his youngest child is 2 years old.

Joselito is asking for a loan to buy spare parts for his motorcycle. He plans to buy another motorcycle in the future to enhance his livelihood so he will able to provide for the needs of his family. Joselito is a 46-year-old man who is determined to reach his goal in the future.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his motorcycle

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda has always had enthusiasm for farming. She has cultivated their rice land in Calamba, Misamis Occidental, and has made good earnings doing this type of work.

Recently, she applied a loan to pay for land and seedbed preparations. This will ensure that the rice field is ready for planting. Erlinda knew that she has to get things right to yield more income for this cropping season.

loans.use: to pay for land and seedbed preparations

loans.name: Elvita

texts.en:
Elvita has a collection of ornamental garden plants. She finds pleasure in doing her gardening activities and earning as well for her family.

As a microfinance member of PMPC, she has sought financial help to purchase a variety of ornamental plants that she can grow and sell. In the future, Elvita wishes to become the supplier of flowers to the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of ornamental plants that she can grow and sell.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 32 years old; she's married and provides for her two children. Her husband is a driver, rendering transportation services to their local community, while Rosemarie manages their vegetable garden. For over seven years, she has been earning well selling her vegetables in the market. It covers the cost of their household expenses, considering also the income of her husband, which she considers as their main source of income.

She gained access in GDMPC, and recently she took a loan for the purpose of buying new seedlings and organic fertilizer to have a more productive harvest. She wants to improve her vegetable farm to ensure a better source of income for the family in the near future.

loans.use: to buy new seedlings and organic fertilizer for her vegetable garden.

location.town: P3, NAGCAAN, RIZAL, ZAMBOANGA DEL NORTE

loans.name: Catalino

texts.es:
Catalino es un hombre de cincuenta y ocho años de edad, muy trabajador y de carácter fuerte, él tiene treinta y tres años trabajando como productor agrícola. Gracias a su ardua labor, ha logrado sacar adelante a tres de sus cinco hijos. Poco a poco a logrado crecer notablemente como comerciante, porque pudo sacar una cosecha completa de frijol para luego venderla en momentos que sequía. 
Confía tanto en Kiva junto a MiCrédito, que ha solicitado un financiamiento que le permita comprar abono, pesticidas y pagar la mano de obra para la siembra de maíz y frijol. En un futuro desea invertir en ganado y otros negocios agrícolas.
texts.en:
Catalino is a 58 year old man. He is very hard working and of strong character. He has been a farmer for 33 years. Thanks to his hard work he has brought up three of his five children. Little by little he has grown significantly as a businessman because he could get a full crop of beans and sell later in times of drought.

He trusts Kiva and MiCrédito so much that he has requested a loan to buy fertilizer, pesticides, and to pay the laborers to plant corn and beans. In the future he wants to invest in livestock and other agricultural businesses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticides, and to pay the laborers to plant corn and beans

loans.name: Solinda

texts.en: Solinda is responsible and dedicated in her work as a tailor. This is her only source of income and she is very grateful for her life and being allowed to be independent. There she has a business producing school uniforms and carrying out repairs to clothes. This business has given her the opportunity to work and survive. She applied for a loan in order to expand her business and increase production. She will buy additional textiles, buttons and sewing supplies. This will allow her to generate more income and be able to cater tailoring services.

loans.use: to buy additional textiles, buttons and sewing supplies.

loans.name: Cornelia

texts.en:
Cornelia signed up for her membership with PMPC and obtained the needed capital to start up a sari-sari store business. She is thankful for the capital that was extended to a small-time borrower like her. 

Cornelia has been able to turn the tide in her favor and is making good sales these days. She wants to take advantage of the good fortune.

Recently, she took a loan to restock her store with basic commodities, like canned goods, oil and soy sauce. In the future, she hopes to build a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to restock her store with items like canned goods, oil and soy sauce.

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander, 46 years old, is married and a resident of Calamba, Mis. Occ., Philippines. He had been in this business for many years already. Since he wants to be more productive, he has now decided to enter into business himself, purchasing fish in bulk for resale at the market.

In 2014, Alexander and his wife agreed to join Paglaum MPC to get a loan because they wanted to buy fishing nets. Aside from the financial assistance they received, they say that they also enjoyed the add-on benefits like insurance and savings.

He has now applied for a loan of 14,900 PHP to buy fish for resale. He is wishing that with Paglaum’s help, and with the patience & diligence of his wife, he is looking forward to being a successful vendor someday and to own a stall in the public market.

loans.use: to buy more fish for resale

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.en:
Felicidad has a collection of ornamental garden plants. She finds pleasure in doing her gardening activities and earning well for her family.

As a Microfinance member of PMPC, she has sought financial help to purchase a variety of ornamental plants that she can grow and sell.

In the future, Felicidad wishes to become the supplier of flowers in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of ornamental plants that she can grow and sell.

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en: Elsa owns a stall in the local market, selling fish. She has been in this business for 20 years now.  It gives her an approximate profit of PHP 6,000 per month. She is assisted by Paglaum MPC to sustain her business. Currently, she avails a loan of PHP 14,900 to buy bulk fish to sell.

loans.use: to buy bulk fish to sell.

loans.name: Tinyfer

texts.en:
Tinyfer signed up for her membership with PMPC and obtained the needed capital to start up a sari-sari store business. She is thankful for the capital that was extended to her, a small-time borrower.

Tinyfer has been able to turn the tide in her favor and is making good sales these days. She wants to take advantage of the good fortune. Recently, she took a loan to restock her store with basic commodities like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce. In the future, she hopes to build a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to restock her store with items like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce.

loans.name: Jerry

texts.en:
His name is Jerry, aged 34, a new member of CCT's Silang, Cavite branch. He is married to Aniza and has no children yet. For three years he has been a fruit vendor as shown in his photo. He also started a small junk shop to better provide for himself and his wife, and also to prepare for a family. He does not mind that a junk shop is literally a dirty business, since it generates money to cover their daily expenses.

A hardworking man, he derives income from his buying and selling fruits and recyclable materials. In view of this, he is humbly requesting funds in the amount of Php 10,000 to pay for bananas and glass bottles, galvanized iron, brass, steel and metal products to sell. He trusts your positive response and is thanking you in advance for your help.

Jerry dreams of buying a house and building a store to display his fruit. Every week, he faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship members* to share stories of his work and to draw strength and inspiration from the word of God he studies.

* All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay Micro Finance loans

loans.use: to pay for bananas as well as recyclable materials to sell.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en: Anita requested a loan from Paglaum MPC, which she will use to buy more kilos of fruits and vegetables to sell. With the loan, she will be able to sell more products which will allow her to earn more money and provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase kilos of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en: Lolita wants to increase her sales. Consequently, she has requested a loan to purchase seed, compost, and fertilizer, among other items, so that she can continue to feed her family.

loans.use: to purchase seed, compost and fertilizer.

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther thought she was in the right place when she joined the microfinance group of Paglaum MPC. She decided to give it a try after she learned she could avail financial assistance for her chosen business. Esther has maintained her membership in good standing without records of default up to this day. She has taken several loans and all were paid in a timely manner.

Recently, she availed a loan to pay for labor costs in post harvest operations for her chosen business. Esther wishes to continuously manage her business more effectively with the support of her family.

loans.use: to pay for labor costs in post harvest operations.

loans.name: Yonis Gricelda

texts.es:
Yonis, de 29 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, está acompañada, se dedica a la agricultura, aprendió este oficio gracias a sus padres, ella se levanta junto a su esposo a las 5:30 a.m. para realizar sus actividades diarias en la agricultura y en la ganadería.

Yonis, se dedica a trabajar en las parcelas que posee, este oficio lo realiza durante la mañana junto a su  esposo y en el transcurso de la tarde se dedica a ordeñar las vacas y a vender la leche.

Yonis, necesita el préstamo para comprar otra vaca lechera, que le vende un familiar y poder incrementar la producción de leche y así poder elaborar quesos y crema para vender.

Yonis, sueña con poder comprar un vehículo para poder ir a vender los lácteos que produce en los alrededores de su comunidad.
texts.en:
Yonis, 29 years old, studied until the sixth grade. She is accompanied. She works in agriculture. She learned this work thanks to her parents. She and her husband get up at 5:30am in order to perform their daily agricultural and livestock activities.

Yonis is dedicated to working the fields she owns. She does this during the morning with her husband and the afternoons she devotes to the cows and the sale of milk.

Yonis needs a loan to buy another dairy cow to be able to increase the milk production so she can make more cheese and cream which a family member sells.

Yonis, dreams of being able to buy a vehicle so she can sell her dairy products in the surrounding communities.

loans.use: to buy another dairy cow.

loans.name: Noong Het 20 Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hinh, 51, is a Thai ethnic widow who has two adult children, a 22-year-old girl who has studied in a medical secondary school and a 21-year-old boy who stays home and supports his mother to earn a living. They live in a Thai ethnic traditional house at a remote village.

Mrs. Hinh and her son mainly work at agricultural production such as cultivating rice, planting vegetables, breeding a buffalo, a cow and fish. The son sometimes works for local employers to earn extra income. Because of the difficult situation, she has to work very hard and diligently.

She has taken out a loan from the Anh Chi Em Program to overcome the lack of capital. This is the third time she has received a loan from the Program, and she will use it to buy piglets to increase production. She hopes that her investment will help her reap good income and gradually help to improve living conditions for her family. Mrs. Hinh dreams that her family will escape from poverty and her children will have a stable and sufficient life. In the picture, she stands at the first from the right.

loans.use: to buy piglets to increase production.

loans.name: Nimia

texts.es:
Nimia es de la ciudad de Paraguarí, ella trabaja en una casa de familia como empleada, estudia por las tardes para poder tener el oficio de peluquera, y de esa forma poder tener un mejor ingreso para poder ayudar a su familia.
Su sueño es poder terminar sus estudios y salir adelante. Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su curso.
texts.en:
Nimia is from the city of Paraguarí. She works as a domestic worker in a family home. She studies during the evenings to become a hairdresser and thus have better income so she can help her family.

Her dream is to be able to finish her studies so she can get ahead. She is asking for this loan in order to pay her course fees.

loans.use: to pay for her course fees.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita earns a living by weaving amakan (bamboo matting, commonly used to make walls for the native houses in the Philippines). She has sold amakan for three years now.

She is widow woman with six children. Four of her children are still attending school. They are 12-18 years old. She lives in the town of Batuan, Bohol.

She  is asking for a loan  to buy materials like bamboo. With these, she could weave more amakan, which would enable her to improve her earnings.

Slowly, her finances will become stable. She could continue send her children to school and could try to expand her livelihood to become more productive, and it could help uplift the family's living condition.

loans.use: to buy materials like bamboo

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is married and has eight children, five of whom attend school.  Her husband is a carpenter.  For the last five years, Jennifer has been selling dried fish to the local population from her house. She raises hogs to earn additional income. 
 
Jennifer requested a loan, which she will use to buy supplies of dried fish. With the loan, she will be able to purchase higher bulk and distribute it to her customers. Her earnings will slowly improve and she will be able to settle her obligation quickly. Jennifer's ambition is to improve her livelihood and never stop seeking ways to become sustainable and support the needs of her children.

loans.use: to purchase dried fish

loans.name: Caridad

texts.en:
Caridad is 59 years old and has five children. She is from the town of San Miguel in Bohol where she farms rice. 

Caridad requested a loan, which she will use to buy fertilizer and to pay for the labor of her hired help who are also farmers. The income she earns will allow her to provide a better and more secure life for her family. In the future, she will reinvest her profit in the same business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pay for hired help

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en: Narcisa is 58 years old and resides in Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is married and blessed with three adult children. She joined PMPC on April 17, 2007 to access the programs and services of the coop. She's accessing her ninth loan of PHP 14,900 for additional working capital to buy a variety of food products to sell in the local community.

loans.use: to buy a variety of commodities.

loans.name: Ester

texts.en: Ester lives in Calamba, Misamis Occidental and is busy repairing her house. She has successfully repaid her previous loan and now asks for her ninth loan to buy building materials and paint, and to pay her workers.

loans.use: to buy building materials and paint and to pay her workers.

loans.name: Clifford

texts.en:
Clifford has signed up for his membership with PMPC and availed the needed capital to start up a sari-sari store business. He is thankful for the capital it extends to a small time loaner like him.

Clifford is able to turn the tide in his favor and has made good sales these days. He wants to take advantage of the good fortune. Recently, he availed a loan to restock his store with basic commodities like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce. In the future, he hopes to make a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to restock his store with basic commodities like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita makes good earnings from her farming activities in Calamba. This is how she supports her family and is able to send her children to school. She wants to increase her farm yield, especially now that she has a high cost of living when her children entered college.

Carmelita approached Paglaum to borrow an amount to purchase a knapsack sprayer for insecticides. She has high hopes that she will have good produce this cropping season.

loans.use: to purchase a knapsack sprayer for insecticides.

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en: Faustina is 42 years old and married with four children. She is a responsible mother who requested a loan from Paglaum MPC to increase her inventory. She wants to buy more kilos of fruits and vegetables to sell. Faustina will be able to sell more produce which will allow her to earn more money and provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase more kilos of fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Zeninanda

texts.en:
Zeninanda has five adult children. She supported them with her fruits and vegetables vending business. 

Zeninanda requested a loan from Paglaum MPC, which she will use to to buy more kilos of fruits and vegetables to sell. With the increased inventory, she will be able to sell more products which will allow her to earn more money and provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase more kilos of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Annabella

texts.en:
Annabella makes a living through her retailing business. She runs a sari-sari store (convenience store) in Calamba, Misamis Occidental and earns a promising income to support her family.

She has signed up for her membership with PMPC to gain access to capitalization. She wants to increase her inventory. Now, she has availed a loan to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items to sell.

Annabella hopes to sustain her business and dreams of sending all her children to school.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items.

loans.name: Carlito

texts.en:
Like most people in San Miguel, 46-year-old Carlito is farming rice for a living. This has been his source of income for the last 18 years.

He applied for a loan to finance his farm maintenance like fertilizer and to pay for other farmers who will be helping during the planting season. He aims to increase the profitability of his business.

His income will go to his family’s daily consumption, savings for the future, and help for his grandchildren.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay for the hired help.

loans.name: Rowena Jean

texts.en:
Rowena Jean is 21 years old and residing at Calamba, Mis.Occ. She is single. She joined PMPC on April 17, 2013 in order to access the programs and services of the said coop.

Recently, she accessed her second loan in the amount of PHP 5,000 for additional working capital of her existing business to buy variety of commodities for which she is selling a variety of food products in the local community.

loans.use: to buy variety of commodities to sell.

loans.name: Matamoros Group

texts.es:
Una carretera rodeada de cañales y arboles de mango lleva a un pequeño municipio veracruzano en cuya entrada se encuentra un gran ingenio azucarero. Muchos de los habitantes trabajan diariamente en dicho complejo para obtener el endulzante que después es transportado a todo el país. En una de las colonias del municipio donde reina la tranquilidad se formó un grupo al cual pusieron por nombre Matamoros, los miembros son: Narcisa e Ignacia quienes venden refresco; Ysidra, abarrotes; Isabel, comida; Rosa, tacos; María, agua purificada; Enedina, cosméticos y calzado por catálogo y Antonio quien se dedica a la albañilería.
   Doña Rosa Aurora es mejor conocida como Rosita debido a su carácter amable e incluso humorístico. Siempre le ha gustado ser una fuente importante en los ingresos de su hogar y por ello hace 3 años decidió abrir una taquería gracias a la ayuda que VF México le otorgó. Desde entonces, da servicio completo a partir de las 6:00 am hasta las 4:00 pm todos los días de la semana. Así, mientras ella prepara los ingredientes necesarios, su esposo se dedica a montar las mesas y colocar todos los accesorios para que cuando llegue el primer cliente ya tengan listos los deliciosos tacos.
    “La comida es un muy buen negocio, más para nosotros pues cualquier mexicano siempre tiene antojo de un taco” comenta entusiasmada al recordar lo que la motivó a realizar dicha actividad.  Con base en el éxito obtenido pudo dar empleo a otra persona, además de solventar los gastos de su casa, comprar una sala, dos camas y ahorrar para comprar un camión de carga con el que planea iniciar una actividad secundaria.
   En esta ocasión el préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de: carne, aceite, chiles, tortillas, gas y refrescos para continuar con el buen paso que lleva hasta ahora. Menciona que  desea “continuar con la taquería y seguir generando ingresos pues a mi edad es mejor tener un negocio independiente”.
 *La fotografía fue tomada junto a un pozo, Doña Rosa viste blusa blanca y está sentada en el medio.
texts.en:
A highway surrounded by cane fields and mango trees leads to a small town in Veracruz at whose entrance you see a large sugar mill. Many of the local people work every day in that factory to obtain the sweetener that later will be transported to all parts of the country.  In one of the quiet neighborhoods of the town the Matamoros group formed. The members of the group are: Narcisa and Ignacia, who sell soft drinks; Isidra, groceries; Isabel prepared food; Rosa, a taco stand: María, purified water; Enedina, cosmetics and footwear from catalogues; and Antonio, who is a bricklayer. 

Doña Rosa Aurora is better known as Rosita because of her likeable, even humorous, character. She has always enjoyed being an important source of income in her household and for that reason three years ago she decided to open a taco business, thanks to the help provided to her by VisionFund Mexico. From that time, she has been giving full service from 6 am to 4 pm every day of the week. While she prepares the necessary ingredients, her husband sets up the tables and sets out all of the table-top items so that when the first client arrives, the delicious tacos will be ready.  "Food sales is a very good business, especially for us, because Mexicans always crave a taco," she comments enthusiastically as she remembers what motivated her to start up this business venture. With a base in the success she has achieved, she has been able to employ another person, as well as take care of the household expenses, buy furniture for the living room, two beds and to save towards the purchase of a cargo truck she can use to begin another business activity. She will invest her portion of this loan in the purchase of meat, oil, chiles, tortillas, gas and sodas in order to continue with the good service that she has been carrying out up to now.
