Doña Rosa mentions that she wants "to continue with the taco stand and keep on generating income, since at my age, it is best to be in business for yourself." The photograph was taken next to a well. Doña Rosa is wearing a white blouse and is seated in the middle.

loans.use: to buy meat, oil, chiles, tortillas, gas and soft drinks

loans.name: Nicanora

texts.en: Nicanora is a responsible mother from Dipolog City. She requested a loan from Paglaum MPC, which she will use to buy more kilos of fruits and vegetables to sell. With the increased inventory, she will be able to sell more products which will allow her to earn more money and provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase more kilos of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 43 years old, married, and has two adult children. She is from the village of Dipolog City.  Jocelyn operates a fruits and vegetables store, which she has been doing for 10 years. She earns a monthly net income of 3,200 PHP. 

In 2015, Jocelyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 2,000 PHP from PMPC. Jocelyn is requesting her second loan for 3,000 PHP, which she will be use to buy more kilos of fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.use: to buy more kilos of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma has always had enthusiasm for farming. She has cultivated their rice land in Calamba, and has yielded good earnings doing this type of work.

Recently, she applied for a loan to pay for land and seedbed preparations. This will ensure that the rice field is ready for planting. Alma knows that she has to get things right to yield more income from this cropping season. In the future, Alma hopes to buy a hauling truck for easy transport of produce.

loans.use: to pay for land and seedbed preparations.

loans.name: Cherilyn

texts.en:
Cherilyn is 40 years old and residing at Calamba, Mis.Occ. She is married and blessed only with children who are of school age.

She joined PMPC on 2007 in order to access the programs and services of the said coop. Recently, she's accessing her eleventh loan in the amount of PHP 30,000 for additional working capital of her existing business to restock the store with basic commodities and other consumable items.

loans.use: to restock store with basic commodities and other consumable items

loans.name: Chhoeun's Group

texts.en:
Chhoeun, 49, is a farmer living in a small wooden house located in Kampong Thom province’s Sandan district. She is the mother of five children, two in school.

She has been growing cassava as the main source of her income for 30 years. She works as teacher for an additional source of income to support her family. Her cassava did not grow well last season so she saved only $5 (USD) each day after expenses.

This is Chhoeun’s sixth loan with VisionFund. She has improved her living conditions as a result of the past loans. As the group leader for this new Kiva loan, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy a decent latrine for her family. She hopes that her family can live in a more comfortable environment and that she can protect her beloved children from infectious diseases.

loans.use: to buy a decent latrine to improve her family standard of living and protect her beloved children from infectious diseases.

loans.name: Colonia Las Flores Group

texts.en:
Rubí is the 19-year-old President of the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank 'Colonia de Flores', located in the Western Highland town of Huehuetenango. She has been married for five years and has two children who are two and three years of age. Rubi was able to attend school until the fifth grade. She has a convenience store and sells bread as well. She is requesting a loan to purchase more items for her store, including oil, butter, sugar, beans, corn, flour for tortillas, and soap.

The Trust Bank, consisting of seven ladies, is in its very first loan cycle with Friendship Bridge - and that is very exciting for them. They see so many possibilities! The women share common goals of expanding their businesses and maximizing all opportunities through the “Microfinance Plus” program of Friendship Bridge (small loans plus education). They are really pleased with the educational trainings they have already received, where they learned about effective business management practices including budgeting, pricing, marketing, accounting and customer service. It is important that they start their relationship with Friendship Bridge and Kiva investors in a knowledgeable way. These ladies want that relationship to be successful.

The ladies are motivated to empower themselves and eliminate poverty. With the kindness and generosity of Kiva investors along with the 'Microcredit Plus' program of Friendship Bridge, they are already beginning that journey with this very first loan. Thank you, Kiva investors!

loans.use: to purchase more items for her store.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth has a collection of ornamental garden plants. She finds pleasure in doing her gardening activities and earns well for her family.

As a Microfinance member of PMPC, she is seeking financial help to purchase a variety of ornamental plants that she can grow and sell. In the future, Elizabeth wishes to become the supplier of flowers in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase variety of ornamental plants that she can grow and sell.

loans.name: El Ángel Group

texts.es:
En Veracruz existe una comunidad en donde el calor hace presencia todos los meses del año, por esta razón ha sido nombrada por los lugareños como “la novia del sol”. En una de sus colonias se integró un grupo llamado El Ángel cuyo nombre hace referencia a los ángeles de la guarda que cuidaran de sus negocios según los integrantes quienes son: Flor quien vende cosméticos y maneja un centro nutricional; Aida, cerámica; Guadalupe, zapatos artesanales y servicio de estilista; Silvia, repostería; María, comida típica y tamales; Carlos, ropa y Rosa, bolsas y zapatos artesanales. 
   Cuando Doña Rosa se vio en la necesidad de cuidar sola de sus tres hijos decidió que la mejor manera para solventar sus gastos era realizar artesanías. Aunque actualmente ya solo uno de sus hijos depende de ella, no ha dejado de realizar su actividad ya que le encanta llevarla a cabo. “Aprendí a bordar y tejer gracias a unos cursos que recibí, desde entonces soy constante en  mis actividades” comenta contenta.  Entre los productos que más vende son las bolsas de mano, los juegos de baño, tapetes, cobijas y juegos de colchas. Aunado a esto, se desempeña como instructora, brinda cursos en diferentes comunidades y cada curso, además de ganancias extras, le deja experiencias muy reconfortantes. 
   Realiza de dos a tres inversiones por año para asegurar las entregas que tiene pendiente con sus clientes, “cuando tengo pedidos debo trabajar todo el día y parte de la noche para cumplir en tiempo y forma con mis clientes” y agrega  “lo más bonito es ver mis bordados terminados, pues en cada uno plasmo una parte de mí”. Su meta es abrir una tienda en donde pueda exponer todos sus productos de tal manera que los clientes puedan ver detalladamente el trabajo que hay en cada pieza.
   Este es el primer préstamo de Rosa con VF México y lo piensa invertir en la compra de tela, listón, cierres, agujas, plantillas y suelas para continuar con la actividad que durante 12 años le ha permitido cuidar de sus hijos.
*Este es el grupo El Ángel, la fotografía fue tomada en casa de una de las integrantes del grupo, Doña Rosa viste blusa color morado.
texts.en:
In Veracruz there is a community where it is hot every month of the year. For this reason it has been called by the locals “Bride of the Sun.”

In one of the neighborhoods is the group called El Angel whose name refers to the guardian angels taking care of their businesses which are:

Flor who sells cosmetics and runs a nutritional center
Aida, ceramics
Guadalupe, handmade shoes and stylist services
Silvia, pastries
María, typical food and tamales
Carlos, clothing
Rosa, bags and handmade shoes

When Rosa saw the need to care for her three children alone she decided that the best way to take care of the expenses was to make handicrafts. Although currently only one of the children depends on her, she has not stopped her work as she loves doing it. “I learned to embroider through some classes I received and since then I am persistent in my work,” she happily says. Among the highest selling products are handbags, bathroom sets, tablecloths, blankets and bedspreads.

She also works as an instructor, offering courses in different communities and each course, in addition to the extra earnings, leaves her with very gratifying experiences.

She makes two or three investments per year to ensure that she can deliver the pending orders of her customers. “When I have orders I need to work all day and part of the night in order to complete them in a timely manner,” adding, “the most beautiful thing is to see my finished embroidery, as each one captures a part of me.”

Her goal is to open a store where she can display all her products so that the customers can see in great detail the work that goes into each piece.

This is the first loan for Rosa with VisionFund México and she plans to invest in the purchase of fabric, ribbons, zippers, needles, soles and insoles in order to continue with the work that during twelve years has permitted her to care for her children.

The photograph of the El Ángel group was taken at the home of one of the members of the group. Rosa is seen in the purple blouse.

loans.use: to buy embroidered blankets, ribbons, zippers, needles, soles and insoles.

loans.name: Lea

texts.en:
Lea is a 52-year-old woman from Mahaplag, Leyte. She is married and has five children. Two of these children are school-aged children, ages 9 and 6 years old. Her husband is a company driver, while Lea is engaged in a hog raising business. She has been doing this for 10 years to earn a living. Aside from raising pigs, she is also engaged in sari-sari store business.

Thus, she is asking for a loan to buy feed for her pigs. In the future, she wishes to expand her business for sustainability.

loans.use: to buy feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Vicent

texts.en: Vicent used the previous loan to rent tomato plantations to harvest and sell. He is a farmer growing tomatoes on a large scale, the business he started with the hope of earning enough income to feed his family. In addition, Vicent owns a retail shop where he earns more income. He is faced with the hardship of unpredictable weather changes that destroy his tomatoes, therefore lowering his output. In future, Vicent is looking at expanding his retail shop and modernizing his garden so that he can become a model farmer in his village and educate all his children to higher institutions of learning. Vicent is asking for another loan to buy herbicides and spray his tomato garden.

loans.use: to buy herbicides and spray his tomato garden.

loans.name: Yoeurn

texts.en: Yoeurn is 43 years old. She is the mother of five children and lives in a rural area located in Battambang province. She has grown rice to support her family’s living for 10 years. Moreover, she works for others for a fee to earn additional income. Lack of working capital to support her business is her main business challenge. This is her first loan cycle with VisionFund. She is going to use her entire loan to buy fertilizer and pesticide to increase productivity of her crop. Yoeurn will use the rest of her loan to pay for labor fees to support her farmland. She hopes that she can get greater yields to make additional income in order to upgrade her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticide to increase productivity of her crop yield so as to gain more returns in order to upgrade her standard of living.

loans.name: Channea

texts.en:
Channea, a 43-year-old widow living with three children in Vattanak Village, earns a living by working as a chef in a restaurant. Spending days and time raising three children, she wants her family to live in a comfortable condition. Moreover, she wants her children to pursue higher education.

Currently she is still keeping on with her hard work in the restaurant. Channea has difficulty in using a battery for home energy. Tired after working a full day, she needs to recharge the battery every week. Seeing the difficulty of using a car battery, she decided to apply for a Kiva loan to buy solar home energy.

She believes solar home energy can enhance her living lifestyle in a comfortable condition and also can let her children have a better study condition at night.

loans.use: to pay for a solar home system.

location.town: Vattanak Village, Vattanak Commune, Sambo District

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is 29 years old, married, and has children who attend school. She operates a sari-sari (convenience store) store business. Daisy's passion is selling and she never gets tired of operating her store. She earns a meager income from it that is sufficient to support her needs. 

Daisy requested a loan from PMPC, which she will use to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items to increase her inventories and sales. She continues to look for better business opportunities, proof that she is determined to pursue her goals.

loans.use: to restock her store

loans.name: Luzminda

texts.en:
Luzminda signed up for her membership with PMPC and obtained the needed capital to start up a sari-sari store business. She is thankful for the capital that was extended to her, a small-time borrower. Luzminda has been able to turn the tide in her favor and is making good sales these days.

She wants to take advantage of the good fortune. Recently, she took a loan to restock her store with basic commodities like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce. In the future, she hopes to build a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to restock her store with items like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce.

loans.name: Rosela

texts.en:
Rosela, 54 years old, is married and a resident of Calamba, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Her husband is a fisherman. The fish he catches are sold to the public market or to their neighbors. They have been in this business for many years already.

Since she wants to be more productive, she has now decided to enter into business herself, purchasing fish in bulk for resale at the market. In 2004, both Rosela and her husband agreed to join Paglaum MPC to avail a loan because they wanted to buy fishing nets. But aside from financial assistance they received, they say that they also enjoyed the add-on benefits like insurance and savings.

She has now applied for a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy her fish for resale. She is wishing that with Paglaum’s help, and with the patience and diligence of her husband she is looking forward to being a successful vendor someday and to owning a stall in the public market.

loans.use: to buy more fish for resale

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is known in Dipolog City for her tailoring business. She is 46 years old and married to a farmer husband. She's doing well in her business and has helped her husband in providing for the needs of their family.

However, one unprecedented event crippled her financially when her husband got sick and had to spend many days in the hospital. Being in need of a great amount of money made Anita decide to pawn their land.

She later learned that Paglaum MPC offers loans to members at the lowest interest rates, so she asked for a loan to redeem the pawned parcel of land. She is grateful to the cooperative that she can now have their land back in her hands.

loans.use: to redeem her pawned parcel of land

loans.name: Eliezer

texts.en: Eliezer is gearing up for the next cropping season. She wants to prepare well, especially the much-needed land and seedbed preparations. She wants to have enough supply of corn fertilizer, so she applied for a loan from the Cooperative. Eliezer hopes to save enough for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy corn fertilizer for more produce

loans.name: Ernest

texts.en: Ernest is married with children. He owns a retail shop and is in the coffee business as well. He ventured into these businesses to boost his family welfare. Ernest wants to stock more goods because he has realized that there is a potential market in his area. However, he lacks some money to hit his target. He is requesting for a loan facility to purchase more rice, posho, beans, and other items for reselling.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, posho, beans, and other items for reselling.

loans.name: Hilario

texts.en:
Hilario lives in Upper Langcangan, Oroquieta City and is married with adult-age children. He has applied for an 8,000 PHP loan through Kiva's field partner PMPC to buy building materials, paint and to pay his workers.

Hilario wants his children to get a good education and escape the life of backbreaking work he has had to endure.

loans.use: to buy building materials, paint and to pay his workers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy inventory for his grocery shop and fertilizer for his tea fields.

loans.name: Mao

texts.en:
Living in a rural village of Battambang province, Mao is 49 years old and a married mother of four children. She has been growing cassava to support her living condition for 12 years. She can also earn more income via working for others for a fee.

Lacking working capital to grow her cassava, she has decided to take a new loan with VisionFund, which is the second loan cycle for her. She has a better house to stay in from her past loan. Mao will use this entire new loan to buy fertilizer and pesticide to support on her cassava farming. She hopes that this new loan will help her to get additional income to upgrade her standard of living and be able to save more money for future needs.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticide to grow her cassava well and be able to save more money for future needs.

loans.name: Medardson

texts.en:
Medardson is a well-known farmer who mainly deals in coffee farming in Nyakabingo village, Rushinya parish, Bushenyi district.

He started this project in 2005 and has managed to sustain his family of four children. He has one wife. His side income is as a salary earner to support his family. Mr. Medardson was born in 1970. His children are aged 19, 17, 15, and 13 years old respectively. All of them are in school.

He has applied for a loan of UGX 4,000,000 to buy fertilizers for his coffee shamba to increase the yields and income. This will help him ssustain his family well. He is an honest man at work on his business, and he works for eight hours a day. He sells the coffee to the factories around Bushenyi district. He is faced with the challenges of pests and diseases that affect the harvest.

His vision is to build a good and big house for his household since he has many dependents.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizers.

loans.name: Vicent

texts.en:
Vicent is a well-known farmer, mainly dealing in tea farming in Kataremwa village, Kibazi parish, Busheny district. He started this project in 2005 and has managed to sustain his family of seven children and one wife. Vicent was born in 1983. His children are aged 15, 13, 11, 9, 7, 5, and 3 years old.  All of them are in school. His side income is cattle rearing, and this has helped him earn some good money to support his family.

He has applied for a loan of 2,500,000 shillings to buy fertilizers for adding manure to his tea shamba, to increase the yields and help in family sustainability. He is an honest man at work and spends eight hours per day working on his business. He sells to all coffee factories around Bushenyi district. He is faced with the challenge of price fluctuations, pests, and diseases that affect the harvest. His vision is to buy a big chunk of land and he is honest.

loans.use: to buy organic manure for his tea farm.

loans.name: Venensio

texts.en:
Venensio is a well-known farmer, dealing mainly in tea farming in Kataremwa village, Kibazi parish. He started this project in 2005, and he has managed to sustain his family of seven children and his one wife. Venensio is also into coffee farming, and this has helped him earn some good money to support his family. He also has a retail shop where he earns additional funds. He was born in 1983. His children are aged 15, 13, 11, 9, 7, 5 and 2 years old. Of the seven children, five are in school.

This is Venensio's first loan cycle from UGAFODE MDI, and he has applied for a loan of 2,000,000 UGX to buy fertilizers for manuring his tea shamba to increase the yields and family sustainability. He is an honest man at work, and he works for 8 hours a day. He sells to all coffee factories around Bushenyi District. He faces a challenge of price fluctuations that affects the harvest. His vision is to buy a big chunks of land to expand his farming project.

loans.use: To buy organic fertilizers

loans.name: Obed

texts.en:
Obed has applied for a loan of ugx2,000,000= He is aged 29years old and this is his second loan cycle from UGAFODE MDI. He deals in tea farming, where he works for 8 hours a day. He started this business on 2007 in Kakanju parish. However, he started these businesses so as to raise money to have a better life.

He says he will use this loan funds to buy fertilizer and he said he sells to all factories in the Bushenyi district. His dream ideal is to build a house and the main challenge he faces is stiff competition. He is hard working and he says UGAFODE MDI staff has good customer care.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is engaged in a food selling business to earn a living. She is 47 years old, married, and has seven children. Her youngest child is nine years old. Her husband is a farmer, while Lydia is engaged in food selling business. She has been doing this for two years to help her husband enhance their livelihood.

She is asking a loan to buy ingredients such as flour, sugar and cooking oil. In the future, Lydia wishes to start another business like running a sari-sari store to improve their earnings.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar and cooking oil.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Jessil

texts.en:
Jessil’s sari-sari, or small general store in the Philippines, has helped her to support her family with her 6,000 PHP monthly income. She enjoys selling groceries, a satisfying job that entails buying goods and displaying them in her shop.

Jessil has applied for a 4,000 loan through Kiva's field partner PMPC to restock her store with items such as canned goods, oil and soy sauce. She smiles at the idea of her children being able to finish their studies.

loans.use: to restock her sari-sari.

loans.name: Ma. Liza

texts.en:
Ma. Liza is a farmer who cultivates her own land. Her goal is to forge ahead and provide a more financially secure life for her only child and her family. Ma. Liza needs to pay for school fees and also cover her household expenses. 

Ma. Liza is requesting a loan to buy planting materials and organic fertilizer to improve her banana production. She is striving for a better life through farming and is grateful for this opportunity. Ma. Liza hopes to have a better life with her family in the future.

loans.use: to buy planting materials and organic fertilizer to improve her banana production.

loans.name: Presiñano

texts.es:
Presiñano con 57 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos, en el distrito de Cayalti, provincia de Chiclayo, departamento de Lambayeque, país Perú.Los habitantes de esta localidad en su mayoría se dedican a la ganadería, comercio y agricultura.

Presiñamo se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado ovino y cerdos, patos, gallinas, etc. Desde hace varios años. Solicita préstamo para la compra de animales y alimentos para estos.El crédito a otorgarle le facilitará mejorar sus ingresos para su unidad familiar.

Presiñamo si cuenta con experiencia crediticia, Presiñano es socio recurrente en nuestra institución financiera.
texts.en:
Presiñano is 57 years old and lives with his wife and children in the district of Cayalti, in Chiclayo province, Department of Lambayeque in Peru. Most of the people in this locality earn their living in the raising of livestock, commerce and agriculture.

Presiñano has been working in the raising and sale of sheep, pigs, ducks, chickens and so on. He has requested loans for several years for the purchase of animals and feed for them. The loan being requested will make it easier for him to increase his income, important for the unity of his family.

Presiñano has a credit history. He is a repeat participant with our financial institution.

loans.use: for the purchase of animals and feed for them

loans.name: Andrea

texts.en:
Andrea is 59 years old and resides in Calamba, Mis.Occ. She is married and blessed only with three children who are of adult age. She joined PMPC on June 17, 2009 in order to access the programs and services of the said coop.

Recently, she's accessing her ninth loan in the amount of PHP 20,000 to serve as additional working capital for her existing business, which is selling a variety of food products to the local community, so that she can buy a variety of items to sell.

loans.use: to buy a variety of items to sell

loans.name: Eillen

texts.en:
Eillen is a strong-willed woman who pushes her ability when it comes to her piggery business. She is a hands-on businesswoman and mother who never gets tired of supporting her family.

Recently she availed herself of a loan to purchase bags of animal feeds. Aside from her project of concreting the pig pens, she thought of adding heads of pigs for commercial sale. Someday she hopes to open a meat shop in a nearby town.

loans.use: to purchase bags of animal feeds

loans.name: Consolacion

texts.en:
Consolacion finds pleasure in doing her gardening activities. Not only is she doing her hobby, she earns an income as well. At the age of 66 and married, she busies herself to sufficiently provide for the family. She grabbed the opportunity to become a pledge member of PMPC. She credits the cooperative for her capital in supporting her gardening activities.

Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase gardening tools and fertilizers. In the future, Consolacion wishes to become the supplier of vegetables in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase gardening tools and fertilizers.

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is 41 years old, married, and lives in Pagadian City. She learned about Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative and the financial assistance it gives start-ups. Elsa tried her luck in doing a business focusing on her farming activities. She feels she owes her fortune to the Cooperative for having trusted her with the money she used as capital.

Elsa borrowed another amount to pay for seedlings and compost. This will help her farming income with a big boost. Elsa looks for better business opportunities and would love to be in the position to help others.

loans.use: to pay for seedlings and compost.

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is from the village of Aloran. She is 78 years old and is a widow. Rosita owns and operates a specialized retail store selling consumable goods and common household products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over thirty years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month.

In 2000, Rosita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Rosita is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP which will be used to restock her store with items like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce. This loan will be her eleventh loan from PMPC.

She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to restock her store, with items like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie thought she was in the right place when she joined the microfinance group of Paglaum MPC. She decided to give it a try after she learned she could avail financial assistance for her chosen business.

Melanie has maintained her membership in good standing without records of default up to this day. She has taken several loans and all were paid in a timely manner.

Recently, Melanie availed a loan to buy six bags of fertilizers. Melanie wishes to continuously manage her business more effectively with the support of her family.

loans.use: to buy six bags of fertilizers.

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Muong Phang 34 Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Oai, 24, is an ethnic Thai lady who is married and the mother of two sons aged six and eight. She lives with her husband and her children in an ethnic traditional Thai house in a remote village.

Mrs. Oai and her husband work very hard at agricultural production to provide for their children. They cultivate rice and breed chickens, pigs and fish. This is the first time that Mrs. Oai has taken a loan from the Anh Chi Em program, and she will use the loan to buy food to feed the pigs she is raising. She hopes that along with the technical support of the agricultural workers of the program, the pigs will grow fast and healthy to help her reap good benefits.

Mrs. Oai dreams that her children will study well and have good jobs so that they won't have to work so hard like their parents, as well as having more abundant lives. In the picture, she is standing on the first from the right.

loans.use: to buy food to feed the pigs she is raising.

loans.name: Juvy

texts.en:
Juvy has been running her convenience store for almost ten years. She started with a small store and an initial capital of PHP 1,500 that she had in her pocket after her wedding. She invested that small amount into buying consumable goods that are commonly used in a simple household and rolled up her proceeds. From that time on, she expanded her little business and added more products such as liquor, cigarettes, deodorant, over-the-counter medicines and even rice and corn grains for human consumption. Now she also sells animal feed.

Juvy recalls that her dreams of being a boss of her own business has come true. She said that this has been made possible because of the assistance of Paglaum MPC that she nurtured for a long time.

Juvy continuously provides her immediate market with their needs, and she asks for a loan of PHP 14,950 to restock her store with grocery items, confectioneries, condiments and other items.

loans.use: to restock her store with grocery items, confectioneries, condiments and other items.

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Saroeun's Group

texts.en:
Saroeun is a 57-year-old, married rice farmer with a dependent child. She resides in the Prey Veng Province in Cambodia and has cultivated rice since 1978. Her child attends school. Her husband is a 64-year-old village chief. Saroeun and her husband can earn around $3.25 each day.

Saroeun is pictured first from the right. As a group leader, would like to request a loan for a group of four members. She will use her portion to purchase lumber and zinc sheets to build a kitchen. In the future, Saroeun is going to build a ground floor room and support her child to earn a bachelor’s degree.

loans.use: to purchase lumber and zinc sheets to build a kitchen.

loans.name: Jonas

texts.en:
Jonas has wide experience in farming. He has mastered farming activities from growing and caring to harvesting and earning income as well.

Like a farmer, Jonas has nurtured his membership with PMPC and has maintained a good repayment record. He knew he can always turn to the Cooperative for his financial needs.

Recently, he applied for a loan to purchase rice seeds that will have good results in healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings. Someday, Jonas hopes to purchase another rice land to cultivate that will potentially add income for the family.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds that will have good results in healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings.

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria, 70, is married and lives in Pines, Oroquieta City. She has a sari-sari, or small general store, where she sells groceries and households items. The store has helped support her family, especially in the education of her children.

Recently, Gloria applied for a 7,000 PHP loan through Kiva's field partner PMPC to restock her store with the basic commodities mentioned above. She believes having enough inventory would allow her to cover all of her customers' needs.

Gloria is thankful that she signed up for membership in PMPC, which allows her the benefits it offers.

loans.use: to restock her sari-sari with basic commodities

loans.name: Maria Jesus

texts.es:
María, de 44 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, está acompañada, se dedica a vender granos básicos como maíz, frijoles y productos de primera necesidad, este oficio lo aprendió de su madre, su esposo trabaja como albañil en una propiedad.

María, se levanta junto a su esposo a las 4:30 a.m. para realizar sus actividades diarias, para vender productos de primera necesidad.

María, necesita el préstamo para comprar maíz y frijol al mayoreo, porque costará menor para que le generara mayores ingresos.

María, sueña con comprar un vehículo para ofrecer sus productos en los alrededores donde reside.
texts.en: María is 44 years old and attended school to the sixth grade. She lives with her partner and works selling grains, such as corn and beans, and basic necessities, a trade that she learned from her mother.  Her husband works as a bricklayer. María gets up with her husband at 4:30 am to take care of her daily activities and to sell her products. She needs the loan to buy corn and beans at wholesale prices because they will cost less and generate greater profits for her. María dreams of being able to buy a vehicle to be able to sell her products in nearby areas.

loans.use: to buy corn and beans at wholesale.

loans.name: Junbo

texts.en:
Junbo is a 47-year-old man who has engaged in selling fruit for six years. His wife is a disabled woman who can do only a little house work. They have a son who is working outside and can’t take care of his parents all the year round.

Junbo has been running his business for almost six years. His major customers are mainly neighbors and acquaintances from other places so that he can earn a living to support his family. Junbo request a CNY 10,000 from Microcred. He is taking this loan to stock up on apples and bananas for his stall. Since those are a favorite food in his community, he is guaranteed to sell it all.

However, sometimes business is slow because he lacks enough money to buy more kinds of fruits to match his customers' demands. He also spends a lot on transportation from the bigger source markets to his stall.

His dream is to expand his business if he can save up enough money to do so. He is a very hard working and honest man.

loans.use: to stock up on apples and bananas

loans.name: Vien

texts.en:
Vien is 25 years old and a single policeman who resides in the Siem Reap Province in Cambodia. He has been working as a policeman since 2014, earning around $5.50 per day.

He is pursuing a bachelor’s degree, majoring in law at the university in the province. Due to the fact that he is short of the finances to pay his tuition fees for the fourth year, he would like to request a loan. With this loan, he will be able to have enough finances to cover his university fees and earn a bachelor’s degree successfully.

After graduation, he is going to find another better job with a reasonable salary and build a new house for his family, and if he has children, he wants his children to study to pursue a bachelor's degree also.

loans.use: to pay his tuition fees for the fourth year

loans.name: Jessica

texts.es:
Jessica es de la ciudad de Carapeguá, está estudiando  la carrera de Análisis de sistemas, dentro de unos años piensa llegar a ser una gran profesional, para poder ejercer su profesión.
Comenta que es una persona muy dedicada, y que hace poco sufrió un accidente pero que está tratando de salir adelante y poder seguir sus estudios. 
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Jessica is from the city of Carapeguá. She studies Systems Analysis, and she plans to become a professional in a few years, in order to be able to work.

She says that she is a dedicated person. Also, that she recently suffered an accident, but she is trying to get ahead and continue with her studies.

She is requesting this loan to pay the university fees, and in that way continue with her studies.

loans.use: to pay the university fees.

loans.name: Adalberto

texts.es: Adalberto de 37 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hija, el posee un taller de estructuras metalicas desde hace varios años, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el cliente quiere mejorar su vivienda colocando el techo en el patio de su casa pero como no posee de suficiente capital esta solicitando un credito para la compra de materiales de construccion y asi poder tener una vivinda mas segura para su familia.
texts.en:
Adalberto, 37, owns the house where he lives with his wife and daughter. He has had a metal workshop for some years now. He manages to cover some of the home expenses with what he earns.

He wants to make some home improvements. He will build a roof in his yard, but since he does not have enough money he is requesting a loan to buy construction materials in order to have a safer home for his family.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Genara

texts.en: Genara landed at the right place for her needed capital when she joined PMPC. She knew this would be her last chance to get back on her feet when she went broke after her first business went bad. PMPC came as a rescue to Genara by lending her money when she needed it the most. Now, she availed another loan for the next cropping season. She borrowed an amount for land and seedbed preparation. Genara perseveres and always tries to reach her goals to continuously provide for her family.

loans.use: to pay for land and seedbed preparation

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Jessie

texts.en:
Jessie is a 32-year-old man who lives in Mahaplag in Leyte, Philippines. He is a single man and has a 1-year-old son. Jessie works hard to provide for the needs of his family.

He is a driver of a habal-habal (a motorcycle with extended seat to accommodate more passengers). He has been driving for almost eight years to earn a living.

Jessie is asking for a loan to buy spare parts for his motorcycle. In the future, he is thinking of raising pigs to enhance his earnings. He is planning to have a piggery in the future. .

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his motorcycle.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Jocelyn is from Trinidad, Bohol. She is 31 years old with three children ages one, three and eleven. While looking after her family, she also works in her two businesses which are her main sources of livelihood. She farms rice and operates a Saru-sari store.  She is asking for a loan to buy stocks of canned food, seasoning, toiletries, condiments and fertilizer. The loan will pave way for her to have a better income. In the future, she hopes that all her children are successful while she supports their education.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned food, seasoning, toiletries, condiments and fertilizer

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.en:
Trinidad learned about Paglaum MPC and the financial assistance it gives to start-ups. As a farmer in San Vicente Bajo, Oroquieta, she tried her luck and took a loan to jump start her corn production. After several months, she was able to return her borrowed capital. To this day, Trinidad feels she owes her good fortune to the Cooperative for having trusted her with the money she used for her business.

Recently, she availed herself of a loan to purchase farm inputs and fertilizer for the next cropping season. Trinidad wishes to sustain her business and be able to supply corn in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and fertilizer.

location.town: Oroquieta-San Vicente Bajo, Oroquieta City Misamis

loans.name: Genelito

texts.en: Genelito has always dreamed of opening his own store to support his two children. He used his loan to stock his store with items like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce. He is now on his way to repaying the loan with his new profits.

loans.use: to restock his store, with items like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is 51 years old and married with four adult age children. She is known in the Calamba, Misamis Occidental area for her farming activities.

She's gearing up for the next cropping season and she needs to prepare her land and sow her crops. She asks, from the cooperative, for an amount to pay for land preparation like plowing and harrowing and to buy high yielding seeds.

loans.use: to pay for land preparation like plowing and harrowing and to buy high-yielding seeds

loans.name: Daisy

texts.es:
Daisy continua con sus estudios de contabilidad, es una persona que se esta esforzando para poder ser alguien en la vida, una buena contadora que sea útil no solo a si misma, sino también a los demás y a su familia. Ella comenta que por medio de su préstamo anterior pudo cubrir parte de sus gastos de titulacion y manutención, lo cual le fue de mucha ayuda.
Hoy pide este nuevo préstamo para poder invertirlo en cubrir la totalidad de sus gastos de titulación y las cuotas de su carrera, agradece por esta nueva oportunidad que recibe de poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida por sus estudios.
texts.en:
Daisy is still studying Accounting. She is a person that works hard to become someone in life; an accountant that can help not only herself, but also her family and people in general. She says that thanks to the previous loan, she could cover some of her graduation and living costs, which was of great help for her.

She is today requesting a new loan to use it to pay the total amount required for her graduation, and her tuition fees. She is grateful for this new opportunity she receives to improve her living conditions through her studies.

loans.use: to pay the graduation costs and tuition fees.

loans.name: Carlina

texts.es:
Carlina es de la ciudad de San Ignacio, esta estudiando la carrera de enfermería, y por medio de sus estudios quiere poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus seres queridos, ella comenta que su préstamo anterior lo uso en poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma pudo seguir con sus estudios.
Ella pide este nuevo préstamo para poder pagar de vuelta las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Carlina is from the city of San Ignacio and is studying to be a nurse. She hopes that, through through her education, she will be able to improve her living conditions and those of her loved ones. She tells us that she also used her previous loan to pay tuition, which allowed her to continue with her studies.

She is requesting this new loan to be able to pay tuition again and continue studying.

loans.use: to pay college tuition.

loans.name: Ni Nyoman

texts.en:
Ni Nyoman took a previous loan and was very pleased.  She had a plan to boost her income, and it was successful.  She increased sales and customers, and her earning increased so that she could pay off the loan quickly.  She says thank you to all lenders for their support.  Now, she has a successful business, and she can help her husband support the family.  

She has a plan to take a new loan to try a new business; she will buy crops from farmers and sell them to the market.  To support the productivity of her business, Ni Nyoman uses a motorcycle to carry the crops from the farmers, stock them at her house, and then bring them to the market.  She needs a loan of 7,000,000 IDR to purchase crops, such as coconuts, bananas, cacao, etc.

With full support from her husband, she hopes her new business will succeed and generate more earnings.  All of the profit will be saved for her family's needs.

loans.use: to purchase crops, such as coconuts, bananas, cacao, etc.

loans.name: Jeane Mae

texts.en:
Jeane Mae is a resident in the town of Sierra Bullones, Bohol. She is 24 years of age and a married woman with a four-year old son.

She supports her family by means of raising and selling hogs. Her husband earns a living by being a habal-habal (motorcycle) driver. She has been raising hogs for three years now.

She would like to improve her livelihood by raising several pigs and providing adequate maintenance including vitamins and supplements to have a high quality results. With these, she could able to balance her finances and slowly expand her hog raising source of income.
Jeane Mae has requested a loan to buy pigs and feeds. These will surely help boost the family's over all financial stability.

In the future, she is determined that she will be managing her current livelihood for the welfare of her growing children.

loans.use: to buy pigs and feeds.

loans.name: Tita

texts.en:
Tita learned of Paglaum MPC and the financial assistance it gives start-ups. As a farmer in Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur, she tried her luck and borrowed a loan to jump start her rice production. After several months, she was able to return her borrowed capital. To this day, Tita feels she owes her good fortune to the Cooperative for having trusted her with the money she used to her business.

Recently she availed a loan to purchase farm inputs and fertilizer for the next cropping season. Tita wishes to sustain her business and be able to supply rice in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and fertilizer

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Cherry

texts.en:
Cherry is managing her eatery business in Calamba. She mastered the business when she and her husband were in the early years of their marriage. She has been doing well and supporting the needs of the family. She has local customers and would also accept catering for added income.

Recently, she borrowed an amount to purchase more kilos of meat and spices for her eatery business. She wants to expand her business and would be more than happy to open a small canteen at a nearby school.

loans.use: to purchase more kilos of meat and spices for her eatery business

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 48 years old and married to a fisherman. They have six children together. Two of them are still dependents, aged 16 and 17. She support her husband's fishing business while also having a business selling gasoline to other fishermen.

Evelyn is asking for a loan of PHP 24,000 to pay for the boat repair. She hopes that with the help of the loan her boat can be fixed. She plans to expand her business someday for her family.

loans.use: to pay for the boat repair

loans.name: Yan

texts.en:
As a farmer of his generation, Yan is living with a wife and one child and continues his family business.

He is a hard working farmer. He always gets up early to prepare his equipment to do farming. He puts forth all his effort in order to allow his family to live in better conditions. Working as a farmer for over 35 years, he still keeps on farming and helping his children in business.

Yan has difficulty in using a battery for home energy. He needs to recharge the battery every week. Seeing the difficulty of using the car battery, he decided to apply to Kiva to buy solar home energy. He believes solar home energy can enhance his living in a comfortable condition.

loans.use: to pay for a solar home system.

location.town: Vattanak Village, Vattanak Commune, Sambo District

loans.name: Inocencia

texts.en:
Inocencia signed up for her membership with PMPC and obtained the needed capital to start up a sari-sari store business. She is thankful for the capital that was extended to a small-time borrower like her.

Inocencia was able to turn the tide in her favor and is making good sales, these days. She wants to take advantage of the good fortune. Recently, she took a loan to restock her store with basic groceries like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce.

In the future, she hopes to build a decent home for her family.

loans.use: to restock her store with items like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is from Pagadian City. She is 54 years old and married with adult age children. She is a rice farmer and that is her primary source of income. She has been in this type of business for a long time, even before she got married. Marissa has expanded her rice farming and has produced bulk rice grains.

She is asking for a loan from Paglaum MPC through the loan program intended for farmers like her. The amount that she is borrowing shall be used to purchase bags of fertilizer.

loans.use: to purchase 10 bags of fertilizer.

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth and her family lives in the town of Mahaplag in Leyte, Philippines. She is a 47-year-old woman who is married and has four children. She has one school aged child aged 14.

Her husband works hard as a farmer while Elizabeth is engaged in the piggery business. She has been doing this for three years to help her husband financially. She is asking for a loan to buy feed. In the future, she wishes to improve her business to enhance their livelihood.

loans.use: to buy feed

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is a 49-year-old woman from Mahaplag, Leyte.  She is married and has six children.  Her oldest child is 22 years old, and her youngest child is 10 years old.  Her husband works hard as a construction worker, while Elizabeth is engaged in selling food.  In addition, she owns a piggery.  Thus, she is asking for a loan to buy ingredients for her food selling business, such as spices, cooking oil, vegetables, and meat.  In the future, she dreams of expanding her business and having a sustainable life.

loans.use: to buy spices,cooking oil, vegetables, and meat.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora is a sari-sari store owner. She has been doing this for more than five years to earn a living.

She is a 53-year-old woman from the town of Mahaplag in Leyte, Philippines. She is married and a mother of four adult children. Out of these four children, she has one school aged child aged 14 years old. Her husband is a driver and works hard to provide the needs of their family.

She is asking for a loan to buy grocery items such as soft drinks, chips, bread, biscuits, eggs, spices, noodles, cooking oil, canned goods, sugar, coffee, toiletries, powdered milk, and chocolate drinks. In the future, she wishes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, chips, bread, biscuits, eggs, spices, noodles, cooking oil, canned goods, sugar, coffee, toiletries, powdered milk, and chocolate drinks.

loans.name: Floripes

texts.en:
Floripes and her family live in the town of Mahaplag in Leyte, Philippines. She is a single woman and has two children ages eight and three years old.

She earns a living by doing a sari-sari store business and engaging in a hog-raising business. She is asking for a loan to buy grocery items such as canned goods, noodles, eggs, cooking oil, spices, sugar, coffee, powdered milk and chocolate drinks, chips, biscuits, bread, toiletries, and soft drinks.

She wants to enhance their livelihood in the future to have better means of living.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles, eggs, cooking oil, spices, sugar, coffee, powdered milk and chocolate drinks, chips, biscuits, bread, toiletries, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Cresencia

texts.es:
Cresencia es una mujer de carácter noble, que si puede ayudar a los demás, no lo duda ni dos veces, tiene sesenta y cuatro años de edad, es madre de seis hijos, junto a su esposo ha logrado mantener a flote por mucho tiempo su pulpería. Ella ya ha sido beneficiada con financiamientos que le han permitido generar buenos ingresos con los cuales ha mejorado su casa de habitación, por ende su calidad de vida. 
Está muy agradecida y confía fielmente en Kiva junto a MiCrédito, por lo tanto ha requerido a un préstamo que le dé la pauta para comprar aceite, azúcar, frijol, jabón, papel higiénico, en grandes cantidades. En un futuro desea poder hacer de su pulpería una distribuidora de granos básicos y surtir a toda su comunidad.
texts.en:
Cresencia is a woman of noble character who doesn't think twice about helping others if she can. She is 64 years old and is the mother of six children. She and her husband have managed to keep their grocery store open for a long time. She has been assisted by loans which have allowed her to generate a good income. With this income she has improved the home she lives in, and as a result, her quality of life.

She is very grateful and trusts wholeheartedly in Kiva along with MiCrédito. The is why she has requested a loan which will give her the wherewithal to buy oil, sugar, beans, and toilet paper in large quantities.

In the future she hopes to be able to make her small grocery store into a distributor of basic staple goods and supply her whole community.

loans.use: to buy oil, sugar, beans, soap, and toilet paper in large quantities.

loans.name: Nelson David

texts.es:
Nelson es un hombre con 20 años de edad, trabajador, humilde y muy estudiado. Desde niño se dedica a realizar labores de campo junto a su sus padres, con esto ha tenido muy buen progreso, hoy en día es dueño de un gran cultivo de hortalizas, con los ingreso generados por esto, logra pagar sus estudios y aporta en su casa.
Con el fin de aumentar su producción y mejorar sus ventas, Nelson solicita un crédito para la compra de insumos como abonos, fertilizantes, insecticidas y variedad de semillas.
Quiere seguir trabajando y luchar hasta cumplir el sueño de mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda, ofrecerle a sus padres una buena estabilidad económica y mejor calidad de vida.

Los deseos de salir adelante son admirables, a su edad este hombre quiere asegurar un futuro completamente despejado y tranquilo.
Usted puede ser parte de estos sueños, anímese, haga un préstamo.
texts.en:
Nelson is a 20 year-old man who is unassuming, hardworking, and very well-mannered.  Ever since he was a child he farmed alongside his parents, and he has made good progress with this.  Today he owns a large vegetable farm, and with the income generated from this he has managed to pay for his education and contribute to his household.

With the goal of increasing his production and improving his sales, Nelson is requesting a loan to buy supplies such as organic and chemical fertilizers, insecticides, and a variety of seeds.  He wants to continue to work and strive toward accomplishing his dreams of improving the condition of his home and providing his parents with good financial stability and a better quality of life.

The desire to get ahead is admirable.  This young man wants to ensure a bright and tranquil future. You can help him accomplish his dreams by taking heart and making a loan.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies

loans.name: Duyen's Group

texts.en:
Duyen is 40 years old and is a Thai ethnic woman.  She currently lives with her two daughters in the Mai Son district of the Son La province.  Her family lives mainly on income from cultivation and breeding, so her annual income is just enough to cover the family's living expenses.  Her elder daughter is in the last year of high school, and her younger daughter is just starting kindergarten.  Therefore, she wants to borrow a loan to pay for their tuition and to buy learning tools for them.

She will find an extra job to get money to repay the loan for M7-MFI on time.  She also hopes that the loan amount will help her children have better conditions for learning and a brighter future as a result.

loans.use: to pay for her children's tuition and to buy learning tools for them.

loans.name: Sindulfo

texts.es:
Sindulfo está estudiando la carrera de derecho, para poder ser útil a las demás personas y a la sociedad y poder enfrentar desafíos del día a día.
Su propósito es poder seguir estudiando una vez terminada su carrera, para poder seguir creciendo u mejorando no solo ella, sino también su familia.
Él es una persona que está poniendo todo de sí para poder cumplir con sus metas y anhelos, para que de esa forma pueda cumplir sus sueños.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma estar cada vez más cerca de sus sueños.
texts.en:
Sindulfo is studying for a law degree so that he can be of use to others and to society, and can confront challenges every day.  His goal is to continue to study until he finishes his degree so that he can continue to grow and improve for his family.  He is a person who is putting everything he has into his work so that he can accomplish his goals and desires and make his dreams a reality.  

Sindulfo is requesting this loan to pay for his education.  This way, he will get even closer to accomplishing his dreams.

loans.use: to pay university tuition

loans.name: Khusnoro

texts.ru: Хусноро жительница города Душанбе. Ей 22 года. Она замужем и пока у нее нет детей. В городе Душанбе почти все молодежи и женщины занимаются швеей. Хусноро тоже занимается шитьем женской одежды. Она занимается этой деятельностью более 6 лет. В этой деле она опытная швея. Ей в швейном деле нравится ежедневный доход, а также она обожает шить и кроить. Хусноро давно хочет отремонтировать свой дом. Но так как на эту цель у нее нет достаточных финансовых средств, она решилась обратиться за кредитом. За счет кредита она купить краски, обои, люстра, и другие стройматериалы и на оставшуюся часть денег она решила купить швейную машинку, чтобы улучшить процесс работы и ежедневный доход. Хусноро хочет жить комфортно и уютно как другие жители города. Хусноро надеется на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en:
Khusnoro is a resident of the city of Dushanbe. She is 22 years old. She is married but does not yet have children. In Dushanbe, almost all young women work with sewing. Khusnoro also works with sewing women's clothing. She has been in this business for more than 6 years. She is an experienced seamstress. She likes the daily income from the sewing business, and she loves sewing and cutting.

Khusnoro has wanted to renovate her home for a long time. She does however not have enough financial resources for to do this. She decided to apply for a loan. With the loan she will purchase paint, wallpaper, chandeliers and construction materials. She has decided to use the remaining sum to purchase a sewing machine in order to improve her work process and the daily income. Khusnoro would like to live comfortably and cozily, as the other residents. She hopes for your support.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and a sewing machine

loans.name: Kenjagul

texts.ru: Кенчагул очень довольна и счастлива, потому что теперь она живет лучше, чем раньше. Она купила несколько голов телят, откормила их и продала с наценкой. Кенчагул получила хорошую прибыль. Она благодарит Кива кредиторов, которые помогли ей в трудную минуту. Она продала всех своих животных. Кенчагул потратила деньги на расходы семьи. На сей раз она также хочет купить несколько голов крупнорогатого скота. Она накопила средств от продажи скота, к сожалению этого не достаточно. Кенчагул видит единственный выход в получение кредита. Она и на сей раз тоже надеется на Ваше понимание.
texts.en: Kenjagul is very satisfied and happy because now she lives better than before. She bought a few calves, fattened them up and sold them at a premium. Kenjagul got a good profit. She thanks the Kiva lenders who helped her at a difficult time. She sold all of her animals. Kenjagul spent the money on family expenses. This time she also wants to buy a few heads of cattle. She has saved up some funds from selling her cattle, but unfortunately this is not enough. Kenjagul sees receiving a loan as the only solution. This time she hopes once again for your understanding.

loans.use: to purchase some cattle.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is a farmer from Pagadian City. She is 62 years old and married with children of adult age.

Gloria had various loans from Paglaum MPC to head up for the next cropping season. She is requesting a loan of PHP 7,000 to purchase bags of fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.use: to purchase bags of fertilizers and pesticides

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn makes good earnings with her farming activities in Calamba, Misamis Occidental. This is how she supports her family and is able to send her children to school. She wants to increase her farm yield especially as she has a high cost of living since her children entered college.

Roselyn approached Paglaum to borrow an amount to purchase a knapsack sprayer for insecticides and bags of fertilizer.

She has high hopes that she will have good produce this cropping season.

loans.use: to purchase a knapsack sprayer for insecticides and bags of fertilizers.

loans.name: Clemen

texts.en:
Clemen makes good earnings with her farming activities. This is how she supports her family and is able to send her children to school. She wants to increase her farm yield, especially as she has a high cost of living since her children entered college.

Clemen approached Paglaum to borrow an amount to purchase 10 bags of fertilizer. She has high hopes that she will have good produce this cropping season.

loans.use: to purchase 10 bags of fertilizer.

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Nahla

texts.en:
Nahla is a 27-year-old married woman from Dier El Balah city. Her husband works as an employee in the public sector, where he gets a low income. This income barely covers all the family needs, but he wants to make his family more comfortable and improve their standard of living.

So Nahla and her husband took a USD loan from FATEN, which will enable them to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house. By taking this loan, he will be able to decrease the electricity expenses, while using a cleaner form of energy (rather than gas). Nahla’s family will have an easier time heating water for showers, cooking, and also washing clothes and dishes. Nahla appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house.

loans.name: Naroun

texts.en:
Naroun runs a pork retail shop and is living with his wife and two dependent children. He needs to serve in the shop the whole day and consumes a lot of energy in running his business until nighttime; however, the car battery is not reliable.

Sometime the battery runs out without notice. He has no choice but to stay in pitch black for one night until morning, which disturbs not only his living but also his business. Therefore, he is applying for a Kiva loan to buy a solar home system to sustain his business’s energy and also his family usage. With solar home systems, he won’t have to be concerned about sudden power outages anymore.

loans.use: to pay for a solar home system.

location.town: Yeav Village, Kampong Cham Commune, Sambo District

loans.name: Dilovar

texts.ru:
Диловар, симпотичный и весёлый парень. Ему 30 лет. Он женат и имеет двое детей. 
Он обратился в Арванд впервые, когда узнал, что есть возможность получить финансовую поддержку.  Сам Диловар живёт со своей семьёй в сельской местности. Он не имеет высшего образования, так как не было возможности учиться в Университете из-за финансовых трудностей в семье.  Он работает мастером по ремонту машин. Жена Диловара работает медсестрой в местной больнице. 
Чтобы иметь дополнительный доход на пропитание, Диловар занимается своим бизнесом. Он занимается откормом и продажей крупного рогатого скота. Сейчас Диловар хочет увеличить количество скота для расширения своего бизнеса. Поэтому он обратился в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку скота. Диловар очень надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Dilovar is a sympathetic and happy guy. He is 30 years old. He is married and has two children. When he learnt that it was possible to get financial support, he turned to Arvand for the first time. Dilovar lives with his family in a rural village. He does not have higher education, as it was not possible for him to study at the university due to the family's financial difficulties. 

Dilovar works as a vehicle repair man. His wife works as a nurse at the local hospital. In order to have an additional income for covering food expenses, Dilovar has his own business. He works with fattening and reselling cattle. 

Currently Dilovar would like to increase the number of cattle to expand his business. Therefore he turned to Arvand and would like to get a loan to purchase cattle. He hopes very much for a positive result, and thanks Arvand in advance for the support.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Bilolhon

texts.ru: Билолхон родился в семье рабочих. У него есть один братик. Билолхон в районе Гиссар проживает вместе с отцом, матерью, братиком, женой и двумя детьми.  Билолхон серьезный, честный, талантливый и хорошо воспитанный парень. Он занимается мастером по ремонту домов. 4 года Билолхон продвигает свою работу. Он зарабатывает, и обеспечить семью. Его братик тоже воспитанный, серьезный и умный парень. Братик Билолхон учится в университете 3 курсе. Билолхон решил взять кредит и оплатит за учебы брата. Он хочет помочь брату, и хочет, чтобы его брат стал образованным и большим человеком.  С такими планами Билолхон обратился к Вам за кредитом. Он верит в Вас и на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en: Bilolhon was born in a working-class family. He has a brother. Bilolhon lives in the Gissar region with his father, mother, brother, wife and two children. Bilolhon is a serious, honest, talented and well-raised young man. He works renovating houses. Bilolhon has been doing this work for four years. He earns money and provides for the family. His brother is also a well-raised, serious and clever young man. Bilolhon's brother is a third year university student. Bilolhon has decided to take a loan to pay for his brother's tuition. He wants to help his brother, and wants his brother to become a well-educated and great man. Bilolhon has turned to you with these plans for a loan. He believes in you and in your support.

loans.use: to pay for his brother's university tuition.

loans.name: Salimahon

texts.ru: Салимахон спокойная и умная женщина. Ей 57 лет. У нее 5 детей. Одна дочка и четверых сыновей. Ее дети взрослые и умные. Они занимаются торговлей деятельности. Салимахон 5 лет назад начала зарабатывать на жизнь. У нее дома все работает. У всех есть свой бизнес. Сейчас сама Салимахон занимается продажей разных тканей на рынке. Салимахон уже получила опыт, и продвигает бизнес вперед. Она решила расширить бизнес. Салимахон просит кредит для перевоза больше ткани на продажу. Она надеется с расширением бизнеса увеличиться доход и позволит хоробо обеспечить семью. В будущем Салимахон планирует открыть еще одну торговую точку для старшего сына. Она надеется на Вашу поддержку. Вы можете ее поддержать сейчас.
texts.en:
Salimahon is a calm and smart woman. She is 57 years old and has five children; one daughter and four sons. Her children are adults and clever. They work with retail sales.

Five years ago, Salimahon started earning money for a living. Everyone works in her house, and everyone has their own business. Currently Salimahon works with selling different fabric at the market. She has already gained experience and works to bring her business forward.

Salimahon decided to to expand her business. She requests a loan to bring in more fabric for selling. She hopes to increase her income through expanding her business, so she can provide for her family in a good way. In the future she plans to open another sales point for her eldest son. She hopes for your support. You can help her now!

loans.use: to bring in more fabric for selling

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay university tuition

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: el joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 25 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, el trabaja como albañil desde hace 10 años y con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogra, el joven vive en casa propia con su madre y su hermana, el quiere mejorar su vivienda repellando las paredes y encementando bien el piso, pero como no posee de suficiente capital esta solicitando un credito para la compra de materiales de construccion y asi poder tener una mejor vivienda.
texts.en:
The young man is 25 years old and has his face pixelated as he lives in a high risk area. He has been working as a construction worker for 10 years and with what he earns he can pay some of the household expenses. He lives at home with his mother and his sister.

He wants to improve their housing by plastering the walls and cementing the floor, but he does not have sufficient capital. He is asking for a loan to buy construction supplies so he can have better housing.

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Manilyn

texts.en:
Manilyn lives in a town in Mahaplag, Leyte, Philippines. She is married and has a two year old child. She earns a living by selling food in her community. She has been doing this for one year.

Manilyn is asking for a loan to buy ingredients such as meat, vegetables, spices and cooking oil. Manilyn is thinking of other business opportunities to help her improve her livelihood. She is determined to own a sari-sari store in the future.

loans.use: to buy meat, vegetables, spices and cooking oil

loans.name: Gulmira

texts.ru: Гульмира, 45 лет, замужем, 3 детей. Работает поваром и техничкой в средней школе. Уже много лет также успешно занимается сельским хозяйством. На сегодняшний день у нее есть 4 коровы, 10 овец. На 1,71 Га земли выращивает люцерну. Гульмира обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS), на полученные средства она увеличит поголовье скота. Полученная прибыль от кредита позволит Гульмире и в дальнейшем развивать ее деятельность, а также отремонтировать дом.
texts.en:
Gulmira is 45 years old. She is married and has three children. She works as a cook and cleaner at a high school. For many years she has also successfully worked with agriculture. Currently she has four cows and ten sheep. She grows alfalfa on 1.71 hectares of land.

Gulmira turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS). For the money received she will increase her herd. The income form the loan will allow Gulmira to further expand her business, and also to renovate her home.

loans.use: to purchase livestock in order to increase her herd

loans.name: Baktygul

texts.ru: Бактыгул, 42 года, замужем, есть 2 детей. В поиске источника доходов для своей семьи, Бактыгул стала заниматься  животноводством, муж и дети помогают по хозяйству. Благодаря непосильному труду и емкой работе Бактыгул достигла хороших успехов в бизнесе и стала получать ежемесячную прибыль в сумме 17,900 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Бактыгул имеется 8 коров, 50 овец.  Также занимается полеводством, выращивая кукурузу в качестве корма для скота. Бактыгул обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS), который она направит на покупку 4 коров. Доходы от кредита Бактыгул планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса и накопить на капитальный ремонт дома.
texts.en:
Baktygul is 42 years old, married and has two children. In search of a source of income for her family, she started working with livestock breeding. Her husband and children help her with the business. 

Thanks to backbreaking labor and capacious work, Baktygul had great succes with her business and started to receive a monthly income of 17,900 som (KGS). Today Baktygul has eight cows and 50 on her farm. She also works with field crop cultivation, growing sweet corn as livestock feed. 

Baktygul turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 150,000 som (KGS) which she will direct to purchasing four cows. She plans to invest the income from the loan in further expanding her business. She will also save money for renovating her home.

loans.use: to purchase four cows in order to increase her herd

loans.name: Ouden

texts.en:
Ouden is a twenty year old single man, who resides in Phnom Penh city. He is a University student.

Recently, Ouden passed to go to an Internship abroad for nine months. During those months, he is going to get 10 USD per day.

Unfortunately, he does not have enough capital to prepare some important documents in order to travel abroad. Due to this, he decided to apply for a Kiva loan via VisionFund to prepare his visa, passport and his study materials to provide for efficient studying.

He hopes that this loan will help him to get more experience and pave the way to get a good job in the future.

loans.use: to prepare his travel visa, passport and study materials for efficient studying during his internship abroad.

location.town: Prey Veng province, Presh Sdach district

loans.name: Tania

texts.es:
Tania tiene 20 años, es una joven con muchos sueños y anhelos, que se esfuerza por poder ser alguien en la vida, y es por ello que estudia la carrera de derecho.
Aspira a terminar su carrera, ser una profesional y tener buen trabajo, para poder ayudar a las demás personas que necesiten ayuda.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por esta oportunidad que mejorar que esta recibiendo.
texts.en:
Tania is 20 years old. She has many dreams and desires, and is making the effort to be someone in life. This is why she is studying law.

She wants to finish her degree, to become a professional and have good work in order to help others who need help. She is asking for this loan in order to pay her school fees so she can continue studying as she has been doing.

She is grateful for this opportunity for improvement that she is receiving.

loans.use: to pay university fees

loans.name: Sangina

texts.ru: На фотографии запечатлена Сангина. Ей 32 года. Она проживает вместе с семьей в городке Куляб в Хатлонской области. У нее большая семья, состоящая из ее любимого мужа, двое детей. Дети маленькие им по 4 и 3 года. Сангина  домохозяйка, она следит за порядком дома и за детьми, и параллельно занимается шитьем женской одежды.  Она на все успевает. Сидя дома Сангина зарабатывает, и кормить детей. Она хочет расширить швейную деятельность, путем увеличить ежедневный доход.  Для совершения данной операции ей необходимо определенная сумма денег. Так как у нее не хватает денег, Сангина обратилась за кредитом. За счет кредита она купить швейную машинку. Так же на оставшуюся часть денег она потратить на покупки стройматериалов, чтобы отремонтировать дом.
texts.en: In the photograph is depicted Sangina. She is 32 years old. She lives with her family in the city of Kulob in Khatlon province. She has a large family comprising her beloved husband and two children. Her children are small: they are four and three years old. Sangina is a homemaker. She looks after the house and the children, and she sews women's clothing in parallel. She finds time to do everything. Sangina earns money and feeds her children while staying at home. She wants to expand her sewing business as a way to increase her daily income. To carry out this plan she needs a certain sum of money. Since she does not have enough money, Sangina has applied for a loan. She will buy a sewing machine with the loan. She will also spend the remaining part of the money on buying some construction materials in order to renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and to buy some construction materials to renovate her house.

loans.name: Zuhra

texts.ru: Зухра жительница Носири Хусравского района. Ей 47 лет, замужем и имеет пятерых детей. Имеет среднее образование.  Зухра уже 10 лет занимается животноводством, выращивает крупный рогатый скот.  Ее цель увеличить поголовье своих животных и доход семьи. Она  очень трудолюбивый  человек. Этой деятельности она унаследовала от своего отца. В этом деле ей помогает ее семья.  Зухра обратилась к Вам за помощью и ждет Вашу поддержку.
texts.en:
Zuhra is a resident of the region of Nosiri Khusrav. She is 47 years old, married and has five children. She has secondary education. 

Zuhra has worked with livestock breeding for 10 years already, breeding cattle. She has an aim to increase the number of livestock, and her family's income. She is a hardworking woman. She has taken over the business from her father. Her family help her with the business. 

Zuhra turns to you for help and awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Kalyikan

texts.ru: Калыйкан, 52 года, замужем, мать 2 детей. Образование среднее, в качестве источника дохода для своей семьи, Калыйкан занимается животноводством и полеводством, начав этот бизнес 19 лет назад с собственных сбережений. Благодаря упорному труду Калыйкан, ее бизнес, на сегодняшний день насчитывает 3 коровы, 13 овец. На 3,04 Га собственной земли выращивает люцерну и пшеницу для реализации. В совокупности деятельность приносит прибыль в сумме 17,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Калыйкан обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота для увеличения поголовья. Доходы от кредита Калыйкан планирует вложить в дальнейшее расширение бизнеса, ремонт дома и свадьбу старшего сына.
texts.en:
Kalyikan is 52 years old, married and the mother of two children. She has secondary education. As a source of income for her family, she works with livestock breeding and field crop cultivation, after having started this business 19 years ago with her own savings. Thanks to Kalyikan's persistent work, her farm has three cows and 13 sheep today. She grows alfalfa and wheat for selling on 3.04 hectares of own land. Combined, the business brings in an income of 17,000 som (KGS) per month. 

With an aim to further develop her loan, Kalyikan turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 150,000 som (KGS) to purchase livestock to increase her herd. She plans to use the income from the loan on further expanding her business, on renovating her home and on her eldest son's wedding.

loans.use: to purchase livestock in order to increase her herd

loans.name: Oern's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village of the Snoul district where crop farming is a common way to earn a living, Oern, 47, is married with three children.
